671979285.name: Beautiful
671979285.author: a TripAdvisor user
671979285.reviewBody: This place is beautiful, it can get very crowded though, especially on Sundays. You can swim, kayak or just sit by the lagoon, gorgeous views. \nThere are also excursions available.  There\u2019s a small entrance fee that you have to pay to get in, it\u2019s worth it.

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

671242230.name: Beautiful beach
671242230.author: a TripAdvisor user
671242230.reviewBody: Very nice spot, 35$ entry, restaurant on site... swings and hammocks for having some fun and most importantly, the clear blue water of the lake

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

669298290.name: You can\u2019t miss the stromatolites
669298290.author: a TripAdvisor user
669298290.reviewBody:
We came here planning to spend just an hour to see the stromatolites and ended up staying half of our day here.

It was a 15 minute walk from our hotel and the ticket is very cheap, 35 pesos (less than $2 USD)

From the entrance you can start falling in love with this place as you can see the turquoise color of the water right in front of you.

The stromatolites are there surrounding the place in secured areas (you’re not allowed to touch them nor getting close to them, although there’s always someone trying to get a picture next to them)

There’s a parking lot, toilets, a restaurant and a deck for small tour boats, there is also a section with hammocks and swings were people line up to get their pictures taken.

We got a boat tour offered and decided to go for it, they took us around the lagoon to see the cenotes and the pirates’ canal, it actually was the cheapest tour we found and it worth every penny.

Going to Bacalar and missing the stromatolites would be a crime considering that there are only a few places in the world where they can be found, not sure if the other places have such a nice backdrop as thus beautiful blue lagoon!

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

662120044.name: Visit for the day
662120044.author: a TripAdvisor user
662120044.reviewBody: We spend a day in Cocalitos. We aet in the restaurant inside. The food and price was good.\nWe ttok the tour to the Laguna right there, the price was better than outside and the guide tour (Mauro) was very knowledgeable about the lagoon, the rocks and what all around

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

660625263.name: Nice public beach with access to the lagoon
660625263.author: a TripAdvisor user
660625263.reviewBody: Beach is actually more a of a green lawn with direct access to the lagoon. Water is shallow so you can wade out for a few 100m. Wooden swings in the water provide a fun and relaxing way to kick back and enjoy the water. Place has a restaurant serving local dishes and beer. What more can you ask for?

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

660242297.name: Beautiful
660242297.author: a TripAdvisor user
660242297.reviewBody: What a beautiful way to spend the afternoon. At just 35peso entry (approx $2USD) this place has everything you need. Crystal clear blue water, swings and hammocks to relax on in the lake and a big cenote. Or else you can just lay on the grass and enjoy the view. Would highly recommend for a very cheap relaxing afternoon.

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

657987312.name: Don\'t miss!
657987312.author: a TripAdvisor user
657987312.reviewBody: We stopped here after seeing it from our boat tour around the Bacalar lagoon. There\'s an average restaurant next door where you can get a juice and a sandwich etc. The place is gorgeous with amazing photos possible - just make sure you are respectful to the place as there are 1000 year-old freshwater corals in the water that you are asked not to walk on (people do...)

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

646634877.name: Amazing and heart breaking
646634877.author: a TripAdvisor user
646634877.reviewBody: Such a beautiful place, it\u2019s impossible to believe it exists. And it\u2019s a bit sad to see these stromatolites that look dead because people still walk on them, although there are signs all over. \nWe came on a day the bar was not working but we just got what we needed elsewhere and it was a fantastic experience. Best swim ever.

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

643359764.name: Come see what produced most of the earth\'s breathable oxygen!
643359764.author: a TripAdvisor user
643359764.reviewBody: There are VERY few places on earth you can see living stromatolites, but Bacalar is one of them. Not only that but it\'s gorgeous. This site has a modest entry fee and can get crowded at times, but the attraction is in the water anyway! Swim, snorkel or hang out on the wooden swings in the water. Then come back in, get a beer, Guac and chips for about 5$. Can\'t be beat! A must-do once a trip.

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

642915979.name: FRAUD! This is the worst place, avoid it and comr see it by boat
642915979.author: a TripAdvisor user
642915979.reviewBody:
We saw this place from the boat tour we did the day before and came here to hang out for the day. First of all you are greeted by the monkey at the gate who only says "pagar" (pay). No hello, no good morning, nothing.

The restaurant only had two (well overpriced) dishes when we came here, so we ordered the cheaper one (a cóctel de camarones). They then brought the more expensive one anyhow, so we complained and they took it back. When they brought the bill, they put items on there we didn't order, so we complained again. And in the end they gave us 100 pesos to little in change - once can be an accident, twice can be a little dumb, but three times is just fraud. 

Avoid this place, it's poorly managed by people who clearly don't know what customer service means. It's a disgrace.

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

634981256.name: Beautiful nature with very poor service
634981256.author: a TripAdvisor user
634981256.reviewBody: We visited this place after a long drive because of so many great reviews. We were so dissapointed!\nWe ordered some food and drinks in the restaurant. It turned out that what we ordered is not available at the moment, so we chose another position from the menu and again it was not available. After few rounds we finaly placed an order because we were too tired and hungry to go somewhere else (and already payed an entrance fee). It was a mistake, the food was not good, totaly not what we expected to have in Mexico.\nNature is beautiful in this place, but the experience was devastated by much too loud music, bad food, poor service and dirty bathrooms.

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

626877268.name: Really interesting
626877268.author: a TripAdvisor user
626877268.reviewBody: Was really cool to see these! Just be careful not to touch them as they are being damaged by all the people around them.

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

624870560.name: Beautiful
624870560.author: a TripAdvisor user
624870560.reviewBody: The water here is so clear! Only getting in and out is a bit challenging as you are not supposed to touch the estromalites (the living rocks) , but you have to wiggle your way past them. But I saw a couple of people sit on them and there is no one who tells them they shouldn\'t. Hopefully this won\'t destroy these rocks.\nI went there by taxi from the main square in Bacalar and it\'s about 10-15min drive and about 35-40 pesos. At the bar you can ask to call a taxi to pick you up.

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

618165732.name: Magical
618165732.author: a TripAdvisor user
618165732.reviewBody: You can have a drink at the restaurant or lie down in the grass to enjoy the beautiful, magical 7 shades of blue in the cenote attached to the lake. Better even is to swim in it, lie down in the hammocks or swing the swings they put up in the water. I couldnt believe the beauty of it. It\u2019s just breathtaking.

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

600493983.name: Great spot on gorgeous lake
600493983.author: a TripAdvisor user
600493983.reviewBody: We stopped here because we weren\u2019t constantly hounded as we drove by. It\u2019s got cheap parking, a great little restaurant, bathrooms, hammocks and swings in the water, and lots of shade. We highly recommend the 2 hr boat tour. We definitely plan on returning in the future.

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

600489387.name: Unbelievable
600489387.author: a TripAdvisor user
600489387.reviewBody: Absolutely beautiful and laid back. Boat tour was great and the day was inexpensive. If you are traveling from the north beware of the police in Felipe Carriillo Puerta. If they see you\u2019re in a rental they will pull you over. The food, drinks and staff were all great. Cleanest lake I\u2019ve ever been to.

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

587806366.name: Beautiful
587806366.author: a TripAdvisor user
587806366.reviewBody: This place was lovely.  There were steps to get into the lake, however they were a bit slippery and I need a can to get in the water so I did not go in.  Other people in my group did and thoroughly enjoyed it.  The stramatalites  sp? were very interesting.  Worth the small entrance fee to enter the small park.

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

582374309.name: Don\'t miss it!
582374309.author: a TripAdvisor user
582374309.reviewBody: Don\'t miss this palce, it has a lovely area with hammocks and swings by the water. The 25 pesos entrance is worth it. There is big garden (where you can even camp) and a local restaurant, good shade areas and the lagoon there is amazing.

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

581952556.name: Beautiful
581952556.author: a TripAdvisor user
581952556.reviewBody: Beautiful and worth a visit to see these \'living\' rock formations.\nAlso has a great swimming area and an onsite restaurant.\nA little pricey at 25$ to enter.

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

575872877.name: A lovely bathing area.
575872877.author: a TripAdvisor user
575872877.reviewBody: Its 25 pesos to enter but worth it as it has a great swimming area and some swings for photos. There is a place to hang hammocks under shade. You can camp here for 100 pesos. Food is served with beer at the restuarant and there is plenty of parking but you pay extra for that.

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

571019790.name: Beautiful place
571019790.author: a TripAdvisor user
571019790.reviewBody: I went there to see the bacalar lagoon and I was blown away. The view is just incredible! There are swings in the water where you can seat and see the beautiful landscape. The water is super clear, super beautiful and overall it was a super experience.

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

569773600.name: Beautiful
569773600.author: a TripAdvisor user
569773600.reviewBody: This was one of the several public swimming spots we visited in Bacalar. There is an entrance fee and also a restaurant on site (did not try). It was beautiful with some swings on the side and relatively few people. Great for spending a couple of hours to enjoy the water.

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

567966009.name: So happy we found Cocalitos!
567966009.author: a TripAdvisor user
567966009.reviewBody: We love to swim in fresh water,  and the estromatolitos made it so amazing. It was a windy day in Majahual so we took a drive to Bacalar for the lake of 7 colors. We usually just swim off the pier at the park. Cocalitos was nicer because they let you bring a cooler, picnic or drinks. You can sunbathe on the grass, or rent a table under a palapa. They also have a restaurant if you choose to get some refreshments. It was  25 pesos for admission to the site. I hope people respect the wonder of the living rocks and do not stand or climb on them. Skip the sunscreen and wear a t-shirt instead. This natural wonder needs to be protected and not become ruined from tourism.

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

564873697.name: Nice place
564873697.author: a TripAdvisor user
564873697.reviewBody: it is a nice place to go with family \nthe only think I did not like is why they have the entrance to the lagoon near of the stromatolites, people are drunk or don\'t know thay are special and touch them .... that annoys me.  Why they dont change the entrance?

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

559043138.name: Stromatolites ...Amazing!
559043138.author: a TripAdvisor user
559043138.reviewBody: Cocalitos is a small park on Lake Bacalar. There is a restaurant or you can bring a picnic lunch. There is a small fee to enter the park. The most amazing part is the stromatolites. I had never heard of these "living rocks" before. There are very few places in the world that these rocks can be seen, so if you are in Bacalar take a trip to Cocalitos to view them.

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

558459991.name: Very cool
558459991.author: a TripAdvisor user
558459991.reviewBody: This place is very hip and cute, with swings in the water and totally made for great pictures. We came on on of the hire boats so got to see lots. The boat was $1500 pesos for two hours and their was 8 of us in total so great price for the boat.

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

541020397.name: Good food Nice Location
541020397.author: a TripAdvisor user
541020397.reviewBody: Nice little restaurant right on the lake,, easy to get to once you know where to look, not a huge menu but food was good, fish needed to be cooked a bit more  friendly staff, like everywhere in MX  music was way too loud

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

538759115.name: Unique
538759115.author: a TripAdvisor user
538759115.reviewBody: Well, they aare one of the oldest way of life in the world! A must see if you are visiting the lagoon!

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

511933560.name: Great Family Place
511933560.author: a TripAdvisor user
511933560.reviewBody: My daughter and I visited here intending to stay just for the morning but ended up staying the entire day.  The water was clean, clear, and beautiful of course. Lots of families having fun together, so the atmosphere was really nice. Maybe we just got lucky, but we left our stuff on the waters and while we went out swimming etc. and nobody bothered it. There is a restaurant, but most people are bringing their own coolers and picnics. We paid 40 pesos for a taxi from town and when we were ready to leave they called another one for us.  We rented a kayak for 100 pesos an hour. Bring a towel to cover your legs, it\'s hot!

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

495185344.name: Beautiful!
495185344.author: a TripAdvisor user
495185344.reviewBody: This is a beautiful place to visit.. you can swim across the cenote (quarry) and see all the way to the bottom.. see fish and other nature. Stay at El Rancho Encantado if you are in this area... beautiful Lagoon!

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

485427972.name: Nice area, not really an attraction
485427972.author: a TripAdvisor user
485427972.reviewBody: It was cool to see these rocks but not really worth going to, however I would stop if I was on my way somewhere else

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

481027106.name: Beautiful place!
481027106.author: a TripAdvisor user
481027106.reviewBody: This place was like paradise! The cost to heaven is 25 pesos and you can stay as long as you want and bring your own food. They have big tables and a small place to buy snack. They are 2 showers too. Enjoy :)

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

477697180.name: cool place
477697180.author: a TripAdvisor user
477697180.reviewBody: perfect watter, you can stay in the shadow or on the beach, you can rent kayak here (100 pesos per hour). There is also bar/restaurant. The entry is 25 pesos per day

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

473492923.name: Do not miss this place!
473492923.author: a TripAdvisor user
473492923.reviewBody: A lot of the lake side around Bacalar has been sold and is now inaccessible to the public. A walk or cycle ride from town, before you get to the cenote azule, Cocalitos is a beautiful spot to relax and look at the scenery.  Google stromatolites before you go !\nAt 25 pesos it is a bargain, take a picnic or use the small bar/ restaurant. I hope you find this review helpful. Happy Travels.

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

466136395.name: Hidden gem
466136395.author: a TripAdvisor user
466136395.reviewBody: Such a cool little beach.  Costs 25 pesos to access the beach however well worth it.  There is a small serving area where you can get a cold beverage and soak up the colors of the lake.  There\'s a cute wooden swing set right out in the water.  Happily spent the afternoon playing in the water and soaking up the sun.

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

465344991.name: very nice place to spend a day with friends or family
465344991.author: a TripAdvisor user
465344991.reviewBody:
One of the most beautiful spots in la laguna de bacalar, home of the Stromatolite 

cover of 25 pesos per person but u can take your own food, or cooking it right there! 
(sadly not so many places in bacalar allow this now) so dont miss it!!!

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

461859538.name: Gorgeous
461859538.author: a TripAdvisor user
461859538.reviewBody: One of the few places where you can easily access the waterfront at Lake Bacalar. Unfortunately, this beautiful lagoon is lined with private properties and hotels, so access to the lake is pretty restricted to a few public beaches. This place, for an entrance of only 25 pesos is definitely worth it. Not only is it a beautiful place for a swim and a relaxing time under the palm trees, it\'s also unique in its biodiversity.

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

454065620.name: Beautiful!
454065620.author: a TripAdvisor user
454065620.reviewBody: The amount of history in this water us mind blowing. The colours are stunning and the water is cool and clear for miles. Ive been swimming all over Mexico and had an amazing day here one of the best!

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

444930056.name: Worth the detour
444930056.author: a TripAdvisor user
444930056.reviewBody: If you\'re familiar with the lake at all you\'ll find it very cool.  But I don\'t know how you kill much more than 20 minutes looking around.  Somehow the restaurant did not inspire me to eat there.  \nLike all of Lake Bacalar very beautiful and pristine

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

424223804.name: Incredible
424223804.author: a TripAdvisor user
424223804.reviewBody: The place is invredible! It is a nature\'s art where you can see some stromatolites, which are prehistoric creatures. Camping allows you to place your hammock or tent and spend a nice evening with your family. It is also the entry site published for Cenote Cocalitos which adjoins just 20 meters from the lagoon.

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

422631899.name: The location is beautiful but only good for camping.
422631899.author: a TripAdvisor user
422631899.reviewBody: Nice to visit and take good photos of the lagoon. Perfect for little children because it quite shallow.

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

418835574.name: Cool if you like stromatolites
418835574.author: a TripAdvisor user
418835574.reviewBody: Beautiful water, very comfortable temperatures for swimming.  I would say only notable if you\'re interested in the stromatolite formations for their uniqueness or your own biological interest.

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

381265482.name: Cool stromatolites. Good swimming and kayak hire.
381265482.author: a TripAdvisor user
381265482.reviewBody: In the context of beautiful Lake Bacalar we could hardly have had a bad time. The Stromatolites were something a bit special though. We had a lovely time swimming and kayaking before we sadly got rained off. In different weather we could have stayed a lot longer.

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

350683384.name: beautiful place
350683384.author: a TripAdvisor user
350683384.reviewBody: You can\'t  miss this place,coca lites are something unique on our planet and la se\u00f1ora cook and awesome frijoles.My girlfriend lost her flipflop there few days ago in a small hole close to the cocalitos  and they planted in her honour two new young palm trees,(Sara palms)definitely worth it!

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

350494561.name: Different style; nature and camping
350494561.author: a TripAdvisor user
350494561.reviewBody: It is not my type of place but it was good to have a nice shrimp cocktail here. The place is more for camping and enjoying the "cenote" (deep cave of sweet water). The place is a big garden in which a you can camp with friends and enjoy the view of the lagoon and admire the "estromatolitos" living rocks.

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

282647958.name: Dont miss it
282647958.author: a TripAdvisor user
282647958.reviewBody: Amazing beach. Must visit it before you die. You wont regret it... a cenote, amazing beach, clear water and a peaceful retreat all in one place.

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

258099592.name: Take Amir\'s launch tour
258099592.author: a TripAdvisor user
258099592.reviewBody: Brilliant 3 hour motor launch tour of beautiful Laguna de Bacalar. Pirates channel, natural spa, centres and floating down the stream of stromatolites - oldest living thing on Earth! All with charming Amir, his cool sounds and free cervezas. Not to mention the warming nip of tequila after all that swimming and snorkelling. \n\n

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

223434593.name: Bacalar on Laguna Bacalar (Bacalar Lagoon)
223434593.author: a TripAdvisor user
223434593.reviewBody:
Bacalar on Laguna Bacalar (Bacalar Lagoon)
This town is an old Spanish settlement here before Chetumal and now is a little local resort; with an old fort in the heart of town called “Foerte de San Felipe Bacalar”. 
Bacalar as it turns out is quite a nice little town located just north of the Belize border on Hwy 307 between Chetumal and Cozumel, Mexico. It has everything you need; ATM, hospital, bars, restaurants, street vendors, souvenir shops, one campground that is right on the lake, hostels, hotels all on a great seven color lagoon. The lagoon is big enough for motorboats, water-skiers, jet-skies, sightseeing watercraft's, sailboats and much more.
This fresh water lagoon is known as “Las Lagunas de Siete Colores” (The Lagoon of 7 Colors) and is landlocked. It is very shallow with a light reflecting bottom that changes colors depending upon time of day and lighting conditions. It is an excellent place to swim and camp. 
The water is beautiful, clear and with colors changing from white to the deepest blue. At this location there are special live formations called Stromatoites that date back some 3,500,000 years. At night the moonlight prances on the water like thousands of fireflies were dancing on it. An added bonus is right now there are not many mosquitoes or other biting insects to spoil the night’s enjoyment. 
Cenote Azul (Blue Sinkhole) is separated from Laguna Bacalar only by a narrow strip of land but entirely different and reported to be more than 175 feet (57 meters) deep. For M$10 you can access this great swimming hole through the restaurant. Spending a hot sunny day in a cool deep blue sinkhole is great way to spend time and have a bite to eat.
Sinkholes here are caves of soft limestone that collapsed and exposed the freshwater rivers within. There are more that 6000 of them and are unique to the Yucatan peninsula; the freshwater within is considered to be sacred waters. The Mayans thought that the underground rivers and streams that are found in these cenotes are gateways to Xibalba or the underworld. Another theory is that some 65 million years ago the Chicxulub meteor impacted the area and a huge proliferation beginning at a radius of more than 100km (62 miles), but looking at a map the cenotes are not in that area. This meteor is the one that is thought to be the start of the ice age and causing the extinction of the dinosaurs. 
My first plan was to stay for just a few days then head on up to Cozumel where I had planned to sell my two scuba tanks and maybe a wetsuit to one of the dive shops. That would have given me some extra cash then I could afford to snorkel with the whale sharks ($150US) and do a few other things, but that has fallen flat. Now I am planning where to go next. 
The Balneario Cocalitos Campground is $7.50US per night for me; it is lovely and right on the lake.

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

169746163.name: Excellent Campground right on the shore.
169746163.author: a TripAdvisor user
169746163.reviewBody: This campground has showers and bathrooms.  It is also easily accessible from the paved Costera road.  Lots of flat grassy areas for your tent or to park your RV on.  The lake is right there with shallows to play in for the kids and then the deep for adults to swim in.  Owned by a nice old Mayan man and woman who have been there for decades.

address.streetAddress: Av costera a tan solo 5 minutos del Cenote Azul

667669467.name: Spend a great day
667669467.author: a TripAdvisor user
667669467.reviewBody: This is a lovely out of the way spot to go swimming and have a bite to eat.  The water is beautiful and the food is great.  We walked to it but it is quite a ways so one may choose to taxi (cheap) or rent a bike.  Well worth the visit!!

661488389.name: Nice swimm
661488389.author: a TripAdvisor user
661488389.reviewBody: A bit out of the way, we took a taxi from the main plaza. 50 pesos. The entry is 25 pesos pp to get in the restaurant who has the monopoly ( that\u2019s why I took a star off) good food in the restaurant, a bit more expensive. Access to the Cenote is good , it is straight away very deep, a few fish on the side but nothing exciting. However very nice natural environment to relax, swimm, enjoy life

658431984.name: Underwhelming
658431984.author: a TripAdvisor user
658431984.reviewBody: Our hotelier told us this was a must do for a short visit to Bacalar. He said to go early, it opens at 10am, and have a swim and breakfast. We did just that. Visually it looked like a small lake and not like a Cenote. The food and service was good.

657763525.name: Wonderful Cenote!
657763525.author: a TripAdvisor user
657763525.reviewBody:
Great place for a rainy or windy morning, or any time when Laguna Bacalar does not beckon you.

Wide (200 metres), and deep (90 metres), this giant cenote has amazing water (like swimming in rainwater), and lots of lush greenery around it.

They also have a large restaurant, great for drinks or basic food.

A fun place to visit, don't miss it!

656015751.name: A must do !
656015751.author: a TripAdvisor user
656015751.reviewBody: If you plan to visit this incredible lagoon don\'t miss the cenote azul ! I recommend you to discover it on the morning (very quiet) and just ... enjoy !

653466633.name: Cenote azul Bacalar
653466633.author: a TripAdvisor user
653466633.reviewBody: Blue cenote 50 meters from the coastal Bacalar, is a restaurant with access to the cenote, there are rental of floating vests and the cost of entry is $ 25 MXN. It is 100 meters deep and the water is very refreshing, if you visit Bacalar you can take an hour to get to know this place.

653253029.name: Paradise Lost
653253029.author: a TripAdvisor user
653253029.reviewBody: I\'m sure this cenote was gorgeous years ago. But we went there on a calm, sunny day, when the water should be at its cleanest and clearest, and it was not clean and clear. There was suspended material clearly visible in the water, which shouldn\'t be there. I\'ve been to lots of cenotes and they weren\'t like this. It\'s apparent that all the waste water from the restaurant (kitchen, dishwashing, toilets, and runoff) are going into the cenote and spoiling it. Pretty sad.

648956228.name: Enjoyable Swimming with Restaurant
648956228.author: a TripAdvisor user
648956228.reviewBody: Because the Yucatan peninsula is made of limestone which is very porous, most of the surface water is fed from underground, creating lakes, lagoons and wetlands. Cenote Azul is like a small lake adjacent to, connected underground to Laguna Bacalar. The water that fills  Cenote Azul may be high in magnesium and other minerals coming from below. Its deep cool, clean water is enjoyable; as it is deep without shallow edges, good swimming skills required. I have several friends who go there to swim laps across the cenote to train for swimming events. There is a small entry fee (currently 10 pesos per person).\nRestaurant Eco Tur\u00edstico Cenote Azul with traditional food, is at the swimming area, making it an easy place to have a family or friends get together.

645807861.name: Sewage leaks
645807861.author: a TripAdvisor user
645807861.reviewBody: Overall in Bacalar they have issues with the sewage, but in this place it was raining and the sewage literally was overflowing leaking everything into the cenote. It was so sad and disgusting

644184023.name: My favourite Cenote in Bacalar
644184023.author: a TripAdvisor user
644184023.reviewBody: My favourite Cenote in Bacalar, it might be a bit separated from the main lagoon but the sight of it is gorgeous!

624578275.name: Nice place
624578275.author: a TripAdvisor user
624578275.reviewBody: It\'s a nice Cenote, but I\'ve seen more beautiful Cenotes in Mexico, so if you have time- it\'s recommended to rent a car and visit some other cenotes.\nDon\'t forget to take a towel with you!

623899369.name: Ok
623899369.author: a TripAdvisor user
623899369.reviewBody: Of all the cenotes we\'ve been to, we were a bit disappointed by this one. The water wasnt clear, it\'s more like a small lake... we were all ready with our swim gear and towels and when we arrived we werent that impressed so we actually left again. I\'m not sure if it was the weather being overcast not showing it off in its best light, but anyway, I think there are much better cenotes to visit than this one.

619101492.name: Silky soft water
619101492.author: a TripAdvisor user
619101492.reviewBody: The water has a quality that is somehow unique. The temperature is about the same as the body temperature and it feels silky soft. \nIt\u2019s 90 metres deep. Find the spot where the tree branches go into the water so you have a nice place to sit in the water. It\u2019s a lovely and memorable experience.

589250475.name: Natural beauty
589250475.author: a TripAdvisor user
589250475.reviewBody: Most this be the place you visit first when you get to the region? Possibly not. As one of the largest cenotes in the region, it is tempting to fall for the great urge to go an visit. I would suggest take a walk down the lagoon first, and if you have some time, do come here. There is a fee to enter, which allow you to not only see the cenote, but also to have a shower and use the changing rooms. It\u2019s a bit far off, but we managed to walk there from the hostal we were staying. There is a restaurant in the premises, so guess one can have a day out there, but I can assure you that there are others spots near by, that will satisfy even the hardest to please.

589074083.name: Nice visiting this place
589074083.author: a TripAdvisor user
589074083.reviewBody: Real relaxing area to swim. It is very secure and swimmers may get life vest. There are security ropes etc for visitors to hold unto. Lots of visitors come here. For a small fee you can enter to enjoy this beauty.

588989078.name: Nice treat!
588989078.author: a TripAdvisor user
588989078.reviewBody: It was a stop as part of a lake excursion, we had the area all to ourselves, it was pretty pleasant and refreshing.\nIt\'s a nice experience to see the contrast from the lake to the cenote and swim in it.\nWorth a visit and a dip in it!

582256022.name: Loved it !
582256022.author: a TripAdvisor user
582256022.reviewBody: Nice place for spending the day, its beautiful, the cenote azul is really blue deep, just be careful

582220434.name: Amazing
582220434.author: a TripAdvisor user
582220434.reviewBody: My favourite of Bacalar\'s cenotes. Crystal clear water, you can swim between, under and over the tree roots. It even has areas that are like your own private pool.

581744754.name: A brief Visit
581744754.author: a TripAdvisor user
581744754.reviewBody: This is a large Cenote on the outskirts of Bacalar set in the jungle. When we visited it was very quiet, it is possible to to swim but there is no shallow area and as it is 90 metres deep you need to be a very strong swimmer or hire a life vest.\n\nThe restaurant is ok for snacks or a drink but there are much better options all around the leake.

575873626.name: Nice place but the lake is better
575873626.author: a TripAdvisor user
575873626.reviewBody: You pay 25 pesos entry which is fine but to be honest the lake swimming is nicer. The restuarant is overpriced but the food is o.k. They hire lifejackets here as there is no shallow area, it just plunges down to 90 metres deep so not for weak swimmers.

571135808.name: really nice swimming
571135808.author: a TripAdvisor user
571135808.reviewBody: It was really nice to swim in this cenote, beautiful clear water and you can rent a life vest if you don\u2019t know how to swim. It was a nice experience.

568475629.name: Beautiful Cenote Close to Town
568475629.author: a TripAdvisor user
568475629.reviewBody: The Cenote Azul is right on the edge of town, but it is so peaceful that you feel like you are in the middle of nowhere.  The water is crystal clear and cool.  The onsite restaurant is adequate for snacks and drinks - there are much better food options in town.  Overall, a must see in Bacalar!

565252542.name: Superb cenote, mediocre restaurant
565252542.author: a TripAdvisor user
565252542.reviewBody: The cenote itself is stunning, though you need to walk through a restaurant to get to the concrete "beach".

561804022.name: Total Mexican experience
561804022.author: a TripAdvisor user
561804022.reviewBody: Great swimming, great cenote, excellent lakeside restaurant. Lots of locals enjoying the same food and swimming experience. It\'s the king of cenotes in the Lake Bacalar region.

557600960.name: beautiful but service not up to what it should be.
557600960.author: a TripAdvisor user
557600960.reviewBody: this is a nice spot, however the service is lacking in professionalism. You sit down and have to wave the waiters few times to get their attention even though the restaurant was empty

557446080.name: The best swimming imaginable
557446080.author: a TripAdvisor user
557446080.reviewBody: This may be the best swimming hole in the world, it is a gorgeous blue cenote that is about ! km around the outside.  It is calm because the trees around the outer edge provide a buffer against winds, so the water is calm and wonderful.  It is is hot outside is feels refreshingly cook, and if it is cool, it feels warm when you jump in.  Friendly restaurant on the premises with waiters who have been there for years.  Good fresh juices and breakfasts.  Opens at 10am and closes in the afternoon, not sure exactly when.

557180238.name: Beautiful swimming and dining location
557180238.author: a TripAdvisor user
557180238.reviewBody: We enjoyed nice swims and meal here while we stayed in Bacalar. You must visit if you\'re in the area.

556561195.name: A great place to spend a few hours
556561195.author: a TripAdvisor user
556561195.reviewBody: We visited Cenote Azul as part of our one-day excursion to Bacalar. Unfortunately, I lost my iPhone at this location due to a faulty product....but the time we did spend in the cenote was peaceful and relaxing. I would love to go back and explore it again as the service was great and the water was warm.

551627283.name: Worth it
551627283.author: a TripAdvisor user
551627283.reviewBody: Fantastic cristal clear cenote with adjacent restaurant. We spent a few hours at the cenote and were most of the time swimming in the clear and warm water. If you are around you must go there

550946917.name: nice little gem - great for family with kids
550946917.author: a TripAdvisor user
550946917.reviewBody: The cenote is a bit hard to find unless you are using google map and paying attention. You can rent snorkeling gears/ life jackets where you pay the entrance fee. If you have teenages/ adults who can swim, there is no need to rent life jackets as the water is shallow (you can stand up in most places.) Water shoes would be a nice to have as it can get slippery and rocks are hard on the foot. Lots of fresh water fish in the cenote to see  - water temperature is fairly warm. Go there first thing in the morning - the cenote can get crowded around noon even during weekdays.

548743013.name: It doesn\'t look like much from the outside, but ...
548743013.author: a TripAdvisor user
548743013.reviewBody: Inside is an incredible cenote, fresh, blue water and a place to eat and drink with friends after swimming.

546793534.name: Lovely swimming, food quite average
546793534.author: a TripAdvisor user
546793534.reviewBody:
This cenote is open to the sky and completely surrounded by a ring of trees and vegetation. The water is clear and deep and delightful for swimming. One pays a fee and enters through the restaurant to access it. Bring your own towel.
Swimming is lovely, and in December, at least, the water is significantly warmer than that of Bacalar Lagoon.
Changing rooms, showers, and toilets are at the back of the restaurant. Be aware the floor gets nasty if more than a few swimmers are there, so bring flip flops or some such.
The fruit water drinks are good, the food is average and predictable. Wifi is good and the restaurant is a pleasant place to enjoy looking out over the cenote from even if you don't swim.

546724769.name: Magnificent swimming, adequate food and drink
546724769.author: a TripAdvisor user
546724769.reviewBody: Slightly touristy, but the water is grand for swimming. The restrooms and showers can get a bit wet under foot when there are a lot of people, so bring flip flops or some such. Food is average, service is mediocre, but the cenote is first rate.

541020770.name: Soooo Blue!
541020770.author: a TripAdvisor user
541020770.reviewBody: Nice and quiet lake with 3 large cenotes, take a tour of all three or explore on your own, you must get out on the water and spend all day there

650355210.name: Cool but a bit scary
650355210.author: a TripAdvisor user
650355210.reviewBody: I\u2019m not a great swimmer and the water felt great I was just little scared because you can\u2019t see down. Of course you know that when you get into the water. Still very pretty area.

645808983.name: Visit through boat
645808983.author: a TripAdvisor user
645808983.reviewBody: It is a small place where it is better to visit through a tour because you get to see all of the edge of the cenote by accesing through the lagoon.\n\nSometimes there is an entrance where they charge but the dock is very, very, veeeery small and not safe (nails were popping).

641150294.name: Excellent private ranch....unfortunately no longer open.
641150294.author: a TripAdvisor user
641150294.reviewBody: This was one of my favorite places to stop on the trip from Playa del Carmen to Belize. Located on a beautiful parcel of property that runs from highway to the Bacalar lake creeks that flow from Xul Ha to Bacalar Chico. Great food, nice swimming pool, and excellent horseback riding.\n\nMaybe it will re-open some day.

address.streetAddress: Lake Bacalar, Xul Ha on the Federal Highway 307, 10 minutes south of Bacalar

457844529.name: One of a kind paradise.
457844529.author: a TripAdvisor user
457844529.reviewBody: We couldn\'t help ourselves from returning to this great roadside ranch several times on our travels through the Riviera Maya. Everything about this place in one word, "impeccable". It is spotlessly clean and the grounds are some of the most beautiful we have experienced. Along with the friendly staff they offer local cuisine and a great little bar to relax in the evening. Laguna Xulha, adjacent to Laguna Bacalar is sweet clear water with beautiful little fish to enjoy a swim with or if you prefer the pool is spectacular. There are accommodations for every budget, from the cute little cabanas with one or two beds to fully furnished ranch houses complete with all the accessories. Sitting on the patio watching the ranch hands with the horses was a true treat every morning and evening, the pride they take in these beautiful animals is truly inspiring. Although we didn\'t have time to take a guided ride through the surrounding area we have a great reason (as if one was needed) to return and experience everything Num Ka\'an Ranch has to offer. Many thanks to all the staff, we can\'t wait to see you all again soon!

address.streetAddress: Lake Bacalar, Xul Ha on the Federal Highway 307, 10 minutes south of Bacalar

224851862.name: lovely place for the day or a weekend.
224851862.author: a TripAdvisor user
224851862.reviewBody: we stopped by here after the swimming competition in Bacalar as my girls LOVE horses (and are in a Hipico here at home).  the owner was SO nice as were all the horsemen.  we thought we might just spend a couple hours here on our way home but had such a lovely time we spent the entire afternoon.  we are now planning to go down for a weekend since we had so much fun the first time.  great for a few hours or the whole weekend!

address.streetAddress: Lake Bacalar, Xul Ha on the Federal Highway 307, 10 minutes south of Bacalar

210579871.name: Unique, Tranquil, yet Diverse with Activity!!
210579871.author: a TripAdvisor user
210579871.reviewBody: Just before you get to the main town of Bacalar, Num Ka\'an Ranch is just off the main road on the right heading North. Immediately you notice the corral of beautiful horses next to a beautiful pool surrounded by tables the restaurant serves. We settled in poolside and enjoyed the best botanas around, outrageously delicious BBQ Ribs, excellent fresh juices & VERY cold beer. Obviously family oriented and away from the over crowded touristy area of Bacalar, the place filled up with families celebrating Fathers Day. The horses got their fair share of attention as folks took trail rides or 20 mins of riding around the corral at very reasonable prices. There are accommodations for travelers to stay over night, a week a month, whatever fits their travel needs. The bathrooms were spotless (a big pet peeve of mine). The property stretches all the way to the beautiful Bacalar Lagoon where water sports are available to be enjoyed. The pool was pristine and multi level so even the small tots could enjoy the pool. As a day trip or a week vacation I HIGHLY recommend Num Ka\'an Ranch. The owners deliver the best hospitality around!!!!!

address.streetAddress: Lake Bacalar, Xul Ha on the Federal Highway 307, 10 minutes south of Bacalar

161336523.name: A MUST - VISIT when in the Bacalar/Xul Ha area!
161336523.author: a TripAdvisor user
161336523.reviewBody:
This family-owned, family-run cowboy ranch I think is a must see in the area. Owners are real-life American ranch people, Jeff and Brenda Deval, and they bring their love of horses, the ranch life, paradise living, organic farming to their beautiful huge property that starts on the main highway entering Xul Ha from the north and extends down the tropical escarpment to the shores of Lake Bacalar.
We went for a trail ride, and after a fun romp around the corral, which made me feel like I was a cowgirl on a movie set, we started our trail ride. We learned a lot about medicinal plants and local stories as we walked through the tropical jungle foliage on a well-groomed trail and enjoyed the breathtaking vista of one of the most private tropical paradises I have ever seen when we reached the dock and aquamarine waters of the "Lake of Seven Colors"!
The swim was refreshing as the horses grazed in the shade of the palm trees.
We returned to the ranch and had some of the finest BBQ meat I have ever tasted. Brenda makes desserts and pies to die for.
We swam in the huge pool as the sun set. 
We lucked out that night and some expat local musicians arrived with guitars and jammed with Jeff.
They have really nice places to stay there, but we were there for the day only. 
I highly recommend this place as a stop along the Costa Maya.

address.streetAddress: Lake Bacalar, Xul Ha on the Federal Highway 307, 10 minutes south of Bacalar

674177367.name: Fort at lake bacalar
674177367.author: a TripAdvisor user
674177367.reviewBody: Very nice place with excellent views of lagoon. Sit and have a coffee and watch the sunrise or sunset over the jungle

673109971.name: Fantastic Photo Opportunities - GPS Coordinates / Hours
673109971.author: a TripAdvisor user
673109971.reviewBody:
Interesting little Fort with a lot of History in downtown Bacalar.  
Open:  9:00 a.m. - 7:00 p.m. every day except Monday.
Purchase tickets at a small ticket booth across from the entrance to the Fort. 
This is a small site, however the views are stunning.  Inside the main building of the Fort is a small museum depicting the history of the area.  A good read and visual.  From the top of the Fort you can see the Bacalar Lake / Lagoon of 7 Colours and in the distance the Canal de los Piratas.  Take your time and enjoy an easy stroll through this lovely little Fort with a lot of history.

GPS:  TicketBooth:  N 18 40.645  W 88 23.309

667668727.name: Interesting history
667668727.author: a TripAdvisor user
667668727.reviewBody: This was not a huge attraction but the history is very interesting and contributed to our enjoyment of our stay.

666155148.name: Nice view over the lagoon
666155148.author: a TripAdvisor user
666155148.reviewBody: The Fuerte is small but worth a visit. The view over the lagoon is beautiful- you can see until the canal de los piratas. \nThere is a tiny museum inside with the history of the place and the pirates. \nAs there is not much else to see in the city of Bacalar the fortress is a nice place to see.

666153506.name: Nice to see but not amazing
666153506.author: a TripAdvisor user
666153506.reviewBody: Didn\'t go inside.  Person selling tickets was not cheerful.  Didn\'t have change was 200 pesos for 2 people and I only had 500.  So I didn\'t go.  Was to unimpressed to go find my own change

662441561.name: This Fuerte is Interesting
662441561.author: a TripAdvisor user
662441561.reviewBody:
Fuerte de San Felips is interesting. We made ur second visit there in February 2019. The fort is interesting with a great view of Bacalar Lake. Inside the main building there is a
well done exhibit and an outstanding mural. The restaurant down the hill from the fort is
very good. As Mexican residents we have a Mexican senior's card so it was gratis for us.
I am not sure if the cost is reasonable or not.

661511980.name: Really good visit
661511980.author: a TripAdvisor user
661511980.reviewBody: While the fort itself is not as amazing as all the other remains around Mexico, the stories in English in the main room makes it really interesting and worthwhile to understand the story of Bacalar and Mexico as well. The descriptions are well done and clear. Something you don\u2019t always find on the maya temple. Highly recommended for a small entry price of 105 pesos pp

659370288.name: Another great piece of history
659370288.author: a TripAdvisor user
659370288.reviewBody: If you are in the area visiting the lagoon or cenotes, be sure and stop in to San Felipe. The entry fee is low and the views are fantastic.

658673375.name: History of bacalar
658673375.author: a TripAdvisor user
658673375.reviewBody: San Felipe is the mos attractive of the area. It is a price adults 5 USD and child 3 USD. It is worth it to go in. It is small but a lot of history. Don\'t for get to do it. Don\'t for get the hat and the sun block it can get really hot. Take you camara  for the pictures. You will love it.

658159257.name: Small but informative
658159257.author: a TripAdvisor user
658159257.reviewBody: We liked the views from the fort. Signs asking guests not to climb on the edges could be better located. The museum is informative. We liked the curation and the texts.

653465884.name: Fuerte de bacalar
653465884.author: a TripAdvisor user
653465884.reviewBody: The Castle of Bacalar, as it is also known, is located next to the Laguna de los Siete Colores, where it has witnessed the story of Mayans, Spaniards and pirates from all over the world.\nThe entrance cost is 100 mxn for foreign tourism; 50, national and 25 mxn children; with a teacher, student or INAPAM credential, the price is 25 mxn.

645808179.name: Nice place but too small
645808179.author: a TripAdvisor user
645808179.reviewBody: It is the only \'museum\' in town with a lovely view, but it is tiny and poorly organized inside which is hard to do considering how small it is.

645626595.name: Quaint museum sharing the history in old Fort
645626595.author: a TripAdvisor user
645626595.reviewBody: What a great little museum. A must visit when in Bacalar to learn the history of the town and the pirates. :)

642104315.name: Fight against pirates
642104315.author: a TripAdvisor user
642104315.reviewBody: This fuerte is established to fight against pirates.\nI\u2019m not sure how important in the history.\nBut you can enjoy the lagoon view from the tower of fuerte.

641692448.name: Nice (and quick) to see
641692448.author: a TripAdvisor user
641692448.reviewBody:
When you are visiting Bacalar Lake, a tour to he Fort worth the visit.
Emtance is cheap, and the place it is very well maintained. 
View is also beautiful on the Laguna 
and there is a small museum showing more about the fascinating history of this remote part of the Yucatan peninsula.

637854096.name: Great views of the lake
637854096.author: a TripAdvisor user
637854096.reviewBody: Overlooking the lake, next to the main square, pleasant surprise to discover it while exploring Bacalar

632778218.name: Nothing special
632778218.author: a TripAdvisor user
632778218.reviewBody: Nice to see this place from outside, but in general nothing special. \nIt is in the center of Bacalar and not many people around.

632636400.name: Something to do
632636400.author: a TripAdvisor user
632636400.reviewBody: Stopped by when walking around the area .\nThere is a fee if you want to go on the top and walk around

624212595.name: Not worth it
624212595.author: a TripAdvisor user
624212595.reviewBody: Is 100 pesos for the entrance and inside you have a 2 minutes walk only. The same you see from outside you see it inside so don\'t pay to see this.

623897942.name: Interesting for pirate history
623897942.author: a TripAdvisor user
623897942.reviewBody: We stopped off here for an hour whilst we were in Bacalar. It\'s got an interesting museum which shows off the pirate history of the area. The fort itself is pretty small but worth seeing and has some beautiful views of the lagoon. Worth stopping off at for a while if you\'re in the area.

618219920.name: Small but really interesting
618219920.author: a TripAdvisor user
618219920.reviewBody: The visit it\'s mandatory\u201a if you want to know some of the place history. It will take little less than an hour to get around all the facts that give magic to Bacalar. The view form the top it\'s beautiful\u201a and the indigenous\u201a the spanish and Pirate\'s stories you read there\u201a will make you want to explore a bit more.

601965975.name: Furete de San Felipe: Bacalar, Mexico
601965975.author: a TripAdvisor user
601965975.reviewBody: The Fuerte de San Felipe is a must see when I\u2019m Bacalar, Mexico! It is extravagantly built wth the deep mot surrounding. This is an excellent look into the past of the Caste wars the took place in the surrounding areas with the actual Pirates of the Caribbean (not the movies, LOL)!! There are several canons and ramparts all in perfect condition and in place for all to see, amazing!! THE BEST VIEW OF THE SEVERN COLORS LAGOON AND PIRATES CHANNEL (where the pirates came in from the Caribbean) IS UP ON THE UPPER RIGHT HAND CORNER OF THR FORT!! BEST PHOTO OP!! Also the museum attached to the fort has amazing exhibits with lots of preserved artifacts from the time even a pirate skeleton found while excavating the area. This is a must see for anyone traveling to the Bacalar Mexico area!! I am so sorry the actual photos of the fort would not upload

600490387.name: View of Lake
600490387.author: a TripAdvisor user
600490387.reviewBody: Great vantage point to take pictures of lake. Quaint town square as well. The fort offers a great historical journey of the town and region as well as just feel of the place. The pirate history is also a great point of intrigue for your kids

599370279.name: Great pirate-themed museum
599370279.author: a TripAdvisor user
599370279.reviewBody: Really well maintained fort with a lovely museum which had lots of information on pirates which my daughters loved.

595686615.name: Spanish Fort
595686615.author: a TripAdvisor user
595686615.reviewBody: Interesting location of the Spanish Fort. It over looks the lagoon on a hill. lots of iguanas all over the place. It has an interesting museum also.

595301381.name: Interesting historical facts!
595301381.author: a TripAdvisor user
595301381.reviewBody: The fort itself is very basic, not much to explore but the views are beautiful of the Bacalar lagoon! Inside the main building you will see artifacts from the early seventeen century with historical facts about this ancient fort. Very interesting!

589513459.name: Too expensive...
589513459.author: a TripAdvisor user
589513459.reviewBody: My husband wanted to go inside to check out the view of the like from a higher location. When we attempted this it turns out you need a ticket ($5 usd). The place is small, literally just one building. Not worth it in our opinion as a family of 6. We can eat for $15 but can\'t see a building for less than $30?

587215429.name: A Beautiful Historical Structure
587215429.author: a TripAdvisor user
587215429.reviewBody: This Spanish Fort was very beautiful and it overlooks this beautiful lake that has a array of colors you can just picture how it looks in the days when The fort was active and was repelling Pirates if you have time to travel south to bacalar this would be a great trip for the whole family

584173959.name: Visit to Historic site
584173959.author: a TripAdvisor user
584173959.reviewBody: Learn about Bacalar history and enjoy site views. We had the opportunity to attend a film festival from Cineteca Nacional and watch a great documental under the stars.

581741318.name: Worth a visit for the views alone, how can 100 peso be considered expensive !!!
581741318.author: a TripAdvisor user
581741318.reviewBody: This is a small historical fort with an informative museum in the central building, the history is given in both English and Spanish giving a good overview of everything. A previous traveller commented on it being expensive but I just do not understand this at all, it is 100 pesos per person (\u00a34), how can they think this is expensive, and they are from Switzerland where it can be really pricey!!\n\nThe views over the lake are spectacular and really do offer a panoramic scene of the lake.

573194520.name: Nice but kind of expensive
573194520.author: a TripAdvisor user
573194520.reviewBody: For the views and therefore some photos it\u2019s nice but for foreigners with 100pesos a bit expensive we thought. It\u2019s a nice construction and it looks also special from the water. To enjoy the views over the lagoon it\u2019s the best point.

569772179.name: Great views and interesting history.
569772179.author: a TripAdvisor user
569772179.reviewBody: Thoroughly enjoyed the visit to the fort.  The views of the lagoon from the different levels were breathtaking.  Great photo op.

568480796.name: Must See!
568480796.author: a TripAdvisor user
568480796.reviewBody: The fort is small but has a great exhibit inside (English and Spanish) about pirates and the history of the region.  Super interesting!  It has a great view of the lake (obviously) and is right in front of the town square which has several good restaurants and shops.

567876737.name: Ok
567876737.author: a TripAdvisor user
567876737.reviewBody: You are here so see the lake but you may as well visit the fortress.\n\nIt\'s ok and it has a good presentation of the history of the area.  Worth a visit for sure

565534085.name: So much part the Bacalar scene
565534085.author: a TripAdvisor user
565534085.reviewBody: We practically fell upon this attraction and it was well worth the visit.  In the centre of the town, its area also extends beyond the actual fort.  The museum within the fort gives one a really comprehensive history of the area and is beautifully curated and displayed.  If you can, start your visit of Bacalar here, it will give you a good foundation to underestand the town, citizens and the lake.

559014658.name: Interesting!
559014658.author: a TripAdvisor user
559014658.reviewBody: We were in Bacalar for an overnight trip and visited this fort. It is not very big, but prepare to spend some time there. there is no guide so you can go at your own pace. There is a lot of information to read. Make sure you start to read the information and photos from the beginning to get a feel for the sequence of the story.

557435705.name: [ENG] It seems like not much of an attraction, but it holds a lot of history | [ESP] Pareciera no ser una gran atracci\u00f3n
557435705.author: a TripAdvisor user
557435705.reviewBody: [ENG] Visit this fort at any time, during sunset is awesome. Also, while buying your tickets I recommend that you ask if there are any tourist guides available, most of them should not charge you and will only ask for a tip after showing you around. A guide is worth the price, because they\u2019ll give you a pretty good knowledge of Mexican ancient history, and how this place was crucial for some European kingdoms, specially regarding pirates and corsairs (Carlos is the name of the guide who helped us)| [ESP] Visita este fuerte a cualquier hora, al atardecer es impresionante. Adem\u00e1s, mientras compras tu boleto de entrada, recomiendo que preguntes si hay alg\u00fan gu\u00eda de turistas disponible. La mayor\u00eda no debe cobrarte y s\u00f3lo te pedir\u00e1 que le ofrezcas una propina al terminar el recorrido. Un gu\u00eda vale mucho la pena porque te transmitir\u00e1n informaci\u00f3n sobre la historia de M\u00e9xico y c\u00f3mo el sitio fuer crucial para reinos europeos, especialmente en lo que a piratas y corsarios se refiere (el gu\u00eda que nos ayud\u00f3 se llama Carlos).

555586692.name: Pleasant surprise!
555586692.author: a TripAdvisor user
555586692.reviewBody: I visited Bacalar for a 3 day weekend, it was great!  Visiting the fort was a pleasant surprise, nice museum inside, nice structure, and beautiful views of the lake, the town and the square!  Not to be missed if ever in Bacalar!

552079265.name: Cool, small, historic fort, with great view but needs a little TLC
552079265.author: a TripAdvisor user
552079265.reviewBody: This is a great historic fort that could be utilized MUCH better in telling the unique history of Bacalar/Bacalal.  What exhibits they do have are fairly unkempt and what was once it looks interactive, is out of order.  There wasn\'t even any working in the fort except the ticket seller.  Great view, as you would expect since it was a defense against pirates, of Laguna de Bacalar, though.   As a historic place, it is a cool place to visit.  As an "attraction" it needs a bit of attention.

547896747.name: Untapped Potential
547896747.author: a TripAdvisor user
547896747.reviewBody: It is a nice piece of history to visit, but it seems that it can really be promoted better, have some more information, interactive displays, etc.

541020677.name: Small but intersting
541020677.author: a TripAdvisor user
541020677.reviewBody: A nice little fort with some great little restaurants nearby, easy to find and open to all  public for free

538758971.name: Great
538758971.author: a TripAdvisor user
538758971.reviewBody: When you arrive in this place, you can feel the energy of the lagoon. You can go outside and imagine how as during the pirates period

536627936.name: A Must Visit For A Sense of History
536627936.author: a TripAdvisor user
536627936.reviewBody: If you ever want to understand the place where you stand, you must visit Fuerte de San Felipe. The Fuerte is a lovely construct with great views of Lake Bacalar and the town. Delve in a little closer and read the history of the area. Inside the "fuerte" are displays, murals and artifacts that deliver the region to you period by period, from its indigenous peoples, to Spanish conquerors, to today. The Fuerte de San Felipe has history come alive.

535241035.name: Ok if you are already there
535241035.author: a TripAdvisor user
535241035.reviewBody: It is quite nice and for the price of 73 pesos ok. The view is quite nice. The museum in the central building is ok but you can see that nothing was done in the last 10 years.

532662030.name: Great historical place!!
532662030.author: a TripAdvisor user
532662030.reviewBody: Do recommend to visit, it has a small museum with lots of history details, the information is easy to read since is both in english and spanish, and tells a lot about the town. There are scale boats so you can imagine how things where back in the day.

530912264.name: Historic castle and museum of piracy.
530912264.author: a TripAdvisor user
530912264.reviewBody: Interesting 18th century fortress with typical functional quasi-military architecture. You can visit the site on your own and it is relatively easy and straight forward but if you have a group of five of more you can ask for a tour.

527838436.name: Worthwhile
527838436.author: a TripAdvisor user
527838436.reviewBody: Unimposing but interesting enough to spend an hour or so.  The modest but informative museum alone is worth the visit.

517825488.name: Interesting
517825488.author: a TripAdvisor user
517825488.reviewBody: Bit pricey for what it is...entrance more than many ruins. The exposition explaining more about history and Mayan trade is interesting as is the skeleton and the magnificent views.

511935021.name: Not really worth it
511935021.author: a TripAdvisor user
511935021.reviewBody: We found the fort to be a little bit less than interesting for us. Some good displays inside but they weren\'t great. We were pretty much ready to go after about 10 minutes. It\'s also extremely extraordinarily hot because it feels like you\'re walking around in and on a brick oven. The cost was 70 pesos per person, not extremely high but I would have much rather spend the money on some tasty street food or a couple of bracelets.

510752047.name: small but nice
510752047.author: a TripAdvisor user
510752047.reviewBody: Is not the nicest Fuerte I have visit, but is wort it. Is good price, is fresh place in side and  pretty view outside.\nIt wasnt that difficult to move me around, even though im on a whealchair.

500095038.name: Small
500095038.author: a TripAdvisor user
500095038.reviewBody: It has a cost to get im, and is very small museum that in 15 min u can walk and read local historic data, spend More time in the Bacalar lagoon

497239932.name: Small but Interesting
497239932.author: a TripAdvisor user
497239932.reviewBody: The Fort is small but the exhibits are in English and the history is interesting. Another reason to visit are the great views of the lagoon.

478858070.name: Maya, Mexico and Pirats history
478858070.author: a TripAdvisor user
478858070.reviewBody: If you like museums this is a must, you only need an hour to visit this place and learn a little about this beautiful and important place. Unfortunately the electronic media is not working, but who cares if you are in this beautiful place. I hope INAH use the tickets money to keep this place in good shape.

478561592.name: a bit of history
478561592.author: a TripAdvisor user
478561592.reviewBody: Worth the few pesos entrance fee. One can learn how the Spanish Conquers found and built the fort. Worth the time to tour.

478079787.name: Very interesting
478079787.author: a TripAdvisor user
478079787.reviewBody: Incredible history around it. A fort in a lagoon? To have protection against the pirates? In a lagoon? Yes, thanks to the Mayas. They made some water canals to go from one lagoon to another and finally to the sea. Today they call it the "Pirate\'s Canal" but in fact is the "Maya\'s Canal". Very interesting.

468897943.name: Ineresting historical site
468897943.author: a TripAdvisor user
468897943.reviewBody: Enjoyed visiting the fuerte in the town itself. Good exhibits with bilingual (Espanol and English) notes, covering a number of centuries.

467355514.name: Worth the trip
467355514.author: a TripAdvisor user
467355514.reviewBody: Lovely little fort and museum.  Definitely worth having a look around.  The kids enjoyed it too as the signs were in English and Spanish.

463510349.name: Beautiful views of the lake from the Fort! Nice little museum, good upkeep.
463510349.author: a TripAdvisor user
463510349.reviewBody: Didn\'t take long to go through but it was a well preserved historical spot with amazing views of the lake Bacalar. Museum was small but nicely laid out. Cheap entrance fee, worth it if you enjoy learning about the Mayans and history of the area.

459012424.name: Well preserved with breathtaking views
459012424.author: a TripAdvisor user
459012424.reviewBody: This fort and tiny on site museum are interesting to visit. It will not take you more than 30 minutes to see and read everything there is to know about the area\'s historical piracy era. There are some interesting pieces, a very nice mural, a well preserved building and moat (dry), but the best thing about it is, by far, the spectacular views of the Bacalar Lagoon. Not to be missed.

458131264.name: Once you are at Bacalar, visiting Fuerte de San Felipe is a most
458131264.author: a TripAdvisor user
458131264.reviewBody: Fuerte is an old building that helped to defend from pirates. It was re-constructed in century XX and is fully functional. You can visit it in less than 1 hour (not that big as others of its kind), and take some good shots using your camera.

444490063.name: Super cool fort and museum
444490063.author: a TripAdvisor user
444490063.reviewBody: My husband and I love historic sites, this was a very cool one to see, reading all the facts to learn more about the history of Bacalar was interesting it is definitely take the time to go, it is not crowded and it\'s cheap to go.

441104193.name: BACALAR\u00b4S HISTORY
441104193.author: a TripAdvisor user
441104193.reviewBody: This is an historic site at Bacalar, with great big walls as every fort.  Built in 1733 by the Spanish Goverment, to defend the region from the pirates.  Interesting to visit, as you can appreciate the architechture and greatness of a fort.  There is a nice museum of the fort\u00b4s history and the Bacalar region since the precolumbian and colonial eras and as an independent country of Mexico.  The site is very well conserved.  There is also a water pit sorrounding the fort, that was built to keep the fort more secure.  Entrance fee $2 per person.  A nice visit if you\u00b4re in Bacalar.

434896972.name: Great place to visit
434896972.author: a TripAdvisor user
434896972.reviewBody: Nice construction with a great view to the Lagoon.. inside there is a small gallery. I\'ll take you about 20 min to view the entire place.

434450519.name: Fuerte
434450519.author: a TripAdvisor user
434450519.reviewBody: Nice little fortress of bacalar to protect it from invading pirates and buccaneers. As is bacalar, the fortress is a very small one, still nice to see

429328880.name: Step back into history
429328880.author: a TripAdvisor user
429328880.reviewBody: If you love history and have an interest in fortifications this is a wonderful example of military science and architecture that should not be missed.  The museum has some scellent pi\u00e8ces and very informative text.

427721417.name: Very interesting FUERTE with history ,small and nice museum
427721417.author: a TripAdvisor user
427721417.reviewBody: Museum, nice and small you can know the past from this inetresting place, Its an old nice construction, you can learn a lot a bout this FUERTE

426033937.name: the fortress and the lake
426033937.author: a TripAdvisor user
426033937.reviewBody: The fortress is a nice stop if you are on your way to Belize. The entrance is significantly cheaper for the people with mexican nationality, as if they wanted to discourage tourism :D Nobody speaks much english here, but it is worth it. It is not crowded at all and after you are done with the tour,  you can continue your walk to the lake, which has amazingly clean water, ridiculously cheap entrance fee and a pier. on your way back, certainly buy a fresh coconut - soooo sweet :)

424218128.name: Era of pirates, Creole and Mayas
424218128.author: a TripAdvisor user
424218128.reviewBody: The museum inside transports you to the era of pirates, Creole and Mayas. You can see fragments of weapons used and found here in Bacalar, replicas of ships entering and leaving the Canal Pirates. The viewpoint of the first tower shows you the lagoon with its 7 colred around 12 noon, excellent moment to take a foto! This fort is dating back almost 300 years ago and was built while the forces were found in the city of Campeche. Inside there are underground roads that connect to strategic areas of Bacalar like San Joaquin Church and the house of culture.

424139266.name: San Felipe Fort in Bacalar
424139266.author: a TripAdvisor user
424139266.reviewBody: Very well preserved and restored Fort, build by the Spanish to protect the town from pirates.Carlos our guide told us all about the history of Bacalar and the Fort.\nIt has a really nice exhibit, partly with replicas but nevertheless nicely done.

422633167.name: Lovely historical building but it feels abandoned.
422633167.author: a TripAdvisor user
422633167.reviewBody: The place is magical. It is amazing to find a fort like this close to a first class lake in such a simple humble town.

410382690.name: Nice museum
410382690.author: a TripAdvisor user
410382690.reviewBody: Despite being a small Forth it has a lot of history, you can visit this place in around half an hour and learn a lot of the history of Bacalar.\n

403604157.name: San Felipe bastion
403604157.author: a TripAdvisor user
403604157.reviewBody: Excluding the magnificent set off lagoons, the fort is THE landmark at Bacalar.  The fort is well preserved and the exhibits about pirates and female pirates is very interesting.

396700379.name: Very interesting and historical
396700379.author: a TripAdvisor user
396700379.reviewBody: We spent about an hour touring this. I found it very interesting. Lots of historical facts to learn about the Pirates. The view from the top is awesome also. It\'s very inexpensive to tour the museum. Take your camera for some awesome pictures. I recommend it. it\'s very easy to find in Bacalar. Across from town square.

395621487.name: \u00a1The Real deal pirates of the Caribbean!
395621487.author: a TripAdvisor user
395621487.reviewBody:
If you want to know more about the real history of piracy on the Caribbean and not just keep with the dumb fantasies of Hollywood, this small museum is just for you. 

This old fort used to be the scenerio of fierce battles between pirates and the Then Spanish government and Armada. Built in 1727 by orders of the Yucatan Governor Don Antonio Figueroa y Silva, The San Felipe fort was built in the region's limestone, sand and coral by the local Mayan Indians. Rich Galleons docked here in their long way to Europe, some even coming from Peru in South America. Loaded with treasure, spices and products like honey, dye wood, Wax, Cacao and tobacco. Of course French, Dutch and English pirates were always ready to take their share of that rich cargo, so this kind of military forts by the sea were used as bases for those ships who escorted galleons and for coast patrolling. 

The small but interesting collection of artifacts include some swords, pistols and everyday objects from the golden days of piracy. 

You can ask for a little tour guiding at the entrance, but be sure to haggle a little bit!

395602659.name: Expensive
395602659.author: a TripAdvisor user
395602659.reviewBody: Tickets were expensive for what\'s on offer. Tiny fort with less than spectacular views and a one room \'museum\' that takes all of five minutes to look at.

381264021.name: Very pleasant hour spent perusing the fort and museum. Information about development of the local area.
381264021.author: a TripAdvisor user
381264021.reviewBody:
First I should say that I really didn't expect to enjoy the fort. I tend to find old stones a bit dry, and often there is not enough contextualising information provided to keep it interesting for those of us that haven't done any prior reading. 

I am pleased to report that this is not the case at the San Felipe Fort. We really enjoyed it for the following reasons
1) Lots of interesting information in the museum in the keep about the development of the local area and the role of the fort. 
2) Good price
3) Perfect size (in my opinion) to spend an hour looking around and then go and get ice cream 
4) Sunbathing iguanas

381162855.name: Excellent Museum
381162855.author: a TripAdvisor user
381162855.reviewBody: It has am excellent museum exhibit where you can get a bit of history lesson about the place learn about pirates, boats the spanish conquest and more. It was a shame no one was taking care of the exhibition and there was kids running and touching everyhting including a small boat model.

352882834.name: iguanas and history
352882834.author: a TripAdvisor user
352882834.reviewBody: Beside beautiful Bacaar lagoon the fort is second best choice to admire. Set in the center of small town cant be missed. It is impressive from in and out. But we found more interesting iguanas which are usualy found on the walls and even in old canons!

350952696.name: Nice historic fort in the center of Bacalar
350952696.author: a TripAdvisor user
350952696.reviewBody: This is a nice spot to visit to see a historic Spanish fort.  It\'s not big but is nice to see and we have enjoyed going twice now.

350277955.name: Worth a visit if you are passing by...
350277955.author: a TripAdvisor user
350277955.reviewBody: It\'s a nice fort and I enjoyed the museum, but it wasn\'t as impressive as the two forts in Campeche.  In fairness, the Campeche forts are so nice I think they may have spoiled us as far as visiting other similar forts.  If you are down in this part of the Yucatan it\'s worth visiting the fort, if nothing else, the view of the lake is wonderful.

349524029.name: Nice view of the lake. Enjoyed the museum with lots info on the history of the region!
349524029.author: a TripAdvisor user
349524029.reviewBody: Interesting structure, it doesn\'t take long to walk around the fortress. The view on the fortress is quite beautiful. If you have time and the patience, go through the museum, read everything, lots to be learned about the region! If you are short on time, you won\'t be able to appreciate the museum very much as it doesn\'t look all that big, but you will still like view on top of the fortress.

348761618.name: Fortress with a view
348761618.author: a TripAdvisor user
348761618.reviewBody: Fuerte de San Felipe ruins is the main monument of Bacalar. Built in 1733 to protect the village from pirate attacks, the fortress has a permanent exhibition with objects of this period, inclyding old weapons and maps. There is always luzards around its walls. And Bacalar Lagoon is just there.

339011151.name: A historic Fort
339011151.author: a TripAdvisor user
339011151.reviewBody: This fort is in the city of Bacalar. It is not a big place. It tells about the local history of that area of the country. It might be able to take less than 30 mins. It is also next to the main plaza of the city. Here you will find food as.well.as.people selling their hand made articles. It is known as a magic town.

337318852.name: Interesting Museum about Piracy with beautiful views to Bacalar Lake
337318852.author: a TripAdvisor user
337318852.reviewBody: I highly recommend to visit this museum to understand what happened to Maya Civilization and why this area with a fresh water lake was attractive to Pirates, Buccaneers, etc. and the difference among them.

335538247.name: WELL WORTH THE TIME
335538247.author: a TripAdvisor user
335538247.reviewBody: The fort of Bacalar is very interesting, with a deep moat surrounding the fort. It has a lot of historical information inside regarding the history of Bacalar and the pirates who invaded it, including some women! Excellent value for $4.00 USD. Highly recommended.

335501728.name: Nothing special
335501728.author: a TripAdvisor user
335501728.reviewBody: There is nothing special about this Fuerte de San Felipe. You come see and go. Its not worth at all to visit.

335044573.name: Great overview of the history of the region
335044573.author: a TripAdvisor user
335044573.reviewBody: Fuerte de San Felipe is just off the main square in Bacalar. It\'s MXN70 per person to enter. You enter across what used to be a fortified drawbridge. In the central room there are numerous detailed and interesting information boards with illustrations and maps detailing the history and culture of the region in Spanish and English. These were much more thoughtfully put together than information boards at any other historical site we visited during our trip and I certainly learnt a lot. After taking in your dose of history, there are fantastic views over the lake from the ramparts. Well worth a visit!

333295329.name: Nice museum
333295329.author: a TripAdvisor user
333295329.reviewBody: We enjoyed the views of the fort and spent more than one hour in the museum of pirates, the exposition was really interesting.

330246159.name: Small but interesting
330246159.author: a TripAdvisor user
