330246159.reviewBody: Great little museum in this fort giving a very interesting overview of the fort and the town. It\'s not expensive and very informative. Worth an hour of your visit time.

328851833.name: Extremely compact and worthwhile
328851833.author: a TripAdvisor user
328851833.reviewBody: I pick up historical details to clothe the framework that reading and research have sculpted before traveling. This historic fort, with it\'s tiny museum, offers a helpful link in the chain of history from long before the Spanish Conquest and moves the view from that of the Maya to the larger world of nations and states in competition for everything. The text that explains the place and its context is presented in Spanish with an English translation. Start at the beginning, and take your time because this may be one of the coolest spots in Bacalar.

326827037.name: Captain Morgan
326827037.author: a TripAdvisor user
326827037.reviewBody: This place has a lot of interesting pirate history. It  had a lot of great information about the Yucatan Peninsula.

326126535.name: Fuerte de San Felipe
326126535.author: a TripAdvisor user
326126535.reviewBody: A wonderfully well maintained historic fort in Bacalar.   It has a look out, walls, cannons and a museum with many great items.  It is worth an hour of your time.  To read about our adventure there and see more videos and pictures check out TravelingMartinezes

321929540.name: old fort in the middle of Bacalar town
321929540.author: a TripAdvisor user
321929540.reviewBody: great little fort right in the middle of Bacalar town, the Zocalo. There are a number of small restaurants right next to the fort and Zocalo. Walking distance to the lagoon is a minute or two right down to the yacht club

319670460.name: the fort of Bacalar
319670460.author: a TripAdvisor user
319670460.reviewBody: if you want to visit Bacalar dont forget to go to Fort of Bacalar because have so much history about mayas and combat with Piratas

316947704.name: Amazing History!!!
316947704.author: a TripAdvisor user
316947704.reviewBody: The history of this fort, built in 1733, is well worth the visit.  The museum inside the fort was interesting and all the information is in Spanish and English.  If you are in Bacalar, definitely go see!  70 pesos for Non Mexicans, 30 pesos for Mexicans.

315502545.name: Good way to spend 2 hours
315502545.author: a TripAdvisor user
315502545.reviewBody: Nice, easy to do, interesting and educating. Located in the town center, a place u need anyway. Worth a visit

315202836.name: Well preserved!
315202836.author: a TripAdvisor user
315202836.reviewBody: Informative museum tracking the local history.  All signs are both in Spanish and English, so you can do a self-guided tour.  Kept very clean.  A few of the automatic exhibits (where you push a button) were not working properly and it was very hot inside.  But it was a great way to learn the history of the area!

304884538.name: Very interesting
304884538.author: a TripAdvisor user
304884538.reviewBody: Tiny museum but necessary to understand the Pirates and lake use from years . Beautiful views of the laguna

303075286.name: Interesting & Informative
303075286.author: a TripAdvisor user
303075286.reviewBody: We enjoyed our visit to the fort. Don\'t forget to pay at the kiosk opposite the entrance like we did! The visit helped put the history of Bacalar into context. Just think they need to open a bit more, the watch tower for example and perhaps provide a free pamphlet.

290418388.name: Great Surprise!  Can\u00b4t believe such fort can be here
290418388.author: a TripAdvisor user
290418388.reviewBody: The story about pirates coming to Bacalar is a lot of fun and very well presented in this small museum.

289936858.name: Small Museum But Well Done
289936858.author: a TripAdvisor user
289936858.reviewBody: Inside the fort is a fair amount of information and displays about the fort & it\'s history. A guided talking tour that included the outside would have been nice and more fitting for the price. I felt it was expensive for what it is

282647730.name: Interesting and educational visit
282647730.author: a TripAdvisor user
282647730.reviewBody: Worth hiring a guide for the fort. The tour will only last a bit over an hour but you will learn a lot about the place and the views are great.

282172614.name: Not worth the small fee
282172614.author: a TripAdvisor user
282172614.reviewBody: I do not recommend visiting the inside of the Fuerte as there is nothing else but text! You can find all the information you may need online. But there is not historical art / item displayed within.

271552185.name: Not so exiting, but nice view
271552185.author: a TripAdvisor user
271552185.reviewBody: For 67 pesos, this is way overpriced. The place is quite nice and has a nice view and a neat little museum, but I would not have chosen to go and pay so much if I had known how little there was to see there. The place is not that big either.

271449940.name: Well restored site and great museum
271449940.author: a TripAdvisor user
271449940.reviewBody: I think the 29 pesos I paid were well worth it.\nThe fort itself is very well restored, with beautiful views of Laguna Bacalar,  the museum is smallish but has enough information  to introduce you to Bacalar\'s history.

263484190.name: Old fortress against pirates
263484190.author: a TripAdvisor user
263484190.reviewBody: It is located in the center of Bacalar. Its purpose was to protect villagers against pirate raids from the lake. Later it was also used during Mexican revolution. Sadly it was closed when we were there and wanted to see it from inside.

259038123.name: Too little for the price!
259038123.author: a TripAdvisor user
259038123.reviewBody: It has an interesting museum on the inside but too expensive for what you actually get, it is just too little, just one room but still a nice hint about the history of Bacalar. Anyway, the best is the view you get of the lagoon from up there and the pics you can make with the old cannons and stuff :)

258093181.name: Great little museum in beautiful setting
258093181.author: a TripAdvisor user
258093181.reviewBody: Surprisingly informative museum about history of Bacalar. Mayans, conquistadors, Pirates and revolutionaries. Info in English and Spanish. Good maps and a few artefacts. Air Con a treat too.

257585706.name: Makes Bacalar picturesque
257585706.author: a TripAdvisor user
257585706.reviewBody: It is modest in size but it is impressively preserved (reconstructed) and the lagoon in the back makes is pretty. It shows the history and adds character to this tiny, beautiful and quiet city. I didn\'t enter the museum and just saw it from the outside but it\'s architecture can also be appreciated.

255507048.name: A nice surprise
255507048.author: a TripAdvisor user
255507048.reviewBody: This fort is beautifully maintained and has excellent exhibits.  Just a few blocks from our room!  Learned about pirates, the Caste War and the history of the Mayans in the area.\n

252972902.name: Great museum, too
252972902.author: a TripAdvisor user
252972902.reviewBody: Displays with narratives in English document the cultural history of the Maya and the roll of Bacalar throughout the centuries as a southern outpost in the Yucatan.

252807521.name: Small fort
252807521.author: a TripAdvisor user
252807521.reviewBody: Beautiful view of Laguna Bacalar from fort. Fort is right in quiet, peaceful town of Bacalar. Fort built by Spanish but occupied by Mayans 1859-1901.

251445386.name: Pirates in Bacalar ????
251445386.author: a TripAdvisor user
251445386.reviewBody: In the 1700s pirates used to come from the caribbean ocean in to Bacalar using a natural canal thru the lagoons.  THey used to take from Bacalar wood to build ships among other goods.  Its worth visiting !!!!

243740887.name: Surprisingly good
243740887.author: a TripAdvisor user
243740887.reviewBody: The fort has a nice view over the lake and is interesting architecture but the stuff inside was a real surprise. Its well worth the small cost, payable across the side walk at a small booth. Don\'t be embarrassed by them chasing after you for payment like I was.

237553783.name: Nice view of the Lago
237553783.author: a TripAdvisor user
237553783.reviewBody: Really nice view, worth the visit. Have to pay something like 20 pesos but I enjoyed the view and the history

218905831.name: Nice museum
218905831.author: a TripAdvisor user
218905831.reviewBody:
This is a nice place to go when you visit Bacalar. The views aré great and the museum guides aré very kind and easygoing. 

The prices are good.
In general everything is very nice

211364767.name: Excellent Historical Monument You Must See
211364767.author: a TripAdvisor user
211364767.reviewBody:
Go for about 1-2 hours and if you can in the late afternoon when the sun is low and the light really shows off the form of this well preserved fort.

It's right I the Bacalar lagoon so your view of the glittery blue waters will be excellent.

There is a neat museum inside with artifacts and historical stories. Really good stuff.

Just go, you'll love it.

201286564.name: History comes alive
201286564.author: a TripAdvisor user
201286564.reviewBody: This fort is in fabulous condition, and it, more then anything else gives some idea of the importance that this area has historically.  It is fun to walk through, and the exhibits are very interesting.

195201286.name: Fuerte de San Felipe en Bacalar
195201286.author: a TripAdvisor user
195201286.reviewBody: A stone fort with a baluarte named San Antonio, a cement bridge into the works. Started in 1733and a work in progress for over 50 years.Inside, a museum with historic maps,ships models, swords, guns and navigational instruments. A large display of famous pirate pictures and storys. The view from the upper walls of the lagunas of Bacalar, deep emerald green,are remarkable. Nearby are some shops and gallerys with crafts, and artwork. The town centre rather quiet for a Mexican town, but worth a visit.

177783292.name: Pirates and History
177783292.author: a TripAdvisor user
177783292.reviewBody: The musuem in the Fort (Fuerte) is worth a visit.  Kids will love the replicas of the pirate ships and adults will find the wall mounted historical time lines of the area fascinating.  Who would have thought that pirates hid in Lake Bacalar and that they could even get there.  Good info on the Caste Wars and why Belize is populated by mestizo.  Amazing post-Columbian history.....The views are great as well.

169744207.name: Interesting fort
169744207.author: a TripAdvisor user
169744207.reviewBody: It is small but all forts of that era are small. Excellent displays written in Spanish, English, and Maya.  It is a history written by the victors of course so the Maya get the short stick.

160821927.name: Interesting place
160821927.author: a TripAdvisor user
160821927.reviewBody: A very accesible walk through this place, you could call it a landmark in Bacalar, it represent the Spanish domination as well as the pirate history of the place.

156443787.name: didn\'t get it
156443787.author: a TripAdvisor user
156443787.reviewBody: Not sure what the fuss is about. The downtown which surrounds this is really tragic. The food was terrible, the area didn\'t seem completely safe, and there was nothing else going on in this town.

154855614.name: Well worth a visit
154855614.author: a TripAdvisor user
154855614.reviewBody: A very interesting part of local Mexican & international history, with an excellent museum & small shop. Superb views of the lake.

154598113.name: Informative & Interesting
154598113.author: a TripAdvisor user
154598113.reviewBody: This is a small site but quite informative and interesting. We learned a lot about the history of the country and the area. It\'s well maintained and there is a nice view of the Lagoon from the open area.

154376424.name: interesting spot
154376424.author: a TripAdvisor user
154376424.reviewBody: Made me realize that Bacalar is more than a beautiful lake. Had a very informative visit to this well designed historical site. I recommend it.

154355100.name: Pirate Museum
154355100.author: a TripAdvisor user
154355100.reviewBody: Very interesting small fort right on the edge of Bacalar Lagoon and the town of Bacalar.  Both the history of the local Maya and the activities of the pirates in the area waters are well described.

153787036.name: Great Little Museum (Pirates and more)!
153787036.author: a TripAdvisor user
153787036.reviewBody: The fort itself has great views of the colors of the lagoon and is good for taking pictures overlooking the lagoon, but my favorite part was the museum. It has an amazing, colorful mural and tons of history about the Maya, pirates, and the Caste War. I stayed about 1 hour in the small museum, reading all of the information and looking at the artifacts.

153736476.name: Wonderful Museum
153736476.author: a TripAdvisor user
153736476.reviewBody: What a little gem in a small town  Found out a lot about Cap\'n Morgan, Sir Francis Drake and other dastardly pirates ( called Privateers in UK!!)

149814424.name: surprisingly interesting museum
149814424.author: a TripAdvisor user
149814424.reviewBody: The fort is reconstructed and worth a quick look. It has good views of the bay. Inside, the museum tells a lot about the history of Bacalar, about the Mayans and their trade practices, about the Spanish conquest, the Caste Wars, and about piracy in Belize and Bacalar. It\'s a great orientation for the area, with objects, images and ship models. Labels are in English and Spanish.

149543099.name: Okay
149543099.author: a TripAdvisor user
149543099.reviewBody: Interesting, but not a huge place, good for some pictures and to see the structure and view of the lagoon. I do recommend walking in the park in front of the Fort and eating or having a drink/coffee in the town, very colorful. Near the fort you\'ll find a beautiful church with amazing trees in the gardens, just ask around, can\'t miss it.

148544031.name: Very nice fort and museum
148544031.author: a TripAdvisor user
148544031.reviewBody: This is quite an impressive fort, overlooking the lake. The museum is small but excellent, with lots of information about the pirates and the history of the area.

146241961.name: fuerte san felipe en Bacalar
146241961.author: a TripAdvisor user
146241961.reviewBody: nice place for family, great lagoon view, museum inside the fort\ngo early in the morning, because afternoon the sun will be hot

134229897.name: Great little museum, perhaps too much reading.
134229897.author: a TripAdvisor user
134229897.reviewBody: I really enjoyed this museum, I wish I could had spent more time.  The kids didn\'t want to read the information, so they were done before me.  One thing we all three enjoyed was the view from a top the fort.

133325614.name: Wonderful piece of Mexican history.
133325614.author: a TripAdvisor user
133325614.reviewBody: The fort is interesting and a great example of the Spanish incursion into the Yucatan culture and history.  The museum is well researched and although not too big it has lots of interesting items that are well described.  It has a nice appropriate building that is well designed to show the items.

133302312.name: nice place
133302312.author: a TripAdvisor user
133302312.reviewBody: It is worth a visit: the museum is interesting and from the top of the fort you can enjoy a very nice view.

127675657.name: Crumbly!
127675657.author: a TripAdvisor user
127675657.reviewBody: The place is small, old, and has not been kept. They close it most of the time and is really in terrible shape. The view is amazing from it, but there is nothing to do there. We could not enter the place the day we went there, even though it was during hours it was supposed to be open. Not worth visiting.

126440891.name: Nice small museum
126440891.author: a TripAdvisor user
126440891.reviewBody: It was a nice museum. Very small but has great views of the lake and town. Took about 15 minutes to walk through. The pictures and information inside was about what you would expect for a museum about pirates. Informative.

125960541.name: A good "must-see" point in town
125960541.author: a TripAdvisor user
125960541.reviewBody: Very interesting museum where you can explore a little bit on the history of Bacalar town, how it was invaded by pirates from different parts of the world, also contains some nice old pirate articles.

124524784.name: Worth the stop
124524784.author: a TripAdvisor user
124524784.reviewBody: Cool little fort that doesn\'t take alot of time to see.  Like every view of Lake Bacalar what you see here is beautiful

124460273.name: Worth to visit
124460273.author: a TripAdvisor user
124460273.reviewBody: The fortress is located on a small hill overlooking the beautiful Laguna Bacalar. It is difficult to find it as there are no signs directing you there. Make sure you ask a local in Bacalar about the directions. The view from the fortress is beautiful. The museum is also very nice, with the historical background of the fortress, information on the Mayans, the skeleton underneath, the pirates story and a few artifacts. There is alsoa vivid mural on the wall.. You will pay a small fee to enter, and if you are mexican, saturdays are free.

123986316.name: Beautiful views, interesting pirate history
123986316.author: a TripAdvisor user
123986316.reviewBody: The views, a little bit of history, interesting clad pirates on Sundays for visitors

123005362.name: Is a real pirates place
123005362.author: a TripAdvisor user
123005362.reviewBody: Here is all the  history about the GREAT pirates of the caribean , and the trade of that time as Well as the castas war. ,

122008479.name: Pretty good museum
122008479.author: a TripAdvisor user
122008479.reviewBody: the fort is small and has a nice view over the lake. the museum is small but has interesting history of the area, exploration and pirates

120802915.name: Definitely worth visiting
120802915.author: a TripAdvisor user
120802915.reviewBody: Even if you aren\'t into history, you should stop at the fort if you are in Bacalar. It\'s easy to explore compared to most of the ruins in the area and it gives you great views of the lake. I visited with some adult relatives, but it would be great for families with young children. There is plenty of space for them to run safely and they would have fun looking at the cannons.

120115335.name: Historical
120115335.author: a TripAdvisor user
120115335.reviewBody: This is the best way to learn about the local history

116638925.name: English KEEP OUT,
116638925.author: a TripAdvisor user
116638925.reviewBody: Wonderful small fort right in town...built by Spanish to fight off the English. THE incredible thing is that the fort is 17 kilometers from open ocean and u need to navigate a series of small ang large sloughs.

116214666.name: Beautiful landscape and history in Bacalar
116214666.author: a TripAdvisor user
116214666.reviewBody:
My family and I traveled back home from Cancun and we made a stop at Bacalar. The driver took us to this old fortress, right in front of the beautiful "Laguna de Bacalar". It is a great structure, very well preserved and even though it is not as big as "San Juan de Ulua" in Veracruz or the walls in Campeche, the "fuerte de San Felipe" looks very nice and a perfect example of the military arquitecture of port cities in Mexico.
The place is protected and run by the INAH which is an advantage because there are guided tours through the place and also, there is a small museum inside this monument.
After we payed our entrance fee (Students, teachers and seniors with valid ID enter for free, and sunday is free for everyone, monday is closed), we were received by a tour guide who was very kind and fun. the knowledge about the fortress and the history about it and the region of Bacalar it's very good, informative and complete. He explained us all about the pirates, the mayas and the fortress.
The lanscape to the Laguna de Bacalar from the fortress are great and the camera it's a must when you visit this place.
Very reccomendable when in Bacalar!

676238902.name: Must See
676238902.author: a TripAdvisor user
676238902.reviewBody: Definitely one of the most beautiful fresh water lakes I have ever seen in all of my travels!  Super unique!

675583613.name: Beautiful place sweet water.
675583613.author: a TripAdvisor user
675583613.reviewBody: Perfect place to enjoy with your family. Baby acceptable. It\u2019s a colorful lake full of options, from snorkeling to paddle boating

674242919.name: amazing boat trip, good guide
674242919.author: a TripAdvisor user
674242919.reviewBody: Yan guided us today and the trip was amazing. Lots of explanation and special places. We also were the lucky ones to see a special phenomenon. Would recommend! 10/10

674176977.name: Bacalar
674176977.author: a TripAdvisor user
674176977.reviewBody: Lake Bacalar is a beautiful place to visit. Quiet compared to other centers in the area. Great food. Close to chetumal, Belize border and ruins Dzibanche, kinichna and kohunlich

673054861.name: Underwhelmed
673054861.author: a TripAdvisor user
673054861.reviewBody: We took a 1.5 hour uninteresting drive from the cruise port in Costa Maya along a straight, flat, 2-lane highway through low bush. \nThe area around the lake seemed to be all private property with an entry fee to see the lake. You must wear life jacket to swim (which are available for rent). There is no snorkelling.\nThe water in the lagoon is very clear, not cold. Not particularly beautiful/colourful. It was definitely not worth the long drive. The nearby Bacalar Fort is not impressive.

672181519.name: Lake of Seven Colors
672181519.author: a TripAdvisor user
672181519.reviewBody: The lake is beautiful - very tranquil - did the tour.  If you\'re from Texas you won\'t be overly impressed. We have several beautiful lakes with homes surrounding the lake. But the color of the water is pretty and clear.

669185271.name: Great place to relax!!
669185271.author: a TripAdvisor user
669185271.reviewBody: Clear blue waters, good access with nice restaurants and bars on shore. Not too spoiled yet with the big tourist groups, so go asap!

668888564.name: Spectacular freshwater lake
668888564.author: a TripAdvisor user
668888564.reviewBody: Laguna Bacalar is a beautiful freshwater lake with very special unique natural features.  The limestone base creates swimming pool clear waters. (but local pollution & obnoxious jet skis are changing this).  Birds abound along the shores (Limpkin, wood storks, egrets, etc.) and the stromolites are very special living structures at the south end. Most beautiful around noon when the sun is high.

667901039.name: Worth the visit
667901039.author: a TripAdvisor user
667901039.reviewBody: This is a great community on a beautiful fresh water lake where you can view the historical fort in town centre, eat at great restaurants all over the town, shop for good priced items, lay around and swim at the public wharfs and take a tour of the incredible lagoon!  We loved it here.  Not too many tourists and friendly local people.

667657147.name: Beautiful lake
667657147.author: a TripAdvisor user
667657147.reviewBody: The lake at Bacalar is picturesque and a wonderful place to visit by a great town. Definitely visit the Laguna, also recommend doing a free-diving or scuba-diving

667509398.name: Astonishing views
667509398.author: a TripAdvisor user
667509398.reviewBody: Never seen so many tones of blue in the water. There are many activities to do during the day. You can visit the cenotes by car or water. By water a visit to the pirates passage is a must and the rapids.\nExcelent family vacation

667424575.name: One of my favourite places in Mexico
667424575.author: a TripAdvisor user
667424575.reviewBody: I planned to go for 2 nights and ended up staying 6. I will likely go back. It\u2019s a great place to relax and also a great place to do water activities - my highlight was the SUP sunrise tour. Great places to eat. Limited ATM\u2019s and everything else so come prepared with all that you need. I will be back!

667083335.name: Absolutely stunning
667083335.author: a TripAdvisor user
667083335.reviewBody: I so need to come back to this place again. Just absolutely stunning. Clean and clear, and not super touristy. Lovely little town. We will come back and spend more time here.

666680457.name: Amazing lake
666680457.author: a TripAdvisor user
666680457.reviewBody: A nice change from swimming in sea water. The lake allegedly has seven colours - not sure how true it is other than to say that there a amazing hues of blue. The lake is fed by a number of cenotes that can be visited. One can also visit the Pirates Cove where the water is at points ankle deep and where you can muddy yourself up with the \u2018Mayan bath\u2019 of mineral enriched sand (you can defiantly smell those pongy minerals!). You can also visit live, rather than fossilised Stromatolites - but please don\u2019t go near them or touch them! But the most wonderful thing you can do on the lake is catch a boat to a spot that isn\u2019t too deep and swim in the marvellous clear and clean water, and when you\u2019ve had enough find a shallow spot and just chill whilst the water laps your ankles.

666495131.name: Uau! Non salty Caribbean waters
666495131.author: a TripAdvisor user
666495131.reviewBody: Cristal waters. This lagoon has more than 7 colors going from blue and green to violet. Perfect for a weekend with your couple.

666190551.name: No wonder they call it the most beautiful lake in the world! Seeing is believing!!!
666190551.author: a TripAdvisor user
666190551.reviewBody: No camera can capture the beauty, the soul gratifyng emotion of being there!  Nothing compares to bathing where the Maya, the most enduring and most advanced pre-Columbian civilization in the ancient New World did.

666159248.name: Spectacular place
666159248.author: a TripAdvisor user
666159248.reviewBody: We took a private tour on the lake and enjoyed the different stops close to the cenotes and the Canal de los piratas. If you go with more than 4 people the private tour is not much more expensive than the ones with another group. The advantage is that you can stop where you desire. We spent some time in the water and enjoyed the different colors and places during the drive on the lake. It is spectacular how the colors change as sun and clouds move. A must if you visit Bacalar - if you have time you can use different options for navigating the lagoon.\n

666153023.name: Amazing
666153023.author: a TripAdvisor user
666153023.reviewBody: Beautiful colors.  Not overly busy with tourists at least when we were there!  Definitely enjoyed our time here.

665648528.name: One of the most beautiful place to discover in Mexico
665648528.author: a TripAdvisor user
665648528.reviewBody: This was truly the most amazing part of the trip, you get to relax and enjoy the unique views of the lagoon. Go kayak for sunset, watch the stars at night facing the lake, eat at Barbanegra before heading to the I Scream Cafe and Catarina!!

664917116.name: Fifty shades of blue
664917116.author: a TripAdvisor user
664917116.reviewBody:
Amazing coulors if you imagine that this is a fresh water sea. 
Grab a canoe and enjoy a ride on the lake. 
Mangroves are pretty and like small pools with a huge flora and fauna.
Be aware that there is no beach at all. Maybe there are just  little small ones but not reachable by foot. 

Anyway, great location to spend some days as there are some little nice hostels, chilled people and everything is a kind of relaxed.

664802050.name: 7 colors lagoon
664802050.author: a TripAdvisor user
664802050.reviewBody: the lagoon has really 7 different colors al around, no fishing but you can swim anywhere, it has an amazing view al around

664303849.name: Unique and beautiful
664303849.author: a TripAdvisor user
664303849.reviewBody: Our three favorite spots for lagoon access (We\'re a family of two adults and one nine year old): Los Aluxes, Los Rapidos, and Kai pez restauarnt. Great days at all spots.

661522904.name: Bacalar, Quintana Roo, Mexico
661522904.author: a TripAdvisor user
661522904.reviewBody: This place is literally a paradise. I can recommend it if your plan is being in peace and quiet for some days :)

660956148.name: Very lovely
660956148.author: a TripAdvisor user
660956148.reviewBody: Just bear in mind it\'s a very big lagoon and the edges have been claimed by a multitude of hotels and guesthouses. Except for a couple of public access spots, you can\'t just rock up to the shores and wander into the water. There\'s not a lot else to see around Bacalar, the lake is the real star.

660624708.name: being a fresh water lagoon just next to the ocean provides a nice contrast to the sea
660624708.author: a TripAdvisor user
660624708.reviewBody: Bacalar is a laid back place. Nice temperate clear freshwater (not salty). Take a day trip boat ride out on the lagoon and jump in or head out to one of the lagoon "beaches" such as Cocalito.  Experience it before it becomes exploited!

659793474.name: Relaxing
659793474.author: a TripAdvisor user
659793474.reviewBody: A relaxing experience. And not expensive. We enjoyed a catamaran trip on the lake, 4 hours trip and to stroll around in the small streets. Visited the fort. In the evenings the main square is very busy, worth a visit too.

659369986.name: Incredible
659369986.author: a TripAdvisor user
659369986.reviewBody: I have never seen water so blue and clear. This brackish Lagoon is not a lake at all and has a long and interesting history. It is well worth spending the day!

658672784.name: 7 colourless on the lake.
658672784.author: a TripAdvisor user
658672784.reviewBody: Bacalar use too be a pirate area. On this day you can fine a concrete boat. The water is clear and clean. If you going to stay in a hotel most of them are in the shore and easy to get on the water. Some will have pallet board. If not you can rent it for half or full hrs. If you go just for the day I will recommend to the park of the government administer. Ones you get to downtown there is a big procreation wall " Fort of San Felipe" you\'ll get down the row and take to the left 3 block and then one to your left and there will be park. You will pay only 1 USD for the parking and you can stay there all day. There is a snak area really good and economy or you can bring yours. You can\'t eat at the pear. The sand in the lake you can use to clean your skin. You will fine tour to do all in a boat. If you do it for sure you will love it. Have fun and if you have questions  let me know. ...

658431563.name: Seeing is believing!
658431563.author: a TripAdvisor user
658431563.reviewBody: This is likely the most beautiful spot we\u2019ve seen in Mexico. Period. We did a two day trip from Tao, Akumal. Colectivo to Tulum and ADO bus from there to Bacalar. Worth every bit of time and planning even for a short trip.

658133423.name: Amazing!
658133423.author: a TripAdvisor user
658133423.reviewBody: Beautiful lagoon! Would highly recommend doing one of the boat tours to see the entire lake and overall area!

657219531.name: Caribbean colors in a fresh water lake.
657219531.author: a TripAdvisor user
657219531.reviewBody: So glad we took our side trip from Cozumel to Bacalar. Well worth the 3 hr and 50 minute bus trip. Locals are super friendly and helpful. Took a boat ride around the lake and did some swimming. Absolutely beautiful.

657019420.name: Sightseeing
657019420.author: a TripAdvisor user
657019420.reviewBody: This Lake is like nothing i have ever seen before,it has 7 different colors of blue. We swam at the public dock and beach. There was a small fee to park, there were bathroom facilities there also.

656015534.name: What an incredible moment!
656015534.author: a TripAdvisor user
656015534.reviewBody: During a 2-week stay in Mexico in january 2019, my family and I made a stopover in the bacalar lagoon for 3 nights. What a good choice! The colours here take on a new dimension. The lagoon is of incredible beauty with exceptional shades of blue and green. Very relaxing! don\'t miss the cenote azul !

654342134.name: Wonderful place
654342134.author: a TripAdvisor user
654342134.reviewBody: Visited Lake Bacalar during a Caribbean cruise. Really worth a visit. Had a nice boat ride and relaxing swimming moments. There is a possibilty to sail as well. Maybe next time...

653243183.name: Stunning!  Magical!
653243183.author: a TripAdvisor user
653243183.reviewBody: Beautiful place!  There are no adequate words to describe this lake!  Take a boat tour!  Learn the fascinating history and see rare geological formations!  Don\u2019t miss this place!

652790087.name: Truly marvellous
652790087.author: a TripAdvisor user
652790087.reviewBody: When you read about this lagoon, they might refer to the lake of seven colours (basically 7 shades of blue) or the Maledives of Mexico - that hits the nail on the head! It\u2019s so beautiful, the water is crystal clear and the temperature is refreshing but not ice cold .. and it\u2019s fresh water! That means less marine life for snorkelling, but no itchy eyes after swimming! \nI recommend renting a kayak and then paddle over to the other side of the lagoon (takes less than 30min against the wind) to enjoy empty sandbanks! They also have boat tours that go there, but with the kayak you can go where ever and as far inside as you like! \nOr you can just swim in the shallow waters close to the fortress - they don\u2019t have public beaches there, but little piers.

651107381.name: Must visit
651107381.author: a TripAdvisor user
651107381.reviewBody: A beautiful lake, with stunning colours and warm water for swimming. Accessible from at least two public areas in Bacalar and well managed and policed. Canoe, fishing or boat trip options available if you want them, and several restaurants on the waters edge.

651091391.name: my top 10 list of beautiful places
651091391.author: a TripAdvisor user
651091391.reviewBody: We were amazed by the gorgeous colors in this lake and fascinated by the information about the lake and the area\u2019s history presented by our tour guide.  We took a Chac Ek tour to Bacalar from Costa Maya and were thoroughly impressed by the experience.  Ishmael was an amazing tour guide, treating us like relatives more than customers.  One of my favorite experiences ever!

648615239.name: Amazing area to relax
648615239.author: a TripAdvisor user
648615239.reviewBody: One of our most favorite spots in Mexico. Still very relaxing and authentic but with all the basics one needs to feel comfortable such as wifi, decent food and amazing swimming. On a sunny day it will take your breath away!

646831597.name: A great vacation destination
646831597.author: a TripAdvisor user
646831597.reviewBody: I just went for the first Time to Bacalar and had an incredible time.  The water is beautiful don\'t forget to take a tour of the lake. They take you to all sorts of really cool features that are mostly only seen on this lake including cenotes that are in the lake. The restaurants are great and plenty of nice hotels.

646266746.name: dream boat tour
646266746.author: a TripAdvisor user
646266746.reviewBody: Bacalar Lagoon is one of the most magical places in the world. Don\'t miss the opportunity to discover it with the best guide: Kiki! We had been around the lagoon with her for a whole afternoon, enjoying a lot a swimming (Birds Island, Cenote Nigro, Pirates\' Channel etc) and she gave us plenty of information about nature and history. You can feel how much she loves this place and you\'ll fall in love too.

646222905.name: Waow! Nice "beach" to expend the day!
646222905.author: a TripAdvisor user
646222905.reviewBody: Very clean and clear water! you can snorkle around and expend hours in the lake. Don\'t miss you sun protection. Could be crowed at at times but there is enough space there for everybody. Enjoy the lake it is beautiful!

646121852.name: GREAT LAKE\u00a1\u00a1
646121852.author: a TripAdvisor user
646121852.reviewBody: This is an amazing lake and evething you see in photos it\'s true, this lake has seven colors in the water an that is great at the view, you can take a great selfies, pictures for over the place and enjoy a great trip with all your family, aaah by the way is a Freshwater lake, another great reason to enjoy it at100%,let me know about yor experiences :)

646080638.name: Lugar incre\u00edble
646080638.author: a TripAdvisor user
646080638.reviewBody: Bacalar es un lugar m\u00e1gico e incre\u00edble que toda persona debe visitar!!! We loved it and hope eveyone that is reading this review can visit it!

645180178.name: Love!!
645180178.author: a TripAdvisor user
645180178.reviewBody: What a beautiful place in Mexico. Feel like we are visiting before the crowds discover and it becomes insane and touristy. Such a gorgeous spot - and The turquoise waters rival those of SE Asia and eastern Caribbean. Sailboat and power boat tour options - although we kayaked and paddle boarded. A must visit.

644183795.name: Bacalar Lake is a pristine place for relaxation!
644183795.author: a TripAdvisor user
644183795.reviewBody: One of the best and most beautiful places I\u2019ve visited! It has the gorgeous lake, nice people, good restaurants and a relaxing ambience overall. My soul is already asking me to come back for more!!!

642104016.name: Great choice to visit
642104016.author: a TripAdvisor user
642104016.reviewBody:
Now I’m staying at Bacalar.
I am totally released from noisy daily lives.
Land scape from the coast is magnificent.
The lagoon view have great contrast of blue.
And every age can enjoy water activity in safe.

In the night, you can enjoy the night sky full of star.

641691989.name: Simply an hidden gem!
641691989.author: a TripAdvisor user
641691989.reviewBody: 30 years of travelling around the world, and I can say that this place is for sure in my personal Top 3.\nCan u imagine to be at Maldives without salted water? This can be the feeling a day in the lake may give you!\nAnd when you want to add some fun too, just visit Los Rapidos to swim following the current.

641606490.name: Beautiful
641606490.author: a TripAdvisor user
641606490.reviewBody: The colors of the lagoon change because of the light, floor, moon... everything makes a beautiful change on the water.\nVery well preserved and home to a lot of fishes, plants, birds and so much more..\nDefinitely a place to go!

641506508.name: Breathtaking place
641506508.author: a TripAdvisor user
641506508.reviewBody: We enjoyed swimming and kayaking at the lagoon! Fun time and memories! Make sure to wear water shoes!

641372606.name: Lovely and unhurried
641372606.author: a TripAdvisor user
641372606.reviewBody: I stopped in lake bacalar on my way to chetumal.i spent two pleasant days walking and swimming in lake .It is a worthwhile stop if you have time while traveling through Yucatan.

641151472.name: Beautiful fresh water "Lake of Seven Colors"
641151472.author: a TripAdvisor user
641151472.reviewBody: This is one of the prettiest lakes you will find anywhere on a sunny day it blue hues will shimmer in the sun light. Find a nice private spot of your own, canoe down from Xul Ha, or stop by a local restaurant with a view. You will be glad you took the time to look!!!

639239145.name: In love with the lake
639239145.author: a TripAdvisor user
639239145.reviewBody: Its a very relaxing blue piece of Paradise , you can access to the lake in a public zone or go to a restaurant, hotel or any guesthouse you want. Please don\'t forget to take your thrash with you, we have to keep this place so we can enjoy it for a long time :)

638168607.name: Must see to believe the colours
638168607.author: a TripAdvisor user
638168607.reviewBody: No matter where you stay for your holiday in Yucatan, you must find a way to get to Bacalar. The sight of something so vivid turquoise,  laguna like at parts, deep blue at others where the cenotes are,  the sheer size and beauty of the lake,  called also the seven colours lake is to be seen to be believed and enjoyed by all. Goes without saying a boat trip on the lake is a must, too. It takes two hours, stopping at five different sites, giving you chance to swim in three cenotes, which here are part of the lake, laguna with optional mud treatment,  passing by bird islands and eco park. Well worth the travel.

636614839.name: Magical
636614839.author: a TripAdvisor user
636614839.reviewBody: The lake of Seven Colors, It\'s a shock to the eyes , I\'ve never seen a more beautiful site in my life. The lagoon is 55 km long and empties into the Caribbean. When you go there you have to look up Ramone Concha for a boat trip....Gorgeous

635694288.name: Super clear water.
635694288.author: a TripAdvisor user
635694288.reviewBody: You can\u2019t imagine how clean and clear this water is.\nA great place to spend the day.\nA lot of history and artifacts at th Fort.

635498820.name: Beautiful place
635498820.author: a TripAdvisor user
635498820.reviewBody: Wonderful lake, not to be missed on your trip through Yucatan. Also recommended to take a boat trip. We were very happy not to have booked in advance with a sailing boat and picked a speedboat because of lack of wind. Enjoy the cenotes!

633997922.name: very nice
633997922.author: a TripAdvisor user
633997922.reviewBody: a good place for kayaking, bird watching, swimming and snorkeling. one can also just relax & lay back.

633509415.name: Great Change from the Sea
633509415.author: a TripAdvisor user
633509415.reviewBody:
We traveled here with another couple who live in Cancun. We had never heard of this area so we were excited to try something new. It was very nice. 
We took a boat trip around the lagoon and ate two meals there. It is truly a beautiful place with warm and clear water. 
Swimming was great and the conotes were pretty amazing. 

It is worth two days of your trip but it is a very long drive from Cancun.

632832654.name: My visit
632832654.author: a TripAdvisor user
632832654.reviewBody: I recommend this place to go and visit it on vacations because it is a very nice place, it has a lot activities to do, like visiting the \u201cFuerte de San Felipe\u201d, \u201cCocalitos\u201d it is a very good choice of a place to hang out. In itself, Bacalar is a lagoon with a very calm environment, the place is very virgin which makes the day wonderful, you can enjoy seeing the tonalities of the water. Practically Bacalar is part of one of the most beautiful magical towns in Mexico, found in Quintana Roo.\nYou can also visit the \u201cCenote Azul\u201d that is one of the most popular natural attractions of Bacalar. To get to know Bacalar well, a boat tour is made to know the water, which makes everyone fall in love with its magical colors. In Bacalar you can enjoy a very good experience together with your family and friends, you can take great pictures with the fantastic colors of the lagoon and as a tradition in the swings above the water. A few months ago, I went with my family to see the whole south, and the part I liked the most about knowing Quintana Roo was Bacalar, since it is not a place where people are overpopulated and it is a very beautiful place which I would visit a thousand times more.

632776891.name: So beautiful
632776891.author: a TripAdvisor user
632776891.reviewBody: It is really great place to relax and to swim in fresh water. Water is a bit colder comparing to the Caribean sea. \n

632342139.name: Great lake
632342139.author: a TripAdvisor user
632342139.reviewBody: Such a Great Lake with all the colors. \nFrom the public \u2018beach\u2019 in the city you can take a swim or just lay in the sun. The fresh water has a very good temperature and is not very deep.

631941102.name: So special. Go to this place.
631941102.author: a TripAdvisor user
631941102.reviewBody: The senotes (cavernous underground pools) are incredible, and they all feed into this incredibly clean, and beautiful lagoon.

631504808.name: Amazing view
631504808.author: a TripAdvisor user
631504808.reviewBody: Get a tour and buy snorkel gear to see the fish and the nice sand around this lake! Highly recommended!

628526998.name: Breathtaking beauty
628526998.author: a TripAdvisor user
628526998.reviewBody: No matter what you\'ve heard about this place, seeing it with your own eyes will knock you off your feet. The size and colors can only be grasped in person. Be sure to take a tour in a boat!

626723078.name: Paradise
626723078.author: a TripAdvisor user
626723078.reviewBody: This destination is off the beaten path compared to all the resorts and beaches in the area. It\'s mainly visited by locals and there are not many luxury accommodations but it\'s definitely worth the visit. There\'s not much to do but relax and swim in this beautiful crystal clear lake. You can rent a boat and go around the lake. Do stay in a place with lake views and with a little dock that takes you straight to a dive in the lake.

626149674.name: Heaven on Earth
626149674.author: a TripAdvisor user
626149674.reviewBody: Lake Bacalar is so beautiful, I wished we stayed longer to enjoy every bit of it.  I can\'t wait to go back.

624845092.name: Absolutely beautiful - for relaxing and energizing
624845092.author: a TripAdvisor user
624845092.reviewBody: Went here for a weekend and we absolutely enjoyed staying in our AirBnB there. The water was just the perfect temperature for a swim in the tranquility of the dawn.

624211914.name: Only for an afternoon.
624211914.author: a TripAdvisor user
624211914.reviewBody:
3 publics accesses where you don't pay anything. There is a long pier and at the end a piece of roof and some wood chairs where you can leave your things. 

We went in low season (oct 2018) and the dock was always full, I don't want to imagine how is it in high season. Also, the piers are all next to each other and very close, so you are next to all the people from the hotels. In one of the accesses, per example, you are only one meter from the hotel pier and there a bunch of drunk guys screaming. So, you don't get to have quiet and tranquility. 

Also, you can not swim because there are a bunch of boats passing by all the time. 

Definitely not 7 colors. Only the dark blue and turquoise. Is pretty but is everything private and fenced out and so commercial that it looses its charm. 

The manager from our hotel told us that at the beginning the lagoon was so beautiful and you could see manaties and lobsters and now you can't see anything. 

So, if you pass by, you can stop and see the lagoon in one afternoon. I wouldn't even recommend to stay the night.

623897622.name: Beautiful lagoon
623897622.author: a TripAdvisor user
623897622.reviewBody: We visited the lagoon in September and it was so gorgeous! We hung out at La Playita and enjoyed the gorgeous view. Worth a visit!

622642070.name: S t u n n i n g !!!
622642070.author: a TripAdvisor user
622642070.reviewBody:
If you're in Mexico- don't miss this place.
This is paradise.
This lagoon is siper beautiful.
Fun activities:
1. Sunrise kayaks
2. Sunset katamaran
Both are offered at CasaChina hostel.

622212952.name: MUST once in a lifetime
622212952.author: a TripAdvisor user
622212952.reviewBody: Its a BEAUTIFUL place to visit. It\'s known as de Mexican Bali, but i guess its better (sorry, i\'m mexican). There aren\'t big hotels, but there are a few nice to stay.

619102601.name: Just beautiful
619102601.author: a TripAdvisor user
619102601.reviewBody: The town doesn\u2019t feel overrun with tourists, although we were there at the rainy season. The boat tour was good with chances to swim in a few choice locations. Jumping off the concrete structure thing was also fun. The lake itself is a true natural wonder, you feel like you are at the ocean but it\u2019s all fresh water. Amazing!!

616050592.name: So beautiful!
616050592.author: a TripAdvisor user
616050592.reviewBody: Bacalar is an amazing place to visit, its always beautiful never disappoints. Definitely do the boat ride

615561927.name: Beautiful Lagoon of 7 colours
615561927.author: a TripAdvisor user
615561927.reviewBody: Amazing mostly fresh water lagoon. Nice to relax, swim, or paddle board. Contains many Cenotes (deep wells) which give rise to the beautiful different shades of blue.

614629226.name: Lake of 7 colors
614629226.author: a TripAdvisor user
614629226.reviewBody: we were recommended by our hotel hospitality concierge. We absolutely loved the lake . We went to a local municipal park which was 15 peso per person and took a boat ride .

608415493.name: Lake gorgeous - But check weather forecast.
608415493.author: a TripAdvisor user
608415493.reviewBody: We booked via Tui. Gabriel was our guide. We were supposed to visit some archeological site as well as enjoy bacalar. The forecast at start of the day was for heavy rain and thunder and the trip should have been cancelled. However the company insisted it would be fine. It wasn\u2019t . We had a 6 hour round trip for about an hour on the lagoon, plus a short walk round the fort and a mediocre lunch that we had to wait for about half an hour . We were cold and wet. We arrived back at our hotel exhausted and it just wasn\u2019t worth the journey. The lagoon in beautiful that is true .Gabriel is a nice chap but young and inexperienced not a great guide. If the weather is bad this trip is pointless. I felt ripped off\n

606351237.name: Never book a sailing trip with Paola and Johnny/Gabriel
606351237.author: a TripAdvisor user
606351237.reviewBody: As we could not find other sailing tours, at El Eden on the Bacalar town lakeside a lady named Dania referred us to Johnny/Gabriel and Paola (Tel. 998 203 6398) who ripped us off. We hardly sailed as the weather turned bad (thunderstorm) when they offered to do the trip the next day, but then they disappeared with the mxn$2000 we had paid! Thieves!

606051682.name: The best lagoon in America
606051682.author: a TripAdvisor user
606051682.reviewBody: Great lagoon, 7 coolers of water, kilometer and miles of safe waters, not salty, caribbean weather, cool town, not expensive and the best place to have a hideaway from everything..this is it

604631880.name: Amazing tour all over the lake!
604631880.author: a TripAdvisor user
604631880.reviewBody: The lake is amazing, it is clear, nice and beautiful. I took a tour and they took me to see estromatolites and had the chance to swim for a while. \nIt was a nice place to visit.

603541284.name: 7 Blues Lake...BEAUTFUL !!
603541284.author: a TripAdvisor user
603541284.reviewBody: Definitely have to check this place out. Take a boat tour of the lake, there are cool liitle places to see that only some of the local guides can take you to see. The water itself, needs to be seen with the human eye to appreciate.....there are cliffs and trees to jump from, the ship wreck and the deep spots. Check it out

601963488.name: Bacalar and seven colors lagoon
601963488.author: a TripAdvisor user
601963488.reviewBody: Took a trip to Bacalar and the Bacalar seven colors lagoon in July!! The city of Bacalar was very beautiful and seemed very tourist friendly!! The peoples personalities were just as bright as the building through the city!! The Seven Colors Lagoon was such a astounding sight!! The colors of the water throughout the day was absolute perfection!! Great fresh water to swim in as well!! Depending on which piers you go to will depend on if you can take a boat out or a small kayak, etc!! The mineral mud in the lagoon was also said to be \u201chealing\u201d so of course a mud facial was a must and great experience with our local tour guide. We cannot wait to take another trip back to Bacalar.

600871359.name: Its a Must!
600871359.author: a TripAdvisor user
600871359.reviewBody: This place is amazing. Lots of thing to do like snorkeling on crystal clear water, ski, swim, visit cenotes, rub sand SPA like, etc. \nYou can end of the visit dining at the La Playita restaurant where the food is ok but te view and vibe is great.

600495410.name: Gorgeous lake
600495410.author: a TripAdvisor user
600495410.reviewBody: This is one of the most beautiful places we\u2019ve ever seen. The water is crystal clear and gives you the feel of being in the ocean yet with no sticky salty feeling after. We definitely plan on returning in the future.

600468522.name: Bacalar lake visit
600468522.author: a TripAdvisor user
600468522.reviewBody: First time there,traveled primary to see the lake of 7 colors. Was not disappointed as lake is absolutely breathtaking. Nice colors and you can swim in it as water levels in some parts are not deep at all.. will definitely go back..

596861817.name: Stunning blue water..the Maldives of Mexico
596861817.author: a TripAdvisor user
596861817.reviewBody: Go for a swim in the beautifully warm and crystal clear water. \nYou can rent a kayak and paddle to the pirate Bay Area and use the sand/clay at the bottom to exfoliate your skin.

595299638.name: Well worth exploring!
595299638.author: a TripAdvisor user
595299638.reviewBody: If you stop by Bacalar, go do the tour of the lake and see the different colored cenotes, go for a swim. Stop for a great mud clay rub that will leave your skin soft as silk!!

594918321.name: Beautiful
594918321.author: a TripAdvisor user
594918321.reviewBody: worth the trip, love all the different shades of blue you can see. Go for a dip at one of the Balnearios municipales, will recomend " El aserradero" and also take a boat tour, better a catamaran than a motor boat.

594132058.name: Hidden gem
594132058.author: a TripAdvisor user
594132058.reviewBody: .. Bacalar is such a beautiful place and not well known, even by Mexicans.. this means it\'s not as overcrowded as many other attractions at Yucatan and worth staying at for at least 2-3 days. Definitely hire a catamaran and enjoy a day on the lake, visiting the canal de las piratas and the healing mineral muds.

593887893.name: Amazing day in Bacalar
593887893.author: a TripAdvisor user
593887893.reviewBody:
This lake is a must see.
Totally worth the 3:45 hr trip from Puerto Morelos (about 2 hr from Tulum)
It is called The Lake of Seven Colors.There are different shades of blue and turquoise,depending on how the rays of the sun hit the water and how deep it is.
I would definitely rate it 5 stars.
The reason I rate it 4 is because there’s so little information available once you get there.
It basically sums up to a bunch of local guides jumping in front of your car trying to sell your boat tours.
Also, public access to the lake is almost inexistent, which I find very disturbing.
The land next to the lake has been sold to private entities, so in order to get to the water, which is public and you are free to navigate with a boat or simply just bathe in, you need to pay a fee to get to it.
Kind of lame.
But hey the lake is wonderful.

593017919.name: Amazing
593017919.author: a TripAdvisor user
593017919.reviewBody: Spent two nights in Bacalar on our way from Tulum to Chetumal and Ambergris Caye. Well worth the stop over.  Met some great people. Bacalar is a very laid back town. Some very good restaurants and bars too. Prices were super reasonable as well. We did a sunrise paddle board tour and did a sunset boat tour. Would highly recommend both. They both went out of the Yak House Hostel. Lagoon was great to swim in and is simply breathtaking.

591018440.name: Out of this world
591018440.author: a TripAdvisor user
591018440.reviewBody: Bacalar truly is a magical place. There isn\'t too much happening in the town, but that doesn\'t matter. Stay on a lake front hotel that has a garden or jetty onto the lake and you can spend all your time in the water or relaxing by the water. Definitely do a tour so a guide can show you the really special spots on the lagoon!

590750909.name: Most beautiful lake
590750909.author: a TripAdvisor user
590750909.reviewBody: Most beautiful lake I\u2019ve ever been to.\nPerfect for boat trip and swimming, amazing colors and the waters temperature is just perfect.

589782264.name: Trip to Lake Bacalar
589782264.author: a TripAdvisor user
589782264.reviewBody: Best fresh water lake I have ever seen.  Looks just like the Caribbean Sea, but unsalted.  Lake is very long and narrow.  \n

589512882.name: Amazing views!
589512882.author: a TripAdvisor user
589512882.reviewBody: The lake is beautiful. You can snorkel, kayak, boat, etc. My kids had a blast (ages 9-16). The wind can make it difficult to swim against the current but all in all a very relaxing getaway.

588600969.name: A blissful place not to be missed!
588600969.author: a TripAdvisor user
588600969.reviewBody: I visited Lake Bacalar during Martin Luther King\'s holiday weekend, back in January. It was a solo trip, perfect to kick off the year. Rented a car in Cancun and off I went.  The little town of Bacalar is part of the designated \'pueblos magicos\'  Given its distance from the more known places to its north of the Yucatan peninsula, you do see your fare of tourists, backpackers and local tourists but you still get the flare of being in a Mexican town. People are nice, friendly and very hospitable.  What I enjoyed the most was Sunday night at the park in the central square, people were out and about, they were having salsa lessons, anyone could join...food carts...shops open...it took me back to simpler times...I live now in a big city and nice childhood memories came about.  They also had free wifi at the park, so I was able to face time and share some the experience with a loved one.  The road is well kept, didn\'t feel unsafe at all, though you do take caution not to drive at night and have common sense as you would do anywhere in the world!

587446840.name: A True definition of Paradise!
587446840.author: a TripAdvisor user
587446840.reviewBody: A true definition of paradise. Views of the 7 color lagoon is like no other. Shades of Aquamarine, Jade, Royal Blue, Emerald, Turquoise, Cobalt, & Saphire. \n\nSo much beauty and full of tranquility. Where strolling through the lagoon is just a dream of reality.

585173793.name: Unbelievable! Well worth the drive!
585173793.author: a TripAdvisor user
585173793.reviewBody: It is like one massive cenote and so breathtaking g! Well worth the 2.5 hour from tulum. Best off going to Los r\u00e1pidos for more remote views!

583209248.name: Stunning \u00fclace
583209248.author: a TripAdvisor user
583209248.reviewBody: Wonderful lake with 50 shades of turcis. Klear soft water, beautiful cenotes. Nice people around and delicious food. A must.

582874701.name: A must see part of the world!
582874701.author: a TripAdvisor user
582874701.reviewBody: Incredibly beautiful surroundings and our family loved swimming in the warm clear waters. Simply amazing and a must see part of Mexico! We visited while stopped in at Costa Maya on a Royal Caribbean cruise.

582647843.name: Amazing!
582647843.author: a TripAdvisor user
582647843.reviewBody: It really does have many colours. Rent a kayak from green monkey and check out the pirates passage to another lagoon. Water is warm and so clear. Soft white sand... What else could you want from a lagoon. Would recommend hiring jetskis if you\'re not on a budget because its too big to explore just on a kayak.

582416198.name: Paradise :)
582416198.author: a TripAdvisor user
582416198.reviewBody: This is a small paradise on earth. Surrounded by lovely small hotels (all price ranges) and delicious restaurants, it\'s all you need for a perfect getaway. Few mosquitoes, lots of sun and pristine waters.

581742321.name: Stunning
581742321.author: a TripAdvisor user
581742321.reviewBody: The views are stunning, there are lots of restaurants and bars overlooking the lake, and lots of opportunity to take a boat ride on the incredible blue waters.

581440474.name: You have to see it to believe it
581440474.author: a TripAdvisor user
581440474.reviewBody: It may look like it is a bit out of the way, but it is well worth the trip and it is not as far a it looks. The roads in Quintana Roo (and the Yucatan Peninsula) are pretty good and not very crowded.

580933770.name: Fantastico
580933770.author: a TripAdvisor user
580933770.reviewBody: Great paradise!! nice day in this place e very amazing views. DO IT!! I hope you will find beatiful days and do not go in august, too much mosquitos and hot

580849710.name: Absolutely beautiful, you have to see it to believe anything could be so blue!
580849710.author: a TripAdvisor user
580849710.reviewBody: This lagoon is one of the most beautiful natural areas I have ever seen in my life. It really does have 7 colours. Also in the morning, the sunrises are incredible, especially if you paddle out onto the lagoon in a kayak to watch.\nOne of my favourite things about the lagoon was that there are hardly any fish and the water is mostly quite clear. This meant that I felt very comfortable swimming in it. \n

580665658.name: Most Beautiful Lake!
580665658.author: a TripAdvisor user
580665658.reviewBody: This is honestly one of the most beautiful places I have ever been to! The water was so incredibly blue and clear and I did not want to leave. We were staying in Tulum and the 3 hour drive was definitely worth it.

580357690.name: Pure beauty
580357690.author: a TripAdvisor user
580357690.reviewBody: It\u2019s so beautiful. There are several public areas where you can go for free to take a swim and sunbathing. And there are tours of 2-3h that you can take out on the lake (is around 200-250pesos) and it\u2019s totally worth it!

580222593.name: Spectacular!!!
580222593.author: a TripAdvisor user
580222593.reviewBody: Pueblo magico - truly is !!! There are different shades of blue from the lightest to dark dark blue . We took a boat with tour guy which cost about 260 peso it took about 2.5 h all around lake with  few stops when we could jump in the water and enjoy this beautiful place . Water is sweet which made the experience even better:) , would highly recommend it . We stayed near Playa del Carmen and it took us 3.5 h drive , the best is to early morning so can make most of it . Plenty shops and restaurants around to get some snacks or food.

579118677.name: Magical place
579118677.author: a TripAdvisor user
579118677.reviewBody: STUNNING... Water are amazing. go swimming.\ntruly as they say.. pueblo magico.\nWe drove there twice... would soo go again.

578541618.name: One of the nicest places in Mexico
578541618.author: a TripAdvisor user
578541618.reviewBody: The views are spectacular and the water is very nice and refreshing. The water is clean and everyone is very focused on you not bringing food and things into the water. I will surely come back to this magical place. It is a true insider thing. Not many tourists there at all. Very few hotels.

578406375.name: Enchanting
578406375.author: a TripAdvisor user
578406375.reviewBody: The various hues of blue on the lake are mesmerising as it reminds you of pictures of the carribean or the Maldives.\nThe waters are quite shallow for some distance in, so plenty of fun for all swimming abilities. No need to pay for any of it.\nBe sure to visit the cenotes. Cenote Negra can be daunting as you see where the waters drop off but it\'s beautiful and cenote Azul has areas where you can swim in completo privacy.

576217042.name: WOW - magical
576217042.author: a TripAdvisor user
576217042.reviewBody: We came by car down from Playa del Carmen and didn\'t really know what to expect. We should have known, everyone we spoke to and mentioned Bacalar just went eyes wide open and said it was magical. And it is. It is a very long lake and not all places on the lake are the same, or good. We did a tour of the lake in a private boat which was great. Most places in Bacalar offer group tours, we decided to go on a private tour which was slightly more expensive but it was fab. If you take the route into town from the Cenote Azul on the Costera, there are plenty of guys waving tour brochures at you. We did take one of those and it turned out great. The starting point was Cenote Esmeralda, and it was literally someone\'s private backyard. We stopped at numerous places (most tours do this), Cenote Negro, Canal de las piratas, the bird island (just to look at not to go on, as it is a protected area), Cocalitos etc. Our captain was a young chap, who spoke little English but patiently explained the history and nature in Spanish to us. He had some water and snacks and stopped and moored the boat wherever we wanted to go for a swim. Highly recommended.

575871961.name: super blue lake
575871961.author: a TripAdvisor user
575871961.reviewBody: Try the public bathing area as it is free and has a great pier that goes into the lake in one of the best positions to swim. There is also a shop onsite that sells beer and water and some snacks.

573844227.name: Excellent view
573844227.author: a TripAdvisor user
573844227.reviewBody: The lake is beautiful and the colors are amazing. This is a hidden gem and paradise. This is a secret paradise \n\n

573357317.name: Lake Bacalar
573357317.author: a TripAdvisor user
573357317.reviewBody:
A gorgeous lake with nice swimming few mosquitos, two interesting Cenotes (the Black (or Brujo) Cenote is a bit hard to access by road but possible, easier to visit by boat.. the Blue Cenote from the road, not attached to the lake) ... When there you must take an amazing opportunity to do an early morning paddle board tour.

Its an almost quiet town that has mostly over priced restaurants, some of the places have a nice vibe... there is a fair amount of good live music on the street following the lake... If you have a car or rent bicycles and want a quieter time there are places below the city center. 

I did note some of the town business owners were rude... you get the sense in some places people came to just make money. 

If you come with good company and find a nice spot it will be a good time

573195633.name: Positive surprise, there are some colors, impressive
573195633.author: a TripAdvisor user
573195633.reviewBody: Beforehand we got some but only very few recommendations about the lagoon of Bacalar. What we saw when we arrived was impressive, the blue seemed to be photoshoped.. at least the same level like the caribbean sea. In Bacalar there is not that much to see but for some quiet time next to the lagoon it\u2019s great. There is a public pier where it\u2019s possible to swim. Would recommend it if you pass it anyway.

573175920.name: Relaxing time
573175920.author: a TripAdvisor user
573175920.reviewBody: We found a small area whit a short harbor.. but the view of the laguna is very lovely!\n\n My new favorite place!

572963887.name: One of the best places in mexico to relax and have fun
572963887.author: a TripAdvisor user
572963887.reviewBody: I visited lake bacalar in january and it was one of the best places i have ever visited in my life. Water is clear and sweet, you can swim or just chill in the lake. Highly recommended!

572724163.name: beautiful
572724163.author: a TripAdvisor user
572724163.reviewBody: Gorgeous, clear, blue and green water. Calm, perfect for kayaking. We did an early morning kayak and saw a ton of birds. The little town is cute, we dropped off our laundry and picked it up next day. They have a public balenario where you can swim for free.

572645520.name: Beautiful Crystal Clear water
572645520.author: a TripAdvisor user
572645520.reviewBody: Beautiful lake with such clear water. The only slight down side is having to gain access via a "beach club" if you want to swim and have sun bathe.

572455650.name: Magical placee!!!
572455650.author: a TripAdvisor user
572455650.reviewBody: I super recommend it! An amazing experience, you will not see all of those shades of blue anywhere else.

570259639.name: Different colors
570259639.author: a TripAdvisor user
570259639.reviewBody: Bacalar is known for its seven colors, you can appreciate at the edge of the lagoon or by boat. If you take the boat tour, you will know two cenotes, birds island and have an exfoliant experience. \nThis place has any kind of restaurants from local to gourmet. \nWe spend our day in a little hut for 10 pesos per person all day, it has an entrance to the lagoon.

569588335.name: 2 days
569588335.author: a TripAdvisor user
569588335.reviewBody: Bacalar is such a beautiful place to relax. You don\'t have much things to do there but the color of the water is amazing. It\'s really worth it to go there !

569354729.name: Stunning blue water!
569354729.author: a TripAdvisor user
569354729.reviewBody: Beautiful clear blue water and very shallow so pleasant for swimming. We took a boat trip around the lake (250 pesos each) stopping at various points to swim. The sulphurous mud makes your skin v smooth!

569339279.name: Love it!!
569339279.author: a TripAdvisor user
569339279.reviewBody: this is an amazing place. paradise on earth, just hope it keeps quiet and unspoiled, not as most of the mexican yucatan peninsula

568920551.name: Beautiful Lake being destroyed by humans
568920551.author: a TripAdvisor user
568920551.reviewBody: Bacalar used to be a peaceful town with a lagoon that would take your breath away. If you want to see it before people ruin this place come soon and if you do, pick up your trash. I can see why the local residents aren\u2019t too happy. \nIf you are a dog lover, also beware. The town has a over population of stray dogs that is simply heart breaking.

568871499.name: Boat tour is great view around the lagoon
568871499.author: a TripAdvisor user
568871499.reviewBody:
We usually do not take tours. We like to do things on our own, so we were skeptical about the boat tour. Since it was reasonably priced we went for it. I really enjoyed our 2 hours. 

We saw cenote Negro (bruha) and swam in the shallows next to cenote Esmeralda. The guide asked if anyone wanted to swim over the 100 meter Negro, but none of us did. It was early and we weren't hot enough I guess. It would have been eerie due to the depth and darkness, and the cove was shady too.

We drove around cenote Cocalitos to see the stromalitos, but you really have to go there and swim amongst them on another visit. See my review on Cocalitos. 

Our final stop was at the Pirate Canal. The water was shallow and warm and we had a sulfer mud bath to purify our skin.

I also enjoyed seeing the houses and hotels alone the coast. To find the tour, go down to the beach road from the square near the fort. There are several to choose from, we used Y por que no? The boats wait until they are full before going out. There were about 12 on ours. Bacalar lake truly is a beautiful natural wonder, and I  hope it does not become spoiled with commercialism.

568786273.name: Who needs Cancun?
568786273.author: a TripAdvisor user
568786273.reviewBody: Lagoon fed by cenotes with fresh water. Average depth 1.75 meters or close to 6 feet. As beautiful as the Tulum\'s beaches.

568096034.name: Beautiful!
568096034.author: a TripAdvisor user
568096034.reviewBody: The best place to visit in Quintana Roo...forget about Tulum and Holbox...Bacalar is HOT HOT HOT!! Super chilled vibes, amazing food and the lagoon is outstanding!!

568095320.name: Best Place in Quintana Roo
568095320.author: a TripAdvisor user
568095320.reviewBody: Amazing Town, beautiful people, superb restaurants, the lagoon is astonishing!! Cant miss it if you come to Quintana Roo!!

567876479.name: Very nice place
567876479.author: a TripAdvisor user
567876479.reviewBody: It looks like the Caribbean sea but it\'s not !  This is a seriously pretty lake and when we were there it seems relatively tourist free. Only spent one night here but wish it had been more.\n\nThe colours are extraordinary and it makes for some very pretty photos !

567785397.name: Fantastic place
567785397.author: a TripAdvisor user
567785397.reviewBody: Go to the other side of the lake with a kayak and enjoy the beaty of the lake close to the pirate canal. So amazing!!!

566756782.name: Beautiful blues
566756782.author: a TripAdvisor user
566756782.reviewBody: A magical lake with excellent swimming.  So many beautiful shades of blue.  A sleepy town with great restaurants

566067185.name: Vacation
566067185.author: a TripAdvisor user
566067185.reviewBody: Great option to disconnect from the world, make water activities like swimming, kayak, sightseeing of water holes "cenotes"

565682616.name: Pueblo magico
565682616.author: a TripAdvisor user
565682616.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful places i have been. The lagoon is breathtaking. I hope it will stay this way forever so we van go back some day and sail again on the most beautiful lake in the world...

565469720.name: Warning to Backpackers/Budgeters: Expensive
565469720.author: a TripAdvisor user
565469720.reviewBody: The lake itself is beautiful and definitely worth the trip. But after two and a half months travelling through Mexico this small, ramshackle town unexpectedly had the highest prices of anywhere in Mexico, including Tulum or Mexico City. Food prices and activities were catering for package tourists.

565136287.name: It\u2019s the prettiest lake I\u2019ve ever seen
565136287.author: a TripAdvisor user
565136287.reviewBody: I totally loved my time at this place. The view, the weather, the colors of the water. It really shows 7 colors. I wish I could stayed there longer. I highly recommend it

564946088.name: Worth the trip
564946088.author: a TripAdvisor user
564946088.reviewBody: We made special trip down from Tulum to see the lake. The colors are amazing and water is warm. Take a boat trip and enjoy the day. We spent the night and enjoyed the small town and were not rushed. I would not try to do it in one day from Tulum.

564904782.name: Beautiful fresh water lagoon an unexpected surprise
564904782.author: a TripAdvisor user
564904782.reviewBody: This inland respite was discovered when a local attempted to help us find an alternative to the windswept shores of our planned excursion which was covered in seaweed. We took a taxi ride round trip and the driver awaited us while we swan and ate in a private beach club along the shore. This lagoon really is crystal clear FRESH water. The rice from the cruise port was about 1.25 hours and down a two lane road (we thought we could be kidnapped possibly). Recommend going with a large group. It is really stunning!

564872759.name: One of the best views ever!
564872759.author: a TripAdvisor user
564872759.reviewBody: I really enjoy this beautiful lagoon.\nIt is amazing the colors and the quiet place it is. \nDefinitely  one of the places of Mexico you must visit.

564694243.name: Great place to visit
564694243.author: a TripAdvisor user
564694243.reviewBody: Really worth it. Do a kayak tour or some activity on the lakes. Visit the "rapidos" without fail, you can\'t miss them.

562767672.name: Bacalar and 7 colors Lake!!!
562767672.author: a TripAdvisor user
562767672.reviewBody: Bacalar is consider a pueblo m\u00e1gico Wich is a magic small town and no wonder why!!! Is beautiful, peaceful, laid-back and safe place. Friendly and kind people. I paid a boat tour that took me around of three cenotes that are inside of the blue lagoon, these cenotes give a dramatic changes of blue to the lagoon and also took me to the canal where I was able to exfoliate my skin with mud Wich is good for the skin since the water is high in sulfur. Definitely one of my favorites places to come back.

562024358.name: Secret paradise
562024358.author: a TripAdvisor user
562024358.reviewBody: This is just all I ever dreamed of. Great turquoise water to swim in, fantastic Caba\u00f1as just by the lagoon, or bring your own tent. The prices are very good when it comes to stay over, food and drinks. I would like to stay here and skip Chichen Itz\u00e1 tomorrow.

562007150.name: Great Place to Visit
562007150.author: a TripAdvisor user
562007150.reviewBody: I might not stay there for more than a few days but it is a nice distraction while travelling through Mexico. The public beach / pier is a great place to hang out for the day.

561620195.name: Heavenly
561620195.author: a TripAdvisor user
561620195.reviewBody: Beautiful white sand lake with shades of blue reminiscent of the Caribbean.  Great place for snorkeling, kayaking, wildlife viewing, or quite simply getting away from it all.  Spent two days in the area with my significant other and we can\'t wait to return.

559028778.name: Worth Seeing
559028778.author: a TripAdvisor user
559028778.reviewBody: We took a long boring ride from Playa del Carmen to Lake Bacalar for an overnight trip.    Lake Bacalar is worth the trip!!!    Charlie (contact at Hotel Villas Esmeralda) arranged for a pontoon boat to pick 4 of us at the hotel dock to take us on a private tour of the lake. He made several stops to give us a chance to swim in the cenotes and rub the fine powder sand at the Pirates canal ( this was a highlight) and see the many different colors and depths of this amazing lake. Photos do not do it justice ... it is a must see.

558459345.name: Beautiful lake
558459345.author: a TripAdvisor user
558459345.reviewBody: This place is stunning totally recommend staying here. The boat ride was so worth it, taking you around to cenotes etc and having time to stop and cool off was excellent.

558181637.name: It truly is the lake of 7 colors
558181637.author: a TripAdvisor user
558181637.reviewBody: Had a few rainy days but finally got out on the lake, on a beautiful sail boat trip. It was gorgeous! We were a bit hesitant towards coverings ourselves in the (stinky!) mud, but the skin did feel softer afterwards, as promised. Just adore all the colors of this lake!

557448539.name: Beautiful
557448539.author: a TripAdvisor user
557448539.reviewBody: Took public transport to Bacalar from Mahahual. Was amazed with the beauty of the lake, pictures do not do it justice. We enjoyed a boat tour with a bit of swimming and a lovely meal out. Wonderful day trip and would like to go back and stay for a week. Hopefully next year.

557180062.name: Diverse adventures on Laguna Bacalar
557180062.author: a TripAdvisor user
557180062.reviewBody: We took a stand up paddle through the mangrove channels and also visited the cenote located within the lagoon. Picturesque views every direction you look and at every time of day. Highly recommended!

556560715.name: Stunning!
556560715.author: a TripAdvisor user
556560715.reviewBody:
We spent a better part of our day here on January 19th as part of our tour with Outand About Tours. The weather was cloudy for most of the morning and luckily, by the time we arrived at Lake Bacalar, the sun was out. To say the views were spectacular is an understatement. The water changed colours before our eyes and it was such a sight to see. 

We also swam in the Black Cenote and shallow waters of the cleansing part of the waters. 

If we were to return, I'd do a full day excursion, or stay in this area, to enjoy the magnitude of what this location has to offer.

556194158.name: Pueblo Magico Pirata
556194158.author: a TripAdvisor user
