556194158.reviewBody: Excellent to visit with your friends or family, there are places to eat in the town and its surroundings, with public and private access to the lagoon, you can venture into one of them or stay in the town enjoying its history and gastronomy.\nExcelente para visitar con tus amigos o familia, hay lugares para comer en el pueblo y sus alrededores, con balnearios p\u00fablicos y privado, te puedes aventurar en auto a uno de ellos o quedarte en el pueblo disfrutando de su historia y gastronom\u00eda.

555697037.name: Beautiful Turquoise water
555697037.author: a TripAdvisor user
555697037.reviewBody: This beautiful lake is not to be missed. Unbelievable fresh water lake in the most gorgeous aquamarine shades of blue/green. Warm, shallow..

555654775.name: Beautiful lake
555654775.author: a TripAdvisor user
555654775.reviewBody:
Gorgeous lake awesome for sailing ,kayaking perhaps stand up paddlebord! 

I recommend bringing some water shoes as the lake has a soft bottom and there is thin lake shell and I cut the bottom of my foot on one !!

554918435.name: relaxing time in the jungle/baclar lagoon
554918435.author: a TripAdvisor user
554918435.reviewBody: I just recover from a very intense work/studying year 2017 by disconnecting and entering into the jungle. I stayed in a ecofriendly house/apartment (casa Aqabal) isolated of hotels, restaurants and turists. The lagoon, the sunrises, the moon rises, the massages and the family time were the things it made it possible.

553259451.name: Awesome!!!!
553259451.author: a TripAdvisor user
553259451.reviewBody: Absolutely beautiful and awesome place to relax. You can enter for 3 pesos and enjoy the beautiful lake with its awesome colours. One of my favourite places in Mexiko!!

552586485.name: Go now before this goes the way of the Riviera Maya
552586485.author: a TripAdvisor user
552586485.reviewBody: The lake is beautiful, tranquil, and all around amazing, but recently  laws were changed to allow speedboats and jetskis. Along with the fertilizer seeping in to feed invasive speeches and momentum towards more and more overdevelopement, it may not be the same place in a few years.\n

552342444.name: Beautiful seven colors lagoon for a day trip
552342444.author: a TripAdvisor user
552342444.reviewBody: Take a romantic boat ride or with friends around the lagoon. It\u2019s a 2-3 hour tour where you can take a swim or do a sulfur mud mask. \nI wouldn\u2019t recommend more than 2 days there. We arrived afternoon, spent the night and left the next day at sunset. \nHave fun!!

552310503.name: Wow
552310503.author: a TripAdvisor user
552310503.reviewBody: This was the main point of the travel, the lagoon is just amazing, don\'t miss the pirates channel, spend at least 1 hour there, you can exfoliate with the mud.

552109123.name: Nice place
552109123.author: a TripAdvisor user
552109123.reviewBody: Nice place to spend time there.\nOwners need to make people respect nature.\nI cannot believe that some people do not care about the nature throwing garbage to the lake.

551029647.name: Best stop on our trip
551029647.author: a TripAdvisor user
551029647.reviewBody: We had planned to dive but the weather was iffy. Our dive shop suggested we drive here for the day instead. It was simply amazing. We were too late for the boat tours but instead rented kayaks and had a blast. It\u2019s gorgeous, like really crazy breathtaking gorgeous, and it is fresh water. I assumed it was salt. For whatever reason this made it even more amazing. Our best unexpected bonus was seeing a random flick of flamingos, we had no idea they lived here. I honestly wish this is where we stayed rather than on the beach.

550316433.name: Sensational
550316433.author: a TripAdvisor user
550316433.reviewBody: I\'d never heard of Bacalar before being recommended by fellow backpackers. I had the best 3 nights here, staying at Yak hostel right on the lake. You can do SUP, kayaking, boat tours or just go for a swim. There\'s Sulfur near the pirate ship so you can have a natural mud bath, or just enjoy the lake and it\'s many shades of blue

550145701.name: Beautiful!!
550145701.author: a TripAdvisor user
550145701.reviewBody: No words can describe it! You need to go see all the colors and views it offers! It is a magic place.

548911146.name: Paradise
548911146.author: a TripAdvisor user
548911146.reviewBody: Quiet friendly beautiful a place we\u2019re you can relax and enjoy Mexico. The lake is pristine, the town has restaurants and hotels within walking distance of the few public access points to the lake. Take tours to enjoy the what the lake has to offer

548501599.name: Worth to go!
548501599.author: a TripAdvisor user
548501599.reviewBody: After Playa del Carmen, this is the best way to escape the city and chill. The lake with its different colors is something I was happy to see. Also - do a Stand up Paddle Board Tour with @whatsupbacala! Magic.

548133812.name: Amazing
548133812.author: a TripAdvisor user
548133812.reviewBody: The lake was amazing, you must see it preferably without clouds to appreciate the different colors really nice. The boat tour is a must as it takes you to all interesting places in the lake: Cenotes to swim, the pirate\'s canal for the mud and the Stromatolites. The only other options would be kayaking and paddle board as there is no way to walk along the shore.

547705091.name: Beautiful Lagoon
547705091.author: a TripAdvisor user
547705091.reviewBody: Absolutely beautiful lagoon. Tour was amazing. Tour guide Tania and our driver Roberto were wonderful and very friendly. I highly recommend to take this tour of Bacalar. Truly great experience!

547581997.name: SUP in the Lagoon
547581997.author: a TripAdvisor user
547581997.reviewBody: We did an SUP Sunrise tour with Blue Monkey Hostel and was a fantastic experience, the landscape with the first light of the day, even with during the rain is stunning!

546714862.name: Beautiful lagoon
546714862.author: a TripAdvisor user
546714862.reviewBody: It\'s really beautiful, for colors and everything, sorkeling experience doesn\'t worth too much.\nThe town is fantastic. Quite, nice at the evening, nice places to drink and eat.

546568641.name: Beautiful Laggon
546568641.author: a TripAdvisor user
546568641.reviewBody: Beautiful place with relatively few tourists (comparing, obviously). However very hard to reach by yourself, access always private and through payed activities

545763426.name: Amazing Colour
545763426.author: a TripAdvisor user
545763426.reviewBody: We loved it! The colour was great. Unfortunately, there isn\'t much to do it it\'s raining. You areen\'t allowed to take bottles into the Public Bath.

543576768.name: Best place to visit while in Quintana Roo
543576768.author: a TripAdvisor user
543576768.reviewBody:
Bacalar is just the best place I visited in Quintana Roo. 
The lagoon is an amazin experience, the day trip to visit the cenotes and the Canal de los Piratas, plus Isla de Pájaros was only 250 pesos. 
There are plenty activities for you to do in the water or in the town. 
Strongly recommend to do several trips, the rapids, viewing Los estromatolitos (super unique formations!), getting exfoliated in el canal de los piratas. Spending the night in the town for dinner, etc. 
Unlike the negative comments, I have to say this town is very safe, I traveled solo and the park is very nice, there are taxi drivers all over the place, they offered good rates for the trips and there is accommodation for all budgets.

ADO station is close and convis are also available. From Cancun to here by bus the rate is around 360 pesos. The ride is 5 hours and 30 minutes. You can also get there from Playa del Carmen, I got a special rate ticket for only 168 pesos.
Tulum is about 3 hours and a half away, ADO buses are not always available, so you can take a convi for 60 pesos to a near town called Carrillo and from there another to Tulum.

This place deserves you staying for at least a couple of nights!

542728060.name: Amazing and breath-taking views
542728060.author: a TripAdvisor user
542728060.reviewBody: The waters of the lagoon are absolutely incredible!! We did a 2-hour boat tour with the local cooperativa (250$/person) and it was so worth it! Colours are incredible and soooooo blue!

542336982.name: I couldn\u2019t believe my eyes.
542336982.author: a TripAdvisor user
542336982.reviewBody: This natural fen\u00f3meno is the most amazing place. Several \u201c cenotes\u201d covered by pristine water and extra white sand. \nPlease don\u2019t miss this place, is totally amazing.

541020612.name: Amzing place to see
541020612.author: a TripAdvisor user
541020612.reviewBody: Every color of blue you can imagine, pristine lake not yet ruined by mass tourism or all inclusives.Take a tour paddle board kayak etc.. you cant go wrong visting this location

539565953.name: Beautiful colors, some nice activities
539565953.author: a TripAdvisor user
539565953.reviewBody: The lagoon, sun permitting, has some great colors! You get to swim in crystal clear waters, have sulphur exfoliation for free and some great activities! If you are interested in sailing try the veleando ando bacalar. They are great!

539528913.name: Beautiful but watch crowded areas
539528913.author: a TripAdvisor user
539528913.reviewBody: On a sunny day, the color of the Lagoon is more turquoise than most anywhere in the Caribbean. The Lagoon of Seven Colors changes shaded of blue based on the changes in the sky above.  No lake like you\u2019ve seen before.\n\nMost of hotels, resorts and public access are near town of Bacalar.  Very crowded on weekends with guests, locals, and Mauhaul cruise passengers.  Southern end is shallower, bluer, less crowded, and more beautiful.  We took a 2 hour tour of the Lagoon to see firsthand.  If you\u2019re an overnight guests book a hotel at this end.  If a day guest, Ive heard some hotels will sell a day pass.  I do not have any info on which will though.

538758708.name: AMAZING
538758708.author: a TripAdvisor user
538758708.reviewBody: Just like the pictures, no photoshop! Magic place, the water is the most beautiful I\'ve seen in my love. Just GO

538284918.name: Amazing
538284918.author: a TripAdvisor user
538284918.reviewBody: This place is just from another world! The colors are very beautiful and you can do several activities! We did the tour and paddel surf. We had so much fun! The people is very nice and welcoming with a great sense of preservation. Beautiful!!!!

536626582.name: Feels Like Heaven
536626582.author: a TripAdvisor user
536626582.reviewBody: There might not be a more tranquil place in all of Mexico. Lake Bacalar has an unearthly feel, surreal, beautiful, breath taking and awe inspiring. It is one of the best of nature\'s gifts that we get to enjoy. The multi colored waters are inviting and soothing. Float, swim, boat or simply gaze upon and be moved. Lake Bacalar is special.

535239510.name: Nice Place
535239510.author: a TripAdvisor user
535239510.reviewBody: Nice Place. Nothing more to say. Oh I have to write 100 chars.....?!? Guacamole, taco, nacho, avocado...

533224890.name: Magical Bacalar
533224890.author: a TripAdvisor user
533224890.reviewBody:
Bacalar Lagoon is a must if you are in Playa del Carmen, Cancun or Tulum. It's the most beautiful lagoon you'll ever see. 

Known for its 7 shades of blue...it's breathtaking. Opt for a guided boat tour so you get to see everything there is to see.  You can also explore in a Kayak or simply on your own. 

It's a very quiet an serene place. A few days here is perfect. You can easily find hotels in every price range. 

It's aproximately a 3 hour drive from PdC

It's a must!

532659976.name: Much better than the ocean!!
532659976.author: a TripAdvisor user
532659976.reviewBody: This is one of the best places i have visited in terms of lagoons, lakes and oceans.. and i have been around. The lagoon has 7 cenotes and a variation of deepness that makes it fun for everyone, kids will fine areas where the water is knee level and for the adults places where the water is 90mts deep. The colors of the lagoon change depending on the area, the water is mostly warm, so great for a midnight swim...

532494084.name: AMAZING
532494084.author: a TripAdvisor user
532494084.reviewBody: Wow, amazing lake that has great spots to chill, swim and see the different colors of the lake\n\nMake sure you go to the Cocalitos beach - great spot!

530545473.name: Beautiful lagoon
530545473.author: a TripAdvisor user
530545473.reviewBody: You should definitely take a boat trip on the beautiful lagoon while you are there. There are 3 cenotes to be seen as well during the trip. It is a fresh water lagoon and the water is just amazing

528918336.name: \u05de\u05e7\u05d5\u05dd \u05d9\u05e4\u05d4 \u05d1\u05d9\u05d5\u05ea\u05e8 The most beautiful place
528918336.author: a TripAdvisor user
528918336.reviewBody:
We took a cruise in Laguna as part of an organized tour.
You can easily do this trip on your own.
An amazing lagoon with crystal clear water.
עשינו שייט בלגונה במסגרת טיול מאורגן.
בקלות אפשר לעשות לבד את הטיול הזה.
לגונה מדהימה עם מים צלולים ויפים.

528607736.name: Boat tour
528607736.author: a TripAdvisor user
528607736.reviewBody: This place is stunningly beautiful. I wish I stayed overnight at one of the hostels there. I will be back again one day!

527836131.name: Breath-taking
527836131.author: a TripAdvisor user
527836131.reviewBody: Absolutely stunning ....... Calm, clean and gloriously blue.  The perfect place to swim, relax and chill out.  Don\'t miss it.

527780270.name: In love!
527780270.author: a TripAdvisor user
527780270.reviewBody: This place is simply amazing! You will instantly fall in love with the colors you\'ll be able to see. There\'s not much to do though, if you\'re an active person then you should not spend more than two days in the lagoon or you\'ll get bored. But it\'s totally worth visiting.

527575071.name: Amazing!
527575071.author: a TripAdvisor user
527575071.reviewBody: We were 2 couples that took private boat the a guide, the guide was great and told us cool stories about the lake and the area, very relaxing tour! super fun!

526861536.name: What can I say?
526861536.author: a TripAdvisor user
526861536.reviewBody:
No really, what can I say? This place does all the speaking for itself really.

The Lake of seven colours is a must-see wonder of Mexico which makes you feel as if you're in paradise.

Swimming in it at the public swimming areas is a delight. I'd highlight recommend getting a boat out to the pirate canal though which is another level of beauty.

525269095.name: A natural pool!
525269095.author: a TripAdvisor user
525269095.reviewBody: This place is amazing to relax a couple of days, the lake has several colors and its great to swim, kayak and just enjoy the view

524500415.name: Amazing
524500415.author: a TripAdvisor user
524500415.reviewBody: \nThe water of Lagoon Bacalar is among the most pale and gem like blue that could possibly exist. The main attraction of travelling to this area is the 7 colours Lagoon, whose beauty could easily induce one to sit and read for a few days without regret. The Lagoon (fresh water) is somewhat shallow at the shores, except where there are sinkholes commonly known as cenotes. It is well seen by kayak or sailboat. The sand when disturbed smells strongly of minerals or sulfur, though sitting by the lagoon or even being on the water certainly carried no odor whatsoever. The Fortress de San Felipe Bacalar, in the center of town, represents one of the bastions used by the Maya before they were overrun by the Spanish, it has a small but modern museum inside, if you are in town it\u00b4s worthwhile visiting. On Sunday night, there may be music and dancing in the city square.

522985359.name: Beautiful place! Clearest water!
522985359.author: a TripAdvisor user
522985359.reviewBody: Was here two days ago. Took a  taxi outside from te port of Costa Maya. If you want a more authentic experience I would choose to taxi there and not from the "cruise package people". The taxidriver drive us to Cenote azul, Beautiful water and authentic mexican food! Later he drive us to Balacar laguna azul! One of the nicest place ive been!!! So clear and blue water!!! Omg wanna go back:)

518323790.name: Magical place!
518323790.author: a TripAdvisor user
518323790.reviewBody: This is one of the most amazing places ive ever been to. Highly recommend the paddle sunrise tour the yak lakehouse offers!

517823210.name: Amazing colours
517823210.author: a TripAdvisor user
517823210.reviewBody: The no s t amazing lagoon I have ever seen the colours are magnificent. Just relax swim and enjoy the beautiful surroundings you do not need more!

516884663.name: Beautiful
516884663.author: a TripAdvisor user
516884663.reviewBody: The water is clear and it changes colors depending on how deep it is. We took a bout out to laguna de 7 colores and it could go from 4 feet to 900 meter!! And the water is sweet not salted!!! Beautiful !! Just Beautiful!! I wish I could have a house on this Lake!!

511568438.name: Incredible lagoon, amazing natural colors
511568438.author: a TripAdvisor user
511568438.reviewBody: This place has an amazing view. The lagoon is great for swimming. You do not need to do much effort to swim. The water is incredibly clear, you can see what\'s in it! The water is warm! Is like a big natural pool! We spent a great time with the friends! Is a must!

510263881.name: The best freshwater swimming in Yucatan
510263881.author: a TripAdvisor user
510263881.reviewBody: Bacalar town looks not what probably Tulum and Playa del Carmen looked like 30 years ago. The cost of a meal, drink or accommodation is a fraction what you pay up in the commercialised north.  The best feature is the lagoon with wonderful colours at sunrise and sunsets and the best freshwater swimming imaginable.  Wonderful!

508914245.name: My favorite place in all of mexico
508914245.author: a TripAdvisor user
508914245.reviewBody: As a Mexican I can proudly say that this, (for the last 4 years) is the best place in mexico. Beautiful and authentic. There\'s nothing better than enjoying the lagoon without the annoying things about the sea or a pool. The lagoon is great because it\'s warm, no waves, it\'s not salt water, and it\'s not a pool filled with chemicals

507901458.name: Beauty at it\'s best
507901458.author: a TripAdvisor user
507901458.reviewBody: Beautiful. Can\'t say much more really. You have to see it. Also, town here is really cool. Go walking around the streets. Lots of shops and places to eat. Stop and get some fresh fruit from a street stand. Nothing like fresh fruit and it\'s SO cheap!!

507242485.name: Oustanding area to visit in good weather
507242485.author: a TripAdvisor user
507242485.reviewBody: We stayed on the lagoon and also did a 3 hours boat trip - swimming in ceynotes and checking out the stinky clay. The area is not overly touristy which was great. No big built up hotels etc. Groups were fairly small - no big boats with 50+ people on them. Water was fantastic to swim in. Visually there were so many shades of blue. If you love water you will love Bacalar.  Very relaxing couple of days with a good choice for food.

505962686.name: Summer vacations
505962686.author: a TripAdvisor user
505962686.reviewBody: Family trip for summer. It has to be one lf the most beautiful and relaxing places on earth.\n\nHave to buy a place here.

502882395.name: Beautiful gem
502882395.author: a TripAdvisor user
502882395.reviewBody: What a beautiful lake, with so many different shades of blue. We stopped there for lunch and it was well worth the detour. The water was warm and perfect for kayaking.

501308624.name: A must see!!!
501308624.author: a TripAdvisor user
501308624.reviewBody: This place is one of the most beautiful waters I ever see, is. Fresh, clean and quiet, we love it, even when the weather wasn\'t great we have clouds we enjoyed so much This is a Gem \ud83d\udc8e

500979426.name: Fresh, Clean and Fun!
500979426.author: a TripAdvisor user
500979426.reviewBody: Visited the seven blue Bacalar Lagon! Loved it no beach yet, it has fresh water very refreshing clean locations! Jumping, diving and Running off the board walks into the water! had a Blast! Listening to relaxing music! With some cold beers enjoying the view and moment!

500168442.name: Beautiful lake
500168442.author: a TripAdvisor user
500168442.reviewBody: We did a nice 3 hour boattour on the lake and saw all the interesting spots. We stopped twice for snorkeling. Very nice, very relaxing nothing very exciting but worth doing if it is on your way

500094541.name: Why a wounderful lagoon
500094541.author: a TripAdvisor user
500094541.reviewBody: Beautiful types of blue, warm waters, like a pool, nice place to pick nic, for family or couples, a must en this area, its big, can go in Car, tour, there ar\u00e9 public and privates areas depends one you

497238464.name: Caribbean Sea Colored Lagoon
497238464.author: a TripAdvisor user
497238464.reviewBody: This fresh water lagoon is shallow and warm, making for perfect swimming conditions. Nice stopover on the way South to Belize.

496957626.name: GO GO GO
496957626.author: a TripAdvisor user
496957626.reviewBody: Amazing, there is nothing more to say, other than you need to go! It is incredible, beautiful and no pictures will every do it justice.

495184901.name: Swimming Competion here.. awesome place! If you go to this town stay at El Rancho Encantado!
495184901.author: a TripAdvisor user
495184901.reviewBody: Beautiful Lake / Lagoon , the water was like bath water and you could see the bottom of the Lagoon. !

494399644.name: Stunning!
494399644.author: a TripAdvisor user
494399644.reviewBody: The most beautiful lagoon I have ever seen plus a water temperature that makes it absolutely perfect.

494290878.name: Beautiful and interesting
494290878.author: a TripAdvisor user
494290878.reviewBody: The water is over 90 degrees, even in the deep cenotes.  Amazing colors and a beautiful setting.  Unfortunately, much of the coastline is private and inaccessible.  However, we did swim in the black cenote which is about 80 meters across and 100 meters deep and adjacent to shore.  Swimming away from shore to cross the cenote was challenging against the wind and current, but the return was quick!  Apparently there are swimming races across the whole laguna at different times.

491624579.name: Most beautiful lake
491624579.author: a TripAdvisor user
491624579.reviewBody: The lake is so beautiful. It\'s the color of the Caribbean Sea but without the rough waves or salt water. There are a few public "balnearios" where you can access the lake for free. If you go early in the morning, there\'s a chance you\'ll have the area to yourself for a little bit and it\'s so relaxing. The water is such a nice temperature, it was never too cold for us. We could stay in the lake for hours and completely destress ourselves. This is a gem in Mexico and I feel blessed to have been able to experience it. It\'s also not very touristy at all, so HURRY before too many people start coming and things change!

491294882.name: Amazing view
491294882.author: a TripAdvisor user
491294882.reviewBody: Its great pleace , nice view and amazing cinholes "cenotes" in the lake, the water isn\'t deep,  maybe 1.40 meters,  but the sand in the bottom its diferent to the sea, its look like a mud , but clean and withe.\nYou can swim here :)

488677503.name: Beatuiful lack
488677503.author: a TripAdvisor user
488677503.reviewBody: great place for a 2-3 nights. stay in a hostel or hotel on the lake for total relxation\nMust try the morning sunrise paddleboard - Green Monkey

488279785.name: Great spot, must see in Yucatan!
488279785.author: a TripAdvisor user
488279785.reviewBody:
We followed a recommendation to make a stopp on our way from Belize to Cancun and are so happy we did that! It was the most beautiful place we visited in Yucatan!

The lake is amazing with its colours and so far there aren't so many tourists jet! 

We can only recommend this place!

485356929.name: Stunning
485356929.author: a TripAdvisor user
485356929.reviewBody: This is one of the most beautiful places we\'ve visited in Mexico.  Off the beaten trail too so you can really enjoy swimming without hoards of other people around! The municipal swimming bit is lovely.

484490143.name: What lake is better for swimming?
484490143.author: a TripAdvisor user
484490143.reviewBody: What a cool and unique lake! The water is the prettiest shades of blue and apparently always a good temperature for swimming.  I started each day with a quick dip it was so nice. Very little plant life or fish in here; it\'s pretty much a 60km long pool. We took a small group tour of the lake and really learned a lot about it, so I recommend doing that you visit here.

484212733.name: Relaxing and beautiful!
484212733.author: a TripAdvisor user
484212733.reviewBody: Beautiful view and very relaxing. One of Mexico\'s hidden gems. Not touritsy at all! Loved it as a couple.

483991788.name: Relax
483991788.author: a TripAdvisor user
483991788.reviewBody: It was amazing that this place was so unreal. It\'s like from a movie. Too bad that my stay was so short although we spent over ten days over there.

481202548.name: Clear Blue Warm Water - Villas Ecotucan
481202548.author: a TripAdvisor user
481202548.reviewBody: We saw a sign on the end of the road and popped into this eco village. We were pleasantly surprised by the helpfulness of the staff and the setting. We decided to stay two night and booked a lake eco tour on Kayaks. We had such a great time, the tour was 3 hours and we got to learn all about the area. The accommodation is set in the forest which provides a setting.

481027600.name: Heaven!
481027600.author: a TripAdvisor user
481027600.reviewBody: Paradise! We booked a visit with a boat and had an amazing time! We were staying in a hostel (Blue Monkey) with a view on the Lake.

480000230.name: Incredible visit lake should a wonder of the World
480000230.author: a TripAdvisor user
480000230.reviewBody: Bacalar lake is Crystal clear fed by fresh water Aquafiers  that constantly drain into lake making it one of to purest bodies  of fresh water in the world it is 3 miles wide and about 35 miles long. No fish because no food or anything  to eat it drains into ocean and no seawater enters lake is slightly higher elevation than sea . Bacalar is about 4 hour drive south of Cancun

479739859.name: Amazing place
479739859.author: a TripAdvisor user
479739859.reviewBody: It is really a place worth to visit. Everything is amazing, the weather, the food, the many views. Lot of things to do right there.

478856694.name: Mexico Wonders, 7 colors, marvelous
478856694.author: a TripAdvisor user
478856694.reviewBody: This place should be a must for every traveler, this lagoon I can say is the most beautiful in the world. With 47kms and cenotes, you can enjoy it by boat, from a restaurant, by swimming or doing any other aquatic sport. Please keep it clean, use ecofriendly FPS

478560093.name: Amazing lake - almost like Caribbean blue waters
478560093.author: a TripAdvisor user
478560093.reviewBody: Been traveling here for 15 years as we own property in Buenavista at the north end. Always enjoy our time here. Will be back in December.

478079103.name: Wonderful
478079103.author: a TripAdvisor user
478079103.reviewBody: The lagoon is simply astonishing. The different colors of the water are amazing. Lots of things to do, water sports, kayaking, swimming, birds watching, etc.

478006892.name: Gorgeous, rivals any beach in the world.
478006892.author: a TripAdvisor user
478006892.reviewBody: This place is so unbelievably beautiful, it would give ANY beach/lake in the world a run for its money. It has cenotes within the lake, it has unbelievable colors and gorgeous views. We took a boat ride and saw most of the lake. Well worth the ride from Cancun and a great place to spend several days at. The local tourist industry is very focused on keeping this place pristine. They used to allow a sea-doo race through the lake but that stopped 3 years ago due to environmental concerns. if you can go to Bacalar, please do, your mind and soul will thank you for it!

477825589.name: Lovely Bacalar
477825589.author: a TripAdvisor user
477825589.reviewBody: The lagoon is one of the most beautiful natural wonders in Qunitana Roo.  Highly recommended as a base for exploration to the Maya site of Chaachoben and Kohunlich.

477465456.name: Very disappointing
477465456.author: a TripAdvisor user
477465456.reviewBody: The lake itself is gorgeous with all the shades of turquoise. The problem is that most of the lakeside land is private. If you go to the municipal access, there is nothing but a dock full of boats waiting to take you on a tour, and a few benches full of people trying to sell you a tour. There is no beach, no chair, no grass... You can\'t stay there and tan or read a book. To really enjoy it, you have to stay at an expensive hotel or pay for a tour. I was really disappointed and left after 30 minutes because I was feeling that I should not be there unless I was waiting for a tour.\n\nGo to Laguna Milagros instead, halfway between Chetumal and Bacalar. The collectivo will cost you 20 pesos. The laguna is just as beautifully turquoise as the lake, the entrance is free, there are some restaurants around it, and there are tables and chairs and hammocks. You can eat from the restaurants or bring your own lunch. There is also grass everywhere, so you can just take a nap on your towl after a swim.

476134280.name: One of the most beautiful lakes in the world
476134280.author: a TripAdvisor user
476134280.reviewBody: Its nick name is the Lake of seven colors...although you might even see more colors. Sweet water, excelent to swim and kayak

475771091.name: Beautiful
475771091.author: a TripAdvisor user
475771091.reviewBody:
Nice place. Very nicely done cabanas. 
Zero English when we were there but that's ok. 
Very tough to find in the dark. Even with their nice big sign. The directions given were off.  Turn left at end of road not right. 
Honestly it was a beautiful place and the people were very polite.  
It appeared like there was lots of free activities masks ,fins , kayaks ready and waiting.

475670358.name: A magical place
475670358.author: a TripAdvisor user
475670358.reviewBody: I absolutely loved visiting this place.  The water is so clear and so blue.  We had a blast when we took a boat tour, even stopping to play in the mud of the edges.  \n\nBecause it is a lagoon, it is not salt water.  It FEELS like the ocean, but without the stickiness of the salt!  We loved that!

475563603.name: Natural wonder of this world
475563603.author: a TripAdvisor user
475563603.reviewBody:
One of the most beautiful and magical places I've been the vibe of the place is like no other, the wildness of the place, still that feeling of exploration and discovery.

For sure one of the most beautiful places in the south of mexico (competition is hard) 

Beautiful hotels and restaurants, amazing ppl.

474242961.name: Lake Bacalar
474242961.author: a TripAdvisor user
474242961.reviewBody: Wonderful experience kayaking in Lake Bacalar. The colors and wide life are amazing. Wish we could have spent more time.

473967507.name: blue paradise
473967507.author: a TripAdvisor user
473967507.reviewBody: A plase to disconect from the city, and connect with the nature, a magic  turquoise blue lagun  with some special healing power and unique  beauty

472463093.name: Mesmerizing!
472463093.author: a TripAdvisor user
472463093.reviewBody: We stayed in a hotel on this lake and it was a highlight of our trip!  It has the colors of the Caribbean without the crowds and with fresh water.  We expected to get bored just sitting by it, but the colors changed constantly in the lake and I loved to watch it like a fire or the sea.  I regret getting sucked into the peace and quiet, a boat ride to pirate bay or the bird areas would have been amazing.

471851672.name: A feast for the eyes!
471851672.author: a TripAdvisor user
471851672.reviewBody: This area of Mexico is phenomenal, so much to do and see! From archeological sites to sport and lifestyle activities, visit this area before it becomes a resort style destination!!!

470731449.name: The best place from Riviera Maya
470731449.author: a TripAdvisor user
470731449.reviewBody: The best place I have ever visited in La Riviera Maya, I have been there about 7 times ., and this place Rocks, I recommend the Amir Tours

469895618.name: A Magical Lagoon
469895618.author: a TripAdvisor user
469895618.reviewBody: Its also called "The 7 color Lagoon". Its amazing how not so many people know this spot being so beautiful. The temperature of the water is perfect for taking a swim. It has Cenotes (is a natural pit, or sinkhole, resulting from the collapse of limestone bedrock that exposes groundwater underneath) all around. The different colors of the lagoon are depending the depth of it There are a lot of different tours to explore all this beauty.

468957167.name: Truly amazing lake.
468957167.author: a TripAdvisor user
468957167.reviewBody:
This might be the best lake I have ever been too, coming from someone who lives in Sweden with pretty amazing lakes all around.

The water is crystal clear and full of colours on a sunny day. I can totally understand why it is called the lagoon of 7 colours.

I would recommend anyone to visit this place.

468897125.name: Excellent for boat trip with swims included
468897125.author: a TripAdvisor user
468897125.reviewBody: Stayed in the town of Bacalar and went on a boat trip on the lake with stops at cenotes in the lake itself, (snorkeled at the first one), passed by a nature reserve island where birds breed and then to \'pirate ship\' at the east side where we swam and dived and relaxed. Very enjoyable and memorable

467806240.name: Sleepy little Mexican town on Laguna Bacalar.
467806240.author: a TripAdvisor user
467806240.reviewBody: This is an amazing fresh water lake in Mexico in the South East.  The colors of blue and turquoise are phenomenal.  (said to be 7 different shades).  If you need a break from the hustle and bustle of the coast give this town a try for a few days.  You can get there by ADO (Bus) or just take a collectivo.  Ask people how to do that as they are all very helpful and friendly.  It is about three hours south of Tulum by bus but a little faster by collectivo (shared mini van)

467355209.name: Unbelievable
467355209.author: a TripAdvisor user
467355209.reviewBody: Beautiful colours in the lake and a really tranquil stay.  It was lovely to go away for a few days and get away from it all - including the tourists.  This is a really small place and that makes it even better.  \nWe went on a lovely boat tour and ate great ceviche.

466222057.name: Most impressive town of south Mexico
466222057.author: a TripAdvisor user
466222057.reviewBody: Turquoise lake place like haven just perfect to a relaxing day. This town is known as a spot for rich Mexican people you will find lovely houses by the lake.

466135980.name: Stunning
466135980.author: a TripAdvisor user
466135980.reviewBody: Beautiful and breathtaking view.  Water is very clear and warm.  Enjoyed a delicious meal along the water\'s edge.  Very quiet and pristine.  Absolutely a place to veg out and escape the noise of popular beaches.

465608777.name: Absolutely Beautiful Lake!!!
465608777.author: a TripAdvisor user
465608777.reviewBody: This is an absolutely great find.  If you like freshwater then this place is one to choose.  It\'s just gorgeous and so refreshing.  You can find boat rentals to bring you around, some even offering water sports like wake boarding, waterskiing, etc.  \nWe came here once on a fluke and have gone there 3 years now and I plan on spending more days each time.  So relaxing and beautiful.\n

465249479.name: Favourite place in Mexico
465249479.author: a TripAdvisor user
465249479.reviewBody: Bacalar is a wonderful little town, the lake is absolutely beautiful and amazing to explore. Natural stromatolites are fantastic.

464413096.name: Stunning views
464413096.author: a TripAdvisor user
464413096.reviewBody: Absolutely gorgeous laguna with dreamy aqua blue water and naturally occurring stromatolites. Only wish there were more things to do nearby.

464165798.name: Lake of seven colours
464165798.author: a TripAdvisor user
464165798.reviewBody: This is a must see, such beautiful colours. Natural wonder. When in the area, you should definitely take a boat tour and discover this amazing place.

463800857.name: Lake of Seven Colors
463800857.author: a TripAdvisor user
463800857.reviewBody: The second largest lake in Mexico, long and narrow, surrounded by second growth jungle and connected to the sea but filled with fresh water from underlying cenotes and springs.  The clear water completely replaces itself every 28 days, allowing you to enjoy the white sandy bottom.  A great place to kayak (especially in the morning, before the winds start) or sail (especially after the winds start), not to mention to swim.  We booked a half day tour on a catamaran from Marina Serenitas, a bit north of Bacalar town.  Marcos is the owner, I think.  Fernando, our captain, was very capable and very easy to be with.  He picked us up and dropped us off right at our waterside accommodation.  For us, it was much more enjoyable than a motor boat with disco music and unlimited alcoholic drinks, attracting the party crowd.

463512080.name: Absolutely Gorgeous!!
463512080.author: a TripAdvisor user
463512080.reviewBody: Beautiful freshwater lake, refreshing swim! A quiet little town, we only passed through for a swim and visit to the Fort but would love to stay here for at least a few days next time so we can enjoy one of the lake tours. A hidden gem in Quintana Roo away from the busy tourist areas.

463079109.name: Beautiful, must see
463079109.author: a TripAdvisor user
463079109.reviewBody: A true gem of a lake. Take a boat tour; swim in the cenotes, go to the bird island, and take a sulfur mud bath.  Tour only $250 pesos. If you go down the main drag by the lake, you will see tour operators.

462529382.name: One of the most beautiful lakes in the world!
462529382.author: a TripAdvisor user
462529382.reviewBody: We\'ve been to Laguna Bacalar five times, we cannot get enough. 33 miles of crystal fresh water surrounded by tropical jungle, what more can you ask for. Everyone should experience this place at least once. It is also close to Mahahual on the sea, the ruins at Chaccoben are amazing and the capital city of Chetumal is an easy 45 minute drive away, outstanding part of Mexico!

462507961.name: Simply perfect!
462507961.author: a TripAdvisor user
462507961.reviewBody: I come from Sardinia and I am VERY picky when it comes to reviewing a place, and Bacalar wowed me big time. The colors are incredible, prepare to land in paradise!

462489257.name: Nice view
462489257.author: a TripAdvisor user
462489257.reviewBody: Is A mandatory activity for visitors that all, if you enjoy to be in te water the experience will be nice if you don\'t please try.

462382253.name: Paradise
462382253.author: a TripAdvisor user
462382253.reviewBody:
This place is certainly the most stunning and beautiful i ve ever seen in my life ! 

Its ecology so protected against the tourism to keep it so natural !

Congrats to mexicain people to preserve it

462009435.name: Paradise on earth.
462009435.author: a TripAdvisor user
462009435.reviewBody: An small town in front of the laguna is a perfect place to relax and good times. Small hotels and restaurants. Navigate the laguna on a sailboat. All the colors of the mayan riviera and remember is sweet water!!! An amazing experience.

461611986.name: Most beautiful lake on earth
461611986.author: a TripAdvisor user
461611986.reviewBody: This lake is amazing. The colors are like the caribbean but fresh water. White sand at the bottom and there are no mosquitoes or algae or anything yucky.

461495818.name: Gorgeous lake
461495818.author: a TripAdvisor user
461495818.reviewBody: Very nice clear Laguna the seven tones of blue were spectacular especially sunrise!... a must do fun for whole family

461285803.name: Very unusual and amazing!
461285803.author: a TripAdvisor user
461285803.reviewBody: Truly a beautiful place. We are touring around Mexico and only stay for one day, but wish we had time for more. The water is warm, and shallow around the edges, which makes great swimming for kids and adults alike. A very spectacular lake and a lovely place for some rest and relaxation. \nNext time we will stay for at least 4-5 days.

460632249.name: Visit bacalar!
460632249.author: a TripAdvisor user
460632249.reviewBody: Is it worth to drive til bacalar?driving 3 hours from tulum ,just to see Bacalar? Yes do it.everybody was saying to don\'t drive in mexico,well do it,this place is the paradise

460459377.name: Best lake experience
460459377.author: a TripAdvisor user
460459377.reviewBody: I will never forget swimming in this beautiful lake.  The water temperature was perfect and it was usually calm until noon or so.\nThe different colors of blue and green were soothing to the soul.  I could sit and look out on it for long stretches and deeply relax.  The town is kind of funky and there are lots of great places to eat.  It is largely Mexican tourists which was also great.  The only reason I don\'t give it 5 stars is because of the bad air quality.  I have asthma and there was just too much smoke in the air too much of the time.  There is a whole lot of burning going on.  If you aren\'t sensitive to smoke, you probably won\'t be bothered by it.  I write this to the people who have asthma and sensitivity to smoke.  If you do go, you may want to get a room that is air conditioned so that you can get some reprieve at night.  If it wasn\'t for the smoke, I would be planning to return.

460284458.name: W-O-W!
460284458.author: a TripAdvisor user
460284458.reviewBody:
When planning our trip to Mexico, we actually wanted to go somewhere that was not as flocked by tourists such as Tulum or so.

We did our research and somehow Bacalar stood out as a must visit place for us. And we are glad we did this, no regrets here. 

When you drive up to Bacalar the laguna is the first thing that one notices. And words simply cannot describe how beautiful this laguna is. We were in complete aww when we arrived at our destination on the laguna and could not wait to take it all in. 

We spent a whole day in and on the water (2 days in a row though). 
Trying to grasp the beauty of it all. And since the water is not salty at all, unlike seawater, this feels so much better on your skin. And the temperature of the water does not feel like a shock when you jump in since it is not cold at all. 

This is definitely a must visit and I would love to return to the laguna someday!

458762108.name: Mind boggling natural beauty, and I live in Canc\u00fan!!
458762108.author: a TripAdvisor user
458762108.reviewBody: I\'ve been living only four hours away from this paradise for almost 20 years, and I\'d never been here before... What was I thinking?\nI am forced to write, but no words can actually describe this piece of Heaven. Mexico is sometimes too amazing to even  compare it with other countries. I\'ll let some photos do the talking.

458563089.name: Do Not Miss Bacalar.
458563089.author: a TripAdvisor user
458563089.reviewBody: I was under the impression of "how amazing can a lake be" \nI was wrong, I wish we had spent more time here as it really is surreal. Stunning colours, perfect temperate and load of water activities to do.

458130516.name: My new favorite place to relax
458130516.author: a TripAdvisor user
458130516.reviewBody: Bacalar has one of the most beautiful views in Caribbean but no waves nor salted water. Simply irresistible.

458107428.name: Bacalar is VERY pretty
458107428.author: a TripAdvisor user
458107428.reviewBody: We rented a car and drove to Bacalar from Playa del Carmen.  It was worth the trip and we could go there and back in one day.  The lake is beautiful and was quite warm!  Recommend.

457861508.name: Stunning!
457861508.author: a TripAdvisor user
457861508.reviewBody: This is breathtakingly beautiful and i believe the lagoon is about 55km wide! Definitely worth a visit...

457357823.name: Seven beautiful colors
457357823.author: a TripAdvisor user
457357823.reviewBody: Off the beaten path but with historical fort in town and some very nice acomodations nearby.. Historic ruins near by but a car is needed, bus connection and collectivo do travel there\n

456679675.name: What a place!!
456679675.author: a TripAdvisor user
456679675.reviewBody: I have been in many Lagoons in my life but Bacalar is the best! If you are going to Cancun for a few days (7-10) you can spend 2 days here, it worth it!! The lagoon has the same turquoise of Cancun and you can swim in every place! It\'s a really quiet town so it is not noisy, a little hippie but you will love it! You can do everything walking

456521699.name: Caribbean feal
456521699.author: a TripAdvisor user
456521699.reviewBody: Bacalar was our first stop after arriving in from Caye Caulker, Belize, and the water was just as amazing.

455703773.name: lagoon of seven Colors
455703773.author: a TripAdvisor user
455703773.reviewBody:
40 mile lagoon good for sailing and swimming on the edge of the Town of Bacalar lots of small fish and many Jesus

 Christ Lizard that walk on water 

r hence the name

455474271.name: It\'s fun.
455474271.author: a TripAdvisor user
455474271.reviewBody: We took a boat tour of the lake. The best part was swimming in the sandy -bottomed Caribbean-blue fresh waters at canal de los pirates. \nSo pleasant!

454913818.name: Heaven Found on the Earth
454913818.author: a TripAdvisor user
454913818.reviewBody: I fell in love with this breathtaking seven-colour lagoon of Bacalar. This place is unreal; something like cartoons I watched in my childhood. The lagoon is amazingly clean. When the sun shines you can see different colours and shades of blue/green. The mud at the bottom of lagoon is apparently good for skin. You can either go for sailing on a group/private boat or simply kayaking. I call it my LaLa Land.

453919292.name: AMAZING
453919292.author: a TripAdvisor user
453919292.reviewBody: I have never seen a blue colored water anywhere else in the world. If you are around Cancun-Playa-Tulum it is a must seen and just a few hours away. Leave early in the morning, arrive for lunch, spend the afternoon on the lake, sleep over there ( amazing sunset ) and come back the next day.

453688325.name: Amazing colours
453688325.author: a TripAdvisor user
453688325.reviewBody: We were amazed by this lake. Young man offered us 2 hours boat tour around the lake. Colours are amazing! There are also fer cenotes in the lake. And at playa dos piratas you can even take a kind of a mud bath. Real relaxing day!

453070936.name: Beautiful place and very popular with the locals
453070936.author: a TripAdvisor user
453070936.reviewBody: Beautiful place and very popular with the locals.  You drive through small streets and pass the town to get to it.  It was very crowded when we went and pretty much local tourists.  There is a small entrance fee to get in - so you will need pesos in change.\n\nSeveral local restaurants to eat and also clean bathrooms and shopping the area.  Go here for an authentic experience with the locals -- not for a resort feel!!

453045660.name: OMG a hidden Mexician Gem
453045660.author: a TripAdvisor user
453045660.reviewBody: You need to book a party boat to get a tour of the lake...the lake has 4 senotes and an entry point where the pirates entered where the mudd will be the best thing you have ever experienced.

452643921.name: Beauty of Yucatan
452643921.author: a TripAdvisor user
452643921.reviewBody: Surprisingly not soo well developed as touristic place as compared with the northern part of Yucatan, this lake offers rare opportunuty to enjoy fresh and warm water experience with a lot of activities on the shore and in the lake itself. Unique, jouful, delightful... you may come here for one day but defenitely would want to stay more... or keep coming back over and over.

452008458.name: Heaven
452008458.author: a TripAdvisor user
452008458.reviewBody: An amazing experience, is like heaven on earth, you have to relax and enjoy the weather, the view and the amazing gift from nature. Don\u00b4t expect resorts; there are only hostels and small hotels.

451422694.name: Serene, peaceful, lovely getaway from all the busy touristy parts of Mexico
451422694.author: a TripAdvisor user
451422694.reviewBody: I stayed right at the lake at a hostel. It was very relaxing and the colours are simply gorgeous. Can swim, paddle board as well.

451363422.name: The sight of the Lagoon will blow you away.
451363422.author: a TripAdvisor user
451363422.reviewBody: A most unique and wonderful place with great people interesting culture. The lagoon is crystal clear and refreshing to swim in.  There are boat tours you can charter, restaurants lining the shore and picture opportunities everywhere. You will have to see this to believe its beauty.

451042184.name: Paradise
451042184.author: a TripAdvisor user
451042184.reviewBody: Bacalar is an incredible place, very quiet a real paradise. Some places has good food and accommodations but don\'t expect anything amazing because the place it is by itself

450862008.name: Beautiful lake, crystal clear water!
450862008.author: a TripAdvisor user
450862008.reviewBody: Bacalar is definitely worth a visit in Mexico! The water is incredible, the location is beautiful and incredibly relaxing!

450851051.name: Jet Skis and motor boats have ruined a once peaceful place
450851051.author: a TripAdvisor user
450851051.reviewBody: In two years it has gone from blissful quiet lake with so many birds to a place that is trying  to make as much money as possible off the tourists.....at the expense of the lake and the birds.  Also lots of street dogs.  They need a solid spay neuter program.  I have heard lots of visitors say they won\'t return because of the dog situation.  Used to be safe to swim....now you have to be very careful of boats and jetskis

449240069.name: Paradise on earth
449240069.author: a TripAdvisor user
449240069.reviewBody: Lake bacalar is a wonderful place. It is so beautiful and peaceful. We did a tour with a catamaran and you should do the same. It s ecological and you experience the place in a different way.

448053558.name: Beautiful lake, but.....
448053558.author: a TripAdvisor user
448053558.reviewBody: Beautiful lake, but a bit disappointed as it looks much better in pictures taken from the air....it\'s not so impressive when you sail on it....

447877834.name: An absolutely special place
447877834.author: a TripAdvisor user
447877834.reviewBody: The magic of is lagoon is felt as soon as you lay eyes on it. It\'s glorious colours just make you want to dive right in, which, of course you can! It looks just like the Caribbean, only its fresh water and you aren\'t in danger of getting dunked by ant waves. I absolutely loved my six weeks here and would recommend to anyone to stop off in this tiny town to experience the wonders of the lagoon. There\'s plenty of legends and myths to hear as well, if you dare!

444662890.name: What a colourful lagune
444662890.author: a TripAdvisor user
444662890.reviewBody: For a reason this lagune is called the lagune of 7 colours. A boat tour is a must. Visiting the different cenotes within the lagune and of course make a stop to get a natural mud treatment

444000586.name: Beatifull in good weather
444000586.author: a TripAdvisor user
444000586.reviewBody: The lake is amazing and beautifull but i would not do all the way especially to see it. Need some luck for a nice day to enjoy the place.

442172836.name: A must in Mexico
442172836.author: a TripAdvisor user
442172836.reviewBody: It is simply one of the most beautiful places I have visited in my life. An environment to protect at all costs. The crystal clear water will amaze you

441963237.name: Heaven on earth!!!
441963237.author: a TripAdvisor user
441963237.reviewBody: Without any doubt Bacalar is one of those places that visitors will allways keep in their minds. The colours of the lake in a sunny day are espectacular with no envie of the best views you may see in the caribean sea.

441235402.name: Wonderful
441235402.author: a TripAdvisor user
441235402.reviewBody: Lake Bacalar is a truly wonderful place. If you have an opportunity to visit make sure you do so. The water is sparkling clear and warm. You can take a tour on the lake, also visit the fort. Go to Cenote Azul  whilst in the area.

441105642.name: BEAUTIFUL WATER COLORS!
441105642.author: a TripAdvisor user
441105642.reviewBody: With several beautiful water colors, a place to relax and enjoy the views.  Surrounded by jungles and a small town with several rustic hotels and restaurants, a place for tourists to enjoy Mayan cultures and nature.  A place to retreat and find some peace.

440194218.name: 3rd visit to Bacalar
440194218.author: a TripAdvisor user
440194218.reviewBody:
I lost my heart to this beautiful part of Mexico.

Yucatan  &  Quintano Roo got it all.

Beautiful wheather, pyramids with heavy history, Colonial cities,, cenotes,Maya culture, stunning natural sites, ..and nice people.

And the Bacalar Lake .  Wow

We made again a tour on the Lake of the many colours with the catamaran of Federico & Valerie.

We had another Mexican  and  German couple on board.

The BACALAR SAILING team has a great package to offer.
Time spend on the lake is flexible. We stayed for over 5 hours.

Fede & Valerie together  speak like 7 languages !!!
and they give great explanations about every thing. On the lake   and in Quintana Roo.

440005415.name: So lovely!
440005415.author: a TripAdvisor user
440005415.reviewBody: I when to this place "accidentally" but it was an amazing surprise! The lake is so beautiful, peaceful, colourful... Just take a bus and go there and you will be very surprised!

436721693.name: Beautiful
436721693.author: a TripAdvisor user
436721693.reviewBody: This is really a great get away to Destress and unwind. The lake is gorgeous, great for swimming, Great for kayaking and is all around beautiful. \n\nThe places around here don\'t provide the best Wi-Fi but if you\'re looking for a place to disconnect from the rest of the world, to clear your mind, and find peace - this place is perfect.

436043475.name: as in a dream
436043475.author: a TripAdvisor user
436043475.reviewBody: very beautiful place, warm water, increadible colors. \nperfect place to chill and have quiet time with friends/family.

435832686.name: Worth the Trip
435832686.author: a TripAdvisor user
435832686.reviewBody: We live in Akumal and head to Bacular when we want to relax and enjoy. The lake is\nincredible. This trip was the first time we took a boat tour. Something we will do again. The only disappointing thing is the swarms of fish are gone so the bird watching is not what it use to be. Truly an amazing place with a wonderful town, fort, and close to many great maya ruins. I would suggest to make sure where you stay has easy lake access.

435729001.name: Beautiful lake!
435729001.author: a TripAdvisor user
435729001.reviewBody: Beautiful lake, a must visit if you are near Bacalar!! \nContact the monkey hostel to do paddle boarding.

434898178.name: Amazing water colora
434898178.author: a TripAdvisor user
434898178.reviewBody: The water has so many beautiful colors and it is sweet water.. it has some cenotes able to see while visiting the lagoon on boat.. the main attractions here are the Fortress museum, the main park, the lagoon excursion and the walk at night ..

434451044.name: Lagune of 7 colours
434451044.author: a TripAdvisor user
434451044.reviewBody: The lagune is very clean and clear. Due to its high part of minerals you can only rarely see fishes but a very high number and diversity of birds. The minerals are also the reason of the different coulour zones which make the lagune even more special. Definitely a must see

433635750.name: About pirates and more.
433635750.author: a TripAdvisor user
433635750.reviewBody:
Why there is a fortress against pirates next to Bacalar lagoon? The answer is in the museum inside the main bulwark. One hour of your time worth the visit. 

Cenote azul with more than 300 ft depth next to the shore and its actual depth still unkown is also a must to visit. You can drink a beer in the restaurant next to the Cenote.

Also have a great meal in La Playita restaurant.  5 minutes from fortress by car. 

If you want to overnight, Luxury hotel is a very good choice (private, clean, with spa services), but call in advance. It is usually booked.

431667778.name: Unbelievable
431667778.author: a TripAdvisor user
431667778.reviewBody: It\'s an incredible lagoon in the middle of an undeveloped town, so better to appreciate nature before the influence of big resorts.

431357462.name: 7 colours
431357462.author: a TripAdvisor user
431357462.reviewBody: The Lake is very pretty and clear and on its own worth visiting Bacalar. The private spot has a 10 Peso charge but in town there is also a public spot for free which seemed just as good to us! Swimming is great because the water is so calm and not as cold as the sea can be. Visibility is okay for snorkeling but there isn\'t much to see. Best way to spend time for us was just taking it easy but other options seem to be kayaks for 150 an hour and Lake tours at around 350 each.

429330530.name: Seeing it is better than reading about it
429330530.author: a TripAdvisor user
429330530.reviewBody: This is one of the most interesting places I can imagine to swim and for sightseeing. The local history is intriguing and under ten miles fro Belize, for good measure. I

428554378.name: Very bad experience at the Laguna
428554378.author: a TripAdvisor user
428554378.reviewBody:
First I will relate to the Laguna itself- this is a nice place with beautiful calm water where you can swim and enjoy a day. Don't know if I would stay there for a night as the town doesn't seem very welcoming. It is pretty poorly maintained, so this may be  good for whoever is seeking for a true "local/ authentic experience". 

We had our own "local experience" when trying to get a boat to tour the Laguna. We took a boat of local operators. It was already too late when we understood that these are actually unqualified and unauthorized guides only seeking to rip off tourists. They offer a tour in a shaky small boat with very little to see. 

We were promised a 3.5 hours tour in a nice boat, drinks included in the price and an English speaking guide. What we got was that shaky small motor boat, no drinks were included (the boat stopped at a restaurant where we could purchase drinks on our account) and the guide didn't know anything about the Laguna and threw some words in English to satisfy the "English speaking" part. The tour lasted barely 2 hours, and of course we were crazily overcharged. All our complaints about the trip were dismissed by the organizers (and when I say organizers I means some creepy tattooed guys who sat on the shore). 

At the end, we were left with a great sense of disappointment, with bad opinion of the locals and their culture (or lack of it) and just escaped that horrible place on the first bus. 

Do yourself a favor - either skip this lake if you are not in the area (we made a special round bus trip from and back to Tulum, where we stayed, which was TOTALLY a waste of time), or book a good tour in advance. Don't go to those local tours. 

Also the surrounding of the Laguna is pretty neglected so this also had some contribution to the disappointment.

427722027.name: one of the BEST natural lake in MEXICO, INCREDIBLE WATER
427722027.author: a TripAdvisor user
427722027.reviewBody: You must visit this place before died , it is incredible!!\nthe water is incredible, the place is excellent a nice contact with the nature

427698904.name: AMAZING
427698904.author: a TripAdvisor user
427698904.reviewBody: This is a must-see! We had such an amazing time there. This lake is so special it felt unreal with the beautiful colors and the easy-going atmosphere. I was very happy that this place was not crowded and touristy. We were staying 5 driving minutes away from Bacalar. \nBacalar is a charming little town with a lot of nice and cozy shops with handcrafted stuff. You will find so many good dining options there and very good coffee shops. \nIf you are in quintana roo - go there!

427619783.name: Staying on the lakefront is what you want to do ... IF YOU CAN AFFORD IT
427619783.author: a TripAdvisor user
427619783.reviewBody:
I was GRANDPAcking in Bacalar for 7 nights.
I couldn't find any (non Dorm) accommodation on the lakefront that I could afford.
So, I stayed in an Hotel on the central park.
It became quickly obvious that staying anywhere other than on the lake dilutes the whole Bacalar experience.
The lakefront is mainly private land. Public access to the lakefront is intermittent between these private properties and, invariably, offers poor recreational access.
But there are benches and tables to laze around on along the path down to the lake.
There are 2 good public accesses to the lake. The first one is free for pedestrians and is found at the bottom of Calle 14. The second is in the national park at the bottom of Calle 30. Entry for pedestrians is MXP10. Both offer access to a pier where you can stay and swim.
Activities on the lake are expensive too.
Kayaks cost MXP120 / hour.
A 3-4 hour motorised boat tour around the lake's sights will cost you MXP350. MXP500 for a sailboat.
There are 4 cenotes to visit; entry is MXP10.

426034233.name: Amazing and totally worth it
426034233.author: a TripAdvisor user
426034233.reviewBody: The entrance to the lake is ridiculously cheap. I think we paid like 10-20 MXN per person :D AND IT IS SOOO PRETTY! The water is crystal clear, there are restaurants, swimming school, snorcheling school, pier where you just have to go and take a picture or just chill and sunbath! Lovely place. If you are arround, just go.

424214979.name: Lake of Seven Colours
424214979.author: a TripAdvisor user
424214979.reviewBody: The lake is huge and pristine! It is about 50 kilometers long and about 2 kilometers wide. Imagine that the bottom of the lake can easily be seen on a sunny day! The water is as crystal clear (I swear!) and the seven colors are truly something worth the trip...I never knew about the place until my second visit to Mexico. Must see when near Yucatan Peninsula!!!

423279837.name: Just beautiful
423279837.author: a TripAdvisor user
423279837.reviewBody: I did paddleboard at daybreak and I really enjoyed it, I loved "el canal de los piratas" and the cenotes.

422629350.name: Paradise
422629350.author: a TripAdvisor user
422629350.reviewBody: Bacalar Lake is not only stunning, it emanates peace and joy. The people are friendly and happy. I have been living here for over 16 years and I love when beautiful people come with respect and love to start a new business.

421830971.name: Quiet but a nice stop off
421830971.author: a TripAdvisor user
421830971.reviewBody: A very quiet and peaceful part of Mexico - not touch activity but the is definitely why we enjoyed it. A great place to stop and relax, though I personally wouldn\'t want to spend too long there. Not much going on but beautiful lake, some nice restaurants and perfect for a chill.

421600427.name: Perfect lake!
421600427.author: a TripAdvisor user
421600427.reviewBody: Never have I seen a more beautiful lake with so many hues. We went out on a boat cruise for a few hours. The water was so clear and pristine. It is a must to see.

420588807.name: Tour of Laguna de Bacalar with Kristel of Tours Bacalar Lagunakristal
420588807.author: a TripAdvisor user
420588807.reviewBody: This was a wonderful excursion.  Our guide, Kristel, was a gem.  She took us all over the lagoon, explaining the history and letting us stop in various places to swim and play and take pictures.  She also offered to take pictures of us so we could all be in them.  The lagoon was beautiful with the most amazing colors.  The water was so clear and would go from cold to warm to hot.  A really great experience.  Our guide was funny and informative.  She also provided drinks and local snacks which was a great treat for us.  I would definitely recommend her to anyone wanting a special treat and to get away from the "hordes" of tourists elsewhere.  We had our kids and their significant others with us and all enjoyed this immensely.

420246953.name: Best place in Mexico!
420246953.author: a TripAdvisor user
420246953.reviewBody: This is actually a lagoon and it resembles the paradise itself on earth because it has 7 different colors depending on the depth of its waters.

419597483.name: Beautiful lake
419597483.author: a TripAdvisor user
419597483.reviewBody: Really lovely place with amazing colours. We took a tour with a local guy who was cheap but didn\'t speak any English. You may need to spend a bit more for an English tour.

419238719.name: Mexico Hidden Secret
419238719.author: a TripAdvisor user
419238719.reviewBody: You would think you are at the sea shore, but you are at a lake witch is produce by cenote water. Located just 30 minutes from Chetumal Mexico, or 60 minutes from the Costa Maya cruise port, is this hidden gem. Completely ecological and the temperature of the water is just perfect. Would definitively will go back. Grab a boat tour and let them take you around.

418541922.name: Absolutely stunning!
418541922.author: a TripAdvisor user
418541922.reviewBody: Gorgeous lagoon, the colours are amazing and you could have fun for hours. We did kayaking and paddleboarding and it was incredible to see the water so clear beneath you and it be fresh water.

416903056.name: Beautiful, tranquil and dreamy
416903056.author: a TripAdvisor user
416903056.reviewBody:
There's not much to say about Lake Bacalar other than its a must see. Take one of the boat trips out to see the various Cenotes and be enthralled by the colours, depth, clarity, warmth and smells of the various areas. Group trips start around 250 pesos per person and a good one will last 2 & 1/2 hours. Ours was around that amount of time and we would say it was our best paid tour/excursion of our trip. 

 If you get a chance to swim in the Cenote Negro, swim out to the middle put your goggles on and look down into the cool, dark water if you dare... It's quite a strange sensation. In contrast swimming around in the shallow crystal blue waters surrounding Cenote Esmarelda is enchanting. Imagine the best tropical sea that you could swim in and take away the salt and the waves. It's perfect. 

 There are many more things to see and learn about Lake Bacalar but it's best not to hear everything before you go!

416766740.name: A magic place
416766740.author: a TripAdvisor user
416766740.reviewBody: You have to enjoy a boat trip on this beautiful lake. Swim in 3 different cenotes. Have a clay therapy / peeling in the water.. finish your tour with a delicous lunch at a beach club

414750168.name: Definetly worth coming
414750168.author: a TripAdvisor user
414750168.reviewBody: We spent a weekend in bacalar, and has been our best vacation so far... as a couple retreat and for a few days is probably the best option..... not quite sure if it works for longer stays

413222056.name: Beautiful lake
413222056.author: a TripAdvisor user
413222056.reviewBody: Even when it was raining it was nice. Water is sweet and quite. When san is pressent the color is amazing

412302467.name: Beautiful but unpleasant town
412302467.author: a TripAdvisor user
412302467.reviewBody: So this lagoon is great, clear water and some cenotes, unmissable visit but... Skip the town: one day visit in and out will be enough.\n\nUgly, no restaurants (just one decent one), all closed by 7pm and a lot of people doing nothing sniffing around to get something from tourists... Avoid that part!

411993520.name: Neither here nor there
411993520.author: a TripAdvisor user
411993520.reviewBody: Lake Bacalar is far lest touristy than Tulum or Playa, yet it\'s an easy travel destination.  \nBeautiful lake, Relaxed atmosphere.  More of what I would think a beach town should be.  A refreshing change from the hordes on the coast.  Small town feel with a fantastic bakery on the square.  Good coffee.

409266576.name: Amazing spot!
409266576.author: a TripAdvisor user
409266576.reviewBody: What an amazing spot to chill, the sand is so soft, water is very shallow for quite some distance. You can hire a yatch and go for a ride for a few kms. The colours are absolutely amazing. Very quite and unpopulated tourist area.

408851916.name: Excellent Place to visit!
408851916.author: a TripAdvisor user
408851916.reviewBody: Definitely worth visiting, you can go to the town center of Bacalar and ask for a tour of the lake with snorkeling included, prices vary from $200-pesos pp depending on the boat ride.

408707238.name: Lake of the 7 colours
408707238.author: a TripAdvisor user
408707238.reviewBody: Beautiful lake in the south of Yucatan, about 2 hours from Tulum. Great for a day out, swimming or kayaking and enjoying nature.

403107169.name: Heaven on Earth
403107169.author: a TripAdvisor user
403107169.reviewBody: Bacalar is a white-sand fresh-water paradise absent of the tourist trap-y vibe of many other beautiful cities of the Yucatan. I could not believe how affordable it was to stay in this untouched, pristine, idyllic area. Bacalar and it\'s lagoons are such gems that I almost hate to encourage others to visit because I pray it stays so lovely and natural forever!

402088745.name: Amazing lagoons with colours
402088745.author: a TripAdvisor user
402088745.reviewBody:
Amazing fresh water lagoon.  I'm amazed at the lack of infrastructure for eco turism.  amazing Cenotes flank the main lagoon which are accesible by car or boat.  You can take a tour for 2.5hrs for 600 pesos per person.  It only includes the ride.  The boat rider told us some information regarding the lagoon and its features.  Trip ends at the Pirate Ship, they tried to make a restaurant and its now in ruins.  Lots of fun.  

The town is quiet and has great places to eat by the water.  Just choose carefully for the one that has good prices, delicious food and allow you to swim in the Lake.  Spme restaurants dont include the tax in their prices and makes for an ugly surprise, such as Kai Pez  I would recommend La Playita.

Finally, this place is amazing but needs more infrastructure and better turism control.  The operators profit for themselves and dont put anything back for the preservation of the lagoon.  And even less to pay their operators efficiently and fairly.

401198394.name: Awesome!
401198394.author: a TripAdvisor user
401198394.reviewBody: Very nice lake with crystal clear waters due to sandy bottom!\nWe spent 1 night and 1 day in Bacalar and would love to come back one day!

397605854.name: BACALAR SAILING
397605854.author: a TripAdvisor user
397605854.reviewBody:
Great experience.
Really beautiful place.
Many ways to discover the secrets of the laguna.

A tour with a sailing boat is great and nature friendly.

The different colours, estramaolites, pirates canal, birds Island,..
The rapidos.

Look for tours with snorkling equipment.
Make it more beautiful is you have also the underwater view.

Great experience  !!

396702033.name: Gorgeous lake
396702033.author: a TripAdvisor user
396702033.reviewBody: This is a very large, beautiful lake. There are quite a few nice accommodations and hotels along the lake. The town is small, but has a few restaurants, and an interesting fort to tour. We spent three days on the lake, and it was very enjoyable. Be sure and check out the boat tours of the lake. It is worth the money and worth your time. The colors of the lake or simply gorgeous.  In town, there are nice restaurants along the lake and more away from the lake.  The 3 July days we spent here, the weather was nice, only 80s, not too hot.  The water doesn\'t leave your skin all sticky like saltwater does.

395727937.name: Lovely
395727937.author: a TripAdvisor user
395727937.reviewBody: Lots of water activities to choose from and excellent swimming. Not much to do in town. One night stay next to the lake is long enough.

394099688.name: Bring your bathing suit!
394099688.author: a TripAdvisor user
394099688.reviewBody: Bacalar is simply stunning.  We enjoyed a drink at a restaurant with a long t-shaped dock that traversed the weedy/rocky parts and had a wonderful place under a palapa from which we could swim.  Sandy bottom (no muck or rocks), clear water, and amazing views.  Highly recommend this.

387042373.name: Stunning Colours
387042373.author: a TripAdvisor user
387042373.reviewBody: We took a boat trip around the lake of the seven colours and it was stunning. Seeing the lake bed drop off into the cenotes was very cool, and stopping in the middle of the lake to swim in the shallows and jump off the white structure was very fun. Highly recommend.

386562819.name: Paradise
386562819.author: a TripAdvisor user
386562819.reviewBody: We have been in Bacalar for the first time and decided to take a sailing tour which was recommended by our host. We felt like in paradise with the best weather ever to see all the different colors of the lagoon. The tour was great and took almost 5 hours, including swimming in the cenote and the canal de los piratas. \nLooking forward do go to Bacalar again soon \ud83d\ude0a

382984014.name: Magical lake and not to be missed!
382984014.author: a TripAdvisor user
382984014.reviewBody: This lake is amazing!  I love it so much.  The swimming is great and no sharks!  I can\'t wait to go back.......

382852127.name: The magical pueblo
382852127.author: a TripAdvisor user
382852127.reviewBody: The Bacalar Laguna is the Laguna of the 7 colors. Absolutely breathtaking! You can visit her by boat tour, swim in her waters or simply sit on the dock and contemplate the different hues of blue.

381165521.name: The most beautiful view
381165521.author: a TripAdvisor user
381165521.reviewBody: The laguna de bacalar has the most beautiful view i have seen. Make sure to bring a swiming suit and a book

380866451.name: I can\'t believe this is a lake....
380866451.author: a TripAdvisor user
380866451.reviewBody: This is the most beautiful place I have ever visited.  The water is so stunningly blue, yet crystal clear with perfect visibility. I think this is the best place to visit in the entire peninsula.

380132883.name: Better than the beaches
380132883.author: a TripAdvisor user
380132883.reviewBody: Don\'t get me wrong, I love the beach - I love being by the water in general. However, the calmness of the lake paired with a clarity I\'ve never seen before (in a lake) just blew my mind! The water was shallow and I could see right down to my toes and didn\'t have any anxiety about touching gross things or sharks. There are only tiny fish and rock animal/formations that are alive in the lake. Also, at certain times of the day when the sun is hitting the water just right, you\'ll be able to spot the 7 colors of the lake - absolutely breathtaking! I can\'t wait to go back <3

380005667.name: Amazing place to go
380005667.author: a TripAdvisor user
380005667.reviewBody:
Probably the best place for those who loves water and a calm environment 

Water is always beautiful, clear and safe

There is some location to go with a great view!!

Some water sports are very suitable to practice like canopying, pad boarding

378730519.name: The Jewel in the Yucatan Peninsula Crown...
378730519.author: a TripAdvisor user
378730519.reviewBody:
This is not the place if you like fast food, noisy clubs or to be surrounded by obnoxious gringos.  But if you like Mexico, and appreciate a more laid-back, groovy wibe, you will love this charming little town. 

Just imagine... a town with NO Fast Food Restaurants, NO Supermarkets, and NO Big-Box retailers!  How cool is that?  Of all the places we visited on the Yucatan Peninsula, this really takes the cake.  

One word of caution, though... you really need to know some Spanish to get the most out of your visit - this is really Mexico, and there are very few restaurant menus in English here.

376380479.name: Magical
376380479.author: a TripAdvisor user
376380479.reviewBody: Bacalar lake or lagoon is a beautiful hidden gem in Quintana Roo. It\'s very peaceful and has a relaxing atmosphere. This is a place to visit if you are ever in this side of Mexico. Very close to Chetumal and Belize. It is worth the drive if you are in Cancun or Playa Carmen. You do not see a lot of tourists around, it seems very local, and very quaint.

374530765.name: A beautiful place
374530765.author: a TripAdvisor user
374530765.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful palces I have visited. Be sure to take a tour of the lake so as to be able to see its different colors.

373481709.name: Yes, It really IS all those colors
373481709.author: a TripAdvisor user
373481709.reviewBody: Even if you never stick a toe in, you can sit and admire the colors for hours as they change as the sun moves and clouds cast shadows. Also lovely for swimming and boating. Breezes off the lake help keep you cool as well.

373221632.name: One of the prettiest lakes!
373221632.author: a TripAdvisor user
373221632.reviewBody: Really! It\'s so beautiful! The water is crystal clear and the sand is so soft. Absolutely love this lake.

372672586.name: Clear
372672586.author: a TripAdvisor user
372672586.reviewBody: The water is so clear one can see the sand almost at all parts of the lake. Good place to stop the boat at any place, swim and enjoy. Wonderful experience

371784636.name: Nice glow but not hat easy to access
371784636.author: a TripAdvisor user
371784636.reviewBody: There is a public park and peir to swim from south of the town fort and square, other than that resturant and resorts will have you buy from them so you can enjoy the water. Cenote Azul was fun, hard to imagine the amount of water laying below. Great formation and water is beautiful temp and very refreshing. 10peso to enter. There is also a restaurant serving good food.

370763383.name: One of the most beautiful Lagoons in the world
370763383.author: a TripAdvisor user
370763383.reviewBody: There are not enough words to describe how beautiful this lagoon is. If you want to relax this is the place to be. I recommend you take a boat tour so you can see all the colors...it is amazing!

368467439.name: Absolutely Beautiful .
368467439.author: a TripAdvisor user
368467439.reviewBody: I stayed two days at Hotel Laguna Bacalar, because this lake is SO BEAUTIFUL... It seems like a rainbow of different turquoise colors... Dark turquoise, light turquoise, green turquoise, blue turquoise... I don\'t know how this happened but it did.   It is actually many cenotes ("sink hole") connected to each other, forming a large lake... I did not go sailing on it, but I wish that I had, it would have been wonderful.  \n\nIt is pristine clean, and I cannot think that I have seen a more beautiful lake anywhere else in the world... and I have seen many beautiful lakes in Mexico, the U.S.A., Switzerland, etc.... This is the most beautiful lake I have seen anywhere.

366203085.name: Magic place!!!
