366203085.author: a TripAdvisor user
366203085.reviewBody: The lake has 7 different colors!! It\'s an incredible place to stay. So peaceful and quiet... Love it!!!

365774847.name: Beautiful!
365774847.author: a TripAdvisor user
365774847.reviewBody: This is an amazing place, great for swimming. You will not find fishes, it\'s just a lagoon that is formed by the connection of 7 different "cenotes". A great choice is to rent a boat, go around and swim in the clear and quiet water.

365241815.name: One of the greatest places in Mexico
365241815.author: a TripAdvisor user
365241815.reviewBody: It reminds me Whitsundays in Australia without the salty water. Amazing place to relax and spend a romantic weekend. I would recommend booking a hotel by the lagoon, its more expensive but definitely worth it

364874241.name: As beautiful as it looks in the pictures.
364874241.author: a TripAdvisor user
364874241.reviewBody: I had high expectations and was not disappointed, the lake like the perfect pool (calm and at just the right temperature) and it changes color several times a day, I fell in love with this place.

364429331.name: beautiful!
364429331.author: a TripAdvisor user
364429331.reviewBody: Crystal clear and refreshing fresh water.  No beach, but many very nice public swimming areas, also many beach front hotels.

362771916.name: Go as a couple!
362771916.author: a TripAdvisor user
362771916.reviewBody: This is the place where you take your girlfriend,wife or significant other! Amazing place with extraordinary views and things to do! Inexpensive!

362380440.name: Amazing!
362380440.author: a TripAdvisor user
362380440.reviewBody: We visited for the day and took a boat ride tour with one of the locals. He showed us many of the cenotes (underwater caves) and we ended up at Pirate Island for a swim. Perfect place to spend a few hours. Be sure to put all that \'slimy\' sand all over your body. The water\'s minerals soften the skin. No fish in the lagoon.

362317750.name: Great relax place away from the beach
362317750.author: a TripAdvisor user
362317750.reviewBody: Bacalar was a pleasant surprise. This lake is like a giant cenote. We went kayaking for 2 hours on the lake. the water is warm and cristal clear. The bottom of the lake is covered with white sand. A beautiful 1 night trip.

361616884.name: Paradise on earth!!
361616884.author: a TripAdvisor user
361616884.reviewBody: One of the mos beautifull places I have been in my entire life.\nThe colors are spectacular and on top it has an interesting history with pirates getting there from time to time!

360837012.name: Just beautiful
360837012.author: a TripAdvisor user
360837012.reviewBody: Absolutely beautiful lake, the colours are just unreal. We found a lovely, peaceful spot to swim and chill out all day long. Also worth watching sunrise here!

359171475.name: All you need is love & Bacalar
359171475.author: a TripAdvisor user
359171475.reviewBody: This is amazing place. You can find friendly people, seven colors to enjoy, paddling or swimming. Magic cenotes, great places to eat delicious and hotels and hostels...I prefer hostels; you can meet many interesting people and cultures.\nI think you should visit this place once in your life...simply beautiful.

359010867.name: Amazing!!!!
359010867.author: a TripAdvisor user
359010867.reviewBody: One of a kind place! Loved it! Stay at least one night here. Take a boat trip to discover this wonder. Who needs Bora Bora? Bacalar is the spot to be!

357928972.name: Incredible
357928972.author: a TripAdvisor user
357928972.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful places I have ever been. The lake is so beautiful and you can swim in it with no problem.

355554419.name: Beautiful relaxing town
355554419.author: a TripAdvisor user
355554419.reviewBody: The Laguna is a sight to be seen, so many shades of blue!  There is quite a few water activities to do on the lake and the town has an interesting walled city and some small restaurants.  We definitely loved travelling here and it was a nice relax after being in some bigger Mexican cities.

353428366.name: A must do
353428366.author: a TripAdvisor user
353428366.reviewBody: Go to casa lahar and book a tour of the lagoon with Amil. 3 hours,great fun, beer,drinks and snacks included.

352995045.name: Fresh water lake near Chetumal
352995045.author: a TripAdvisor user
352995045.reviewBody: Lake Bacalar is a fresh water lake in southern Yucatan. We stayed at Rancho Encantado, but there are a number of small resorts on the lake as well as the town of Bacalar, an early settlement with a 16th century fort.

352982330.name: Excellent swimming at Cenote Azule, Bacalar
352982330.author: a TripAdvisor user
352982330.reviewBody: It\'s so cool to see such small canal leading Caribbean to Lagoon in this area. Water is warm and so beautiful. Since it is a fresh water lagoon called Cenote, no waves and easy to swim. Water colors are different due to mineral contents from emerald green to very blue and the shallow area is almost light green. Absolutely gorgeous and very deep. It\'s hard to believe its a part of river and not the ocean.

352480692.name: Tranquility
352480692.author: a TripAdvisor user
352480692.reviewBody: Lake Bacalar is amazing natural resource! I hope that it is well cared for and available for future generations to enjoy. The water is very alkaline so plant and fish like is low, and thus the water is very clear. It\'s a little more difficult to float/swim here than your local swimming pool. I absolutely loved the tranquility and peacefulness of the place. Motorized watercraft are few, so there isn\'t a lot of noise to disturb your days spent near the lagoon. I look forward to returning someday - love, love, love this place.

352096962.name: A most unusual and wonderful place!
352096962.author: a TripAdvisor user
352096962.reviewBody: Lake Bacalar is a great place to spend an afternoon, a day, or a week.  Whether sitting by the shore or taking one of the many boat tours that you can find, you will be amazed at a lake that looks like some tropical sea environment.  Having the cenotes within the bigger cenote provides amazing color contrasts.  Since much of the lake is shallow, you can wade around easily, but you can also swim in the deeper cenotes.  I would advise wearing water shoes -- there are lots of snail shells on the bottom and it is easy to cut your foot!

350364926.name: Excellent swimming, huge lake, beautiful forest and properties around it
350364926.author: a TripAdvisor user
350364926.reviewBody: Visited friend who owns B&B on shore of lake.  Went kayaking, swimming and had best swim because the lake is big, water temperature ideal and the water deep enough that there are no hazards.

349662764.name: must see
349662764.author: a TripAdvisor user
349662764.reviewBody: super tranquil place and amazingly beautiful too. snorkel around the cenote, enjoy a full-body beauty-mud-mask then watch the sunset from the middle of the lagoon.  can\'t recommend it enough! see it before money destroys this spot too..!

349531791.name: Must see it for yourself! Stunning colours!
349531791.author: a TripAdvisor user
349531791.reviewBody:
We encountered different levels of sunlight while we were here, including  a flush rainstorm which gave the water a deep green jade-like colour. Wish we had a good camera to capture all of the beautiful colours, you just have to see it with your own eyes! 

At one point we saw small fish in the water. The water is super clear. It's fun to swim, float, and laze around for a whole afternoon.

We went to a public beach area, it costed 10 pesos per person to access, you can come in and out with your ticket. You can park your car right here if you drive, or you can probably walk here from your hotel. It's also close to the Spanish Fortress, we basically walked in between these places.

The hut/umbrella seats by the lake costs money to rent, might have been 30 pesos. You can leave your stuffs in the restaurant by the lake if you eat there as the waiter told us. We basically had lunch there (gorgeous view and the food was not bad at all!) and were able to keep our table for the rest of the day.

;

347954082.name: Kayaking Lake Bacalar is a must
347954082.author: a TripAdvisor user
347954082.reviewBody: It takes around 2 hours to experience the laguna bacalar by kayak and does not require a lot of efforts. Kayak can be rented from the town centre. The only downside of Lake Bacalar is that it lacks beaches or public areas to rest and enjoy the water, this is not an ideal place to rest.

347521832.name: "A Fantastic Day to Remember!"
347521832.author: a TripAdvisor user
347521832.reviewBody: The beautiful Bacalar Lake is an absolute must see in Quintana Roo province  and deserves the detour. But better than see this wonderful place from a pier is swimm or dive on it crystaline waters. Prices can go from 200 to 350 mexican pesos (roughtly 12 to 20 US$) for a shared boat. If you pass near the banks, it\'s impossible to miss the guys that organize the tours. Take your time to check the itinerary, lenght of the tour, and then, simply enjoy. After your adventure I recommend you to celebrate it with a delicious paleta. Near  the Old Fort, in downtown there is one excellent ice cream shop, Annie Delicias, that deserves its name.

346960291.name: Amazing Lake
346960291.author: a TripAdvisor user
346960291.reviewBody: It\'s so beautiful. You won\'t see these much colors in one lake again. Be sure to get a Hotel directly at the coast!! Then you\'ll be fine.

346721107.name: Beautiful
346721107.author: a TripAdvisor user
346721107.reviewBody: Definitely worth the trip in!!! We visited by booking with Native Choice Tours and was taken up for a cruise excursion day.  Beautiful water and unspoiled beauty!!

343376039.name: Stunning views!
343376039.author: a TripAdvisor user
343376039.reviewBody:
The lake is very beautiful. Fresh water makes it possible to swim in it indefinitely and not have that burning sensation in your mouth and nose that you get from salty water.

There's a lot of shallow areas which makes it possible to play all kinds of water sports. 

The lake is very relaxing and makes you want to do nothing forever.

340201705.name: Short and sweet
340201705.author: a TripAdvisor user
340201705.reviewBody: I went from Playa del Carmen to Bacalar on my way to Belize. At the ADO they told me it would take 3 hours. It should have take 3 hours but don\'t let me fool you it took me 6 hours. They might have a direct bus I wasn\'t aware so ask for it when you are at the ADO otherwise make sure you have lots of time. I got there and it was dark most hotels are not walking distance from where the bus drops you. I stayed at the Green Monkey hostel. The location of the hostel is really gorgeous right non the lake but the hostel itself is bad. It was dirty, it is small and when I got there the tent they had out were wet. The thing that bothered me the most was the caus and the dirty kitchen. I decided to stay there only one night and then moved to Belize the next day. Fortunately I found a group of awesome backpackers who traveled with me to Caye Calker who were a lot of fun. I am still in touch with most of them. Go and visit Bacalar but pay attention to where you are going to stay.

339009868.name: Laguna de ilusiones
339009868.author: a TripAdvisor user
339009868.reviewBody: This was a wonderful place to visit. The water was warm seems is a lagoon that means there is not an ocean water that means no salty water. Overall an restful time. Highly recomend.it.

338691086.name: Pure water
338691086.author: a TripAdvisor user
338691086.reviewBody: The place where the sky is born for Maya. Beautiful water hot and very pure full of colors and transparent.

337756679.name: Bacalar a small jewel.
337756679.author: a TripAdvisor user
337756679.reviewBody: The lake is really nice. There was a small public dock a block or two south of the plaza. Nice dock to swim off. The town is quaint. The plaza quaint. The old fort a perfect center piece. The park too nice not to sit and soak in Mexico for an hour.

337057792.name: Laid back, marvelous, paradise like place
337057792.author: a TripAdvisor user
337057792.reviewBody: Not far from crowded, messy, noisy Tulum, a real paradise oasis. The lake is infinite blue, quite and clean...perfect for chilling out!

335539724.name: THE LAKE OF SEVEN COLORS
335539724.author: a TripAdvisor user
335539724.reviewBody: The lake is beautiful. Shallow in the beginning and very family friendly. Warm, fresh water lake suitable for swimming all year round. Great for kayaking or sailing. Guided boat tours are available. Unfortunately there is a lot of garbage around the lakeshore and raw sewage is spewed directly into the lake. There is an ecological state park and a couple of public docks which are free of charge. Some of the docks have rotten wood and missing planks, making them somewhat dangerous. The state park has broken palapas with broken chairs and tables and the ground is very swampy, so there is nowhere to enjoy a picnic. The city does absolutely nothing to maintain its parks or playgrounds.

335502157.name: Great when the weather is right
335502157.author: a TripAdvisor user
335502157.reviewBody: The Nature is beautiful and its worth to visit and make tours but only if the weather is right. Recommendable

335045345.name: Beautiful clear water - great for swimming or kayaking
335045345.author: a TripAdvisor user
335045345.reviewBody: Lake Bacalar is a fresh water lake just inland from the Caribbean coast. It is a beautiful relaxing location to get away from the hectic tourist areas further north. When we visited the water was crystal clear and perfect for swimming in. From town, you can swim from the balneario municipal at the end of Calle 14, which is free to the public. There is a pier and small covered platform where you can leave your clothes and jump in. Kayaking on the lake is also worthwhile - you can rent kayaks from the other balneario (\'Magico\') at the other end of town, which is 10 pesos to get in and 100  pesos per hour for a two person kayak.

333587265.name: Magic even in the rain...
333587265.author: a TripAdvisor user
333587265.reviewBody: so I can only imagine how beautiful it is on a sunny day. Definitely go out in a kayak or go for a swim. The water was so clear.

333337644.name: Beautoful
333337644.author: a TripAdvisor user
333337644.reviewBody: I loved the lagoon and completely recommend it. If you are travelling on to Belize it\'s much better to visit here rather than Chetumal before.\nAlthough I felt there wasn\'t much to do in the area there is plenty to do on the lagoon - watching the sunrise and kayaking being highlights. Wear a life jacket when out on the water, we made the mistake of not bothering and swam into some trouble!

333295301.name: No comment needed
333295301.author: a TripAdvisor user
333295301.reviewBody: Beautiful lagoon, far away from the overcrowded Cancun. The water is warm and so clean! Lovely place.

330532236.name: Beautifull place
330532236.author: a TripAdvisor user
330532236.reviewBody: Beautiful, romantic, gorgeous place for different activities. Clear fresh water for swimming, fishing, water sports. Beautiful places to say around the lake.

330117267.name: Brilliant
330117267.author: a TripAdvisor user
330117267.reviewBody: Great sailing opportunities. Also wonderful swimming in crystal clear water with wonderful white sand - mostly very shallow.

328840906.name: Accessed from green monkey
328840906.author: a TripAdvisor user
328840906.reviewBody: Beautiful and great to catch a sunrise to put online to make people jealous. Only real attraction in bacalar!

326826717.name: the best lake in the world
326826717.author: a TripAdvisor user
326826717.reviewBody: This lake is breathtaking the only way to get a full view and the best experience is to take a boat tour highly recommended it. It\'s a 2 hour drive from Tulum but it\'s totally worth it. The lake has three Cenotes you can clearly see them from a boat and they are pretty amazing.

326126183.name: Boating on Lake Bacalar
326126183.author: a TripAdvisor user
326126183.reviewBody: Absolutely breathtakingly beautiful!.  If you are in the area drive, bus or take a tour - just get there it is worth it.   A perfect place to relax in fresh water with water and sand the color of the Caribbean. Our boat passed several deep cenotes, including Cenote de la Bruja and Cenote Negro.   To read about our boat ride tour with the Explorean Kohunlich Resort search TravelingMartinezes Bacalar.

326070773.name: One of the most beautiful lakes in the world
326070773.author: a TripAdvisor user
326070773.reviewBody: This is one of the most beautiful lakes in the world.  It is called the lake of 7 colors because it is blue, green, light turquoise, dark turquoise,etc... an amazing everchanging spectra of colors.  With the blue sky, gorgeous sun rises,  and beautiful carribean sun it is an amazing place to visit.  The lake is fresh water, and warm all year.  Always easy to jump in. It feels like velvet.

325565914.name: Beautiful and peaceful under dramatic skies
325565914.author: a TripAdvisor user
325565914.reviewBody: Bacalar is a small lakeshore town with interesting history, a good small museum in an old Spanish fort, plenty of good restaurants and cafes, fantastic swimming in the super deep cenotes, a wide range of accommodations, lots of water sports options, and superior birding on and around the lake. The only downside is high humidity, but a dive in a cenote is a quick fix.

324839017.name: A gem
324839017.author: a TripAdvisor user
324839017.reviewBody: The lake is truly amazing. We got some thunderstorms but still great place to chill. Rented a double kayak and just paddled the shore. Lots of birds and wildlife. Stayed at Yaxche hostal camping and had a wonderfull time. Also had couple nice meals at cocina economica mexicana, two blocks south from zocalo.

323521704.name: Laguna de Bacalar lo mejor para descansar
323521704.author: a TripAdvisor user
323521704.reviewBody: Visit Bacalar is perfect for rest or tourism activities snorkel nature , canopy , sailing or know his seven cenotes only reserch good agency

323234081.name: Paradise
323234081.author: a TripAdvisor user
323234081.reviewBody: I found my own Bora Bora in Bacalar. \nThe lake is breathtaking!  Everyday the water coulour changed. From morning being one color to afternoon changing to another colour. Pefect for swimming, kayaking, stand up paddle board or just soaking in the view. If you\'re aftera slice of Paradise - look no futher! Bacalar !\n

321928896.name: great place for a get away
321928896.author: a TripAdvisor user
321928896.reviewBody: I am visiting Bacalr for 20 years not for long weekends to get away or passing through on a trip to Belize or Guatemala. Love it !!

321215069.name: Nice view ! awesome to dip in !
321215069.author: a TripAdvisor user
321215069.reviewBody: Stay at Green monkey in your on a budget but still want the awesome view. Great chilled out atmosphere

319442590.name: Truly 7 colors of Magic..
319442590.author: a TripAdvisor user
319442590.reviewBody: The best spot in the Yucatan, no seaweed, fresh water and cenotes on the lake. Great food at El Barril, one of the best margaritas ever and cheap, El Pato de Perro is a great hostel for low cost hospitality, Amirs Bacalar Boat tours are world known for good reason. You can book through the hostel.

318236619.name: Just WOW!
318236619.author: a TripAdvisor user
318236619.reviewBody: The Laguna de Bacalar is really worth a trip. I have never seen a more beautiful fresh water lake than this one - especially when the sun is shining and the water turns all sorts of colors. You can wade out into the water pretty far before it gets deep or explore the lake by kayak or paddle boat. There are also some nice cenotes to look at.

315203369.name: Must do!
315203369.author: a TripAdvisor user
315203369.reviewBody: The difficulty here is that you need a guide with access to a boat - but boy is it worth it!  There are several cenotes in the lake and your guide can take you to see them.  Ask to swim and snorkel.  The water is magnificent - changing colors with depth.  We enjoyed a sunset tour and watched the birds come to an island on the lake to roost for the night.  I\'ve never seen anything quite like it!

315085689.name: Peaceful
315085689.author: a TripAdvisor user
315085689.reviewBody: Lovely peaceful lake. Not much to do. Went for a swim and the local police told us to turn back and go closer to the shore.

314835968.name: Amazing tour with Amir
314835968.author: a TripAdvisor user
314835968.reviewBody: We joined a small group on a boat with instructor Amir. The tour included a boat ride to an amazing place near the channel to Chetumal bay. Shallow water and fun and games. Amir provided plenty of beers, tequila and snacks. We spent 1 hour in the shallow water which was amazing. Later we went to a place called black cenote which was nice to float with life jackets. Finally we spent some more time in the water. The tour is more like a pleasure cruise. The Lagoona Bakalar is so beautiful and special it really doesn\'t matter what you do. The whole trip was 3 hours. Highly recommend, if you can get in touch with Amir.

314323944.name: Incredibly Beautiful Lake Bacalar
314323944.author: a TripAdvisor user
314323944.reviewBody: Peaceful energies soothe the soul in the alkaline water of Largo Bacalar, lake of seven colors, fed from limestone under the Yucatan and Quintana Roo regions of Mexico.

313311738.name: Paradise. Period.
313311738.author: a TripAdvisor user
313311738.reviewBody: Fresh water, amazing shades of blue and emerald. Close to many mayan sites, lush vegetation. Small town, small market with big flavors.\nGo disconnect yourself.

308756505.name: Paradise on earth.
308756505.author: a TripAdvisor user
308756505.reviewBody: Awesome view, the color its amazing, and the water are extremely clear. If you want a really relaxing vacations, this is the place. The only thing you can do in Bacalar is rest.

307245412.name: Amazing Fresh Water Lake
307245412.author: a TripAdvisor user
307245412.reviewBody:
A really amazing place and well worth the effort to get there.

Taking a boat trip on the lake MXN 200-400 per person.

The lake is freshwater, mainly shallow and sandy.

The area attracts independent travellers and has a bohemian feel

306764309.name: Amazing Laguna in Southern Mexican Caribbean
306764309.author: a TripAdvisor user
306764309.reviewBody: If you go to holiday in Quintana Roo, you cannot miss these amazing place. Leave parties in Cancun and Playa del Carmen and go chill out for some days here. Water is one of the best I ever seen in my life, the place is cheap, there are beautiful cenotes around. Definetly worth to spend 3-hours bus from Playa del Carmen to stay 2 days.

304885621.name: Must to visit
304885621.author: a TripAdvisor user
304885621.reviewBody: Just a beautiful natural place to not to miss when visiting riviera maya, denotes inside the lake make him have different blue tones, must to visit!

301198705.name: Bacalar is magic
301198705.author: a TripAdvisor user
301198705.reviewBody: this is a magical site, a lake , filled with crystal clear cenote water and white sands, the effect, beautiful colors and a paradise destination for swimmers and nature lovers. It is a shame that the main town and the boat excursions are not clean and pretty much overrated

301145695.name: Dont come here, unless you want perfection and you will take care of nature
301145695.author: a TripAdvisor user
301145695.reviewBody: Best place in Mexico! Forget about the Riviera, well actually dont, otherwise this will get crowded and dirty and ruined just like the Riviera did.
